[AmsterdamData Scientist

Working at the essence of understanding consumers: transforming data into shiny top-notch experiences

As a Data Scientist at Talpa Network, you will create AI solutions that impact million of users. This job is for a Data Scientist who is ready to unlock the potential of vast amounts of complex rich data and create first-class personalised consumer experiences for Talpa products like Kijk.nl, Voetbal.tv and Radio 538.
As part of our new AI team, you participate in AI projects from scratch, building machine learning models that will be put in production in one of our products. You will also work on automated testing and validation of the model’s output using technical and business metrics.
FULL-TIME · AMSTERDAM
Your typical day at Talpa Network
The day starts with strong espresso and a deep dive in Jupyter notebooks using Spark and the PyData Stack in a JupyterHub EMR cluster in AWS.
After taking a quick look at the Jira board, you go to a brainstorm session to discuss new features and modelling approaches for problems like recommendation engines, entity extraction, image tagging, etc.
Then, together with the Machine Learning Engineer you create robust code in a python package to train and deploy your models.
It’s time for lunch, and together with the team you hit the shores of the IJ harbour to grab some food and have some fun.
On the way back you feel good about the value you are bringing to Talpa consumers and open a mobile app to see your machine learning model in action.
A hands-on session with the Lead AI to improve your level is up next.
The afternoon you spend getting your hands dirty implementing those new modelling ideas to improve that recommendation engine or speech-to-text model.
On your way home you think about how to implement a specific metric, data split and loss function that will test your model according to the use case.

Our Technology Stack
Python data stack: Pandas, Scikit-learn, NumPy, Scipy, Matplotlib, Nltk, Xgboost, Lightgbm, Seaborn, Jupyter
Python virtual environments
Solid programming skills: OOP, FP, algorithms, unit testing, data structures
Basic knowledge of Spark
Basic knowledge of the command line

Nice to haves:
Deep Learning tech stack: Keras, PyTorch or TensorFlow
Cloud experience, preferably AWS
Bayesian models
Streaming algorithms
Spark ML

A remarkable Technology Team

You are welcome in our recently created AI team based in our buzzing office in Amsterdam, near the ‘Muziekgebouw aan ‘t IJ’. An energetic and creative bunch, we, the platform team, the engineering team and the AI team, are tech-experts that share best practices on how to build something that works. Communication with each other and departments like Legal, DevOps and Cybersecurity, is effective and fast, in order to get to a solution ASAP.

What we offer
An environment where your work is extremely valuable and will impact millions of users.
A location in the middle of Amsterdam with benefits like meetups, conferences and events.
A competitive salary.
A good architecture where responsibilities are clear, and every component works together to create value by taking AI solutions to production.
Dedicated time to contribute to open-source projects related to your daily work.
A budget for your personal development and guidance from the Lead of AI.
Getting access to our cool events like 538 King’s Day, 538 DJ Hotel, Das Coen und Sander Fest and Waylon Live in concert.

You are a quality-oriented Data Scientist with:
At least 2 years of experience;
Advanced knowledge of statistics;
Advanced knowledge of traditional Machine Learning;
Basic knowledge of Deep Learning;
Experience in building models for production;]

[AmsterdamGeneral
The Advanced Analytics Center of Expertise (AAD CoE) is a comprehensive data & analytics department part of Customer and Digital Experience in ABN AMRO Retail Banking. At this place people work on the successful banking app, but also Grip and Tikkie. Here you find our e-Commerce teams and our colleagues of ‘Video Banking’. In short, within Customer & Digital Experience the online platforms are being created and built that offer all the digital products of ABN AMRO Retail. All of these developments and products are powered by the data & analytics of the Advanced Analytics & Data CoE.

We strongly believe that online banking should be easier, faster, more delightful, and more personal to create sustainable long-term relationships with our customers. We develop suitable solutions that give our customers greater financial control. With a vast amount of data at hand, together with our unique usability lab as test-station we build digital services in an agile way that surprise customers and help them move forward.

At Customer & Digital Experience you get the freedom and responsibility to improve our products & services. In other words, we encourage you to release your creativity and put it into practice. The environment is similar to a start-up atmosphere, so feel free to wear your sneakers.

We are currently seeking a high caliber professional to join our CoE as Data Scientist. He/she will be responsible for applying advanced statistical analysis tools and ML techniques for different type of business challenges e.g., expenses forecasting, customer segmentation, customer targeting, product bundling, recommendations, text mining, predictive routing etc.
The job
Your job as a data scientist will be:
Collaborate with other data scientists and data consultants to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test.
Understand business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions.
Coordinate with the Business and Grids (similar to Spotify Tribes), data consultants, IT and data engineers to deliver end to end Analytical solutions.
Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the ABN AMRO organization.
Regularly test and maintain analytical models to improve efficiency and keep up with changing Business needs, ensuring timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time.
Write reports articulating the analytics insights and their Business impacts.
Conduct and lead meetings and workshops to explain findings.
Support data consultants in communicating the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions developed.
Profile
5+ years of experience in Data Science, specifically building predictive models using ML techniques.
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Data Science or other relevant degree. Masters or other advanced degrees are a plus.
Experience with object-oriented design, coding and testing, engineering Data Science/ML platforms.
Proficiency in programming languages e.g., SQL and Python or R and experience in big data technologies e.g., Hadoop, Spark.
Comfort in using SQL Server, PostgreSQL/MySQL, experience in tools based on Git or SVN and working knowledge of cloud computing platforms e.g., Microsoft Azure and AWS.
Proficiency in aggregation of large data sets, statistical analysis tools.
Expert knowledge of data modeling and understanding of different data structures.
Understanding of advanced applied mathematics in AA, artificial intelligence and array operations.
Experience in Banking and/or e-Commerce is a plus.
What we offer
We are offering

The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
A salary ranging from EUR 3.862-, to EUR 6.308-, per month based on a 36-hour workweek
A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
An annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on the function
A solid pension plan
Additional information
This role will be located in Amsterdam. Should you want to know more about this job opening, please reach out to Alexandra Caraghiulea alexandra.caraghiulea@nl.abnamro.com or Hicham Zmarrou hicham.zmarrou@nl.abnamro.com. We very much look forward meeting you.]

[AmsterdamData Science is the heart and core of our company. Algorithms and models are the foundation upon which our products are built, with data driving our key decisions, testing and growth. At Perengo (TMP), we are developing state-of-the-art large-scale recruitment advertising and machine learning applications. We are looking for talented data scientists to support ads management and optimization problems. In this role you will work with other data scientists, engineers, and product managers on high impact initiatives.
About Us
Perengo (TMP) is a programmatic job advertising platform.
We automate job distribution, measure / analyze performance in real time, and optimize towards our customer’s primary KPIs including cost-per-application and cost-per-hire.
Why Join Us?
Getting in at this stage means that you get to actually help further mold the company culture and engineering vision
A chance to build something revolutionary
The market is ripe for disruption and there's no doubt that whoever cracks the puzzle will win the market. This is also a rare opportunity for you to build a large-scale platform that millions of people are positively impacted by (instead of, say, boring old enterprise software that few people touch!).
Quality of the Team - Truly high-performing teams are hard to come by; joining Perengo gives you an opportunity to collaborate with, learn from, and grow together with like-minded, successful tech veterans who have a track record of building great products.
Who we are looking for:
Personality
Knows and loves the startup world
Quick thinking and acting with minimal/no supervision
Able to build enterprise-grade software off of minimal and changing requirements
Self-driven, independent, creative and eager to learn new skills
Aren't happy with good, and build to great
Role
Building machine learning models to optimize campaign performance at massive scale, in particular understanding how bids/campaign features/texts (SEM) influence business metrics
Run and analyze A/B tests and experiments for campaign feature changes/addition
Exploratory analyses to inform business strategies; identifying, creating, and transforming informative features based on historical and real-time data
Working with Product to define data collection and modeling frameworks
Coordinating and working closely with engineering to put models and algorithms into production
Requirements and Background
Deep understanding of machine learning models (supervised/unsupervised/neural network) and the best use cases for them; NLP related tasks highly desirable.
Knowledge in inferential statistics (classical/Bayesian), hypothesis-testing
Experience in optimization (multivariable optimization with constraints, combinatorics)
Experience building models and placing models into production
Well versed in statistical programming languages such as R, Python
Familiarity with relational databases such as Postgres and Amazon Redshift, and accessing data via SQL
Degree in a quantitative field including but not limited to: computer science/engineering, operations research, decision sciences, discrete mathematics
Graduate work in machine learning a plus, or relevant work experience
Bonuses: Experience using scalable technology such as Spark, Using Markov chains/simulations, Experience in advertising “Ad Tech”
Related Roles
Growth Scientist
Data Scientist, Advertising
Machine Learning Engineer, Ad Platforms

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.]

[AmsterdamWe’re looking for a social and technical (medior/senior) Data Scientist who has experience with Computer Vision. Are you interested in working for a Big Data Start-up with a team of around a dozen of Data Scientists? Then our company might be for you!

The position
As a Data Scientist within Xomnia you will be responsible for one or multiple projects for different and diverse clients. You will also share your expert knowledge during our training sessions and when guiding our trainees. Of course, you won’t be doing this alone! You will have a strong team by your side.

Because of the activities, you will be performing, it is important that you also enjoy daily interaction with your colleagues, clients, partners and other stakeholders. You will have a medior /senior Data Scientist position within Xomnia. Experience is therefore very important. Just graduated? Our Data Science Traineeship might be better suited. Most Data Scientists (MSc or PhD) within Xomnia have an Artificial Intelligence background and know their way around R, and Python. If you have a similar experience but within a different education or toolkit, we are also very interested in getting in touch!

About Xomnia
Xomnia is the leading Dutch big data company that empowers organizations to create maximum value out of data. We excel in generating value from data by developing, integrating and maintaining your big data platforms and predictive solutions. Xomnia’s big data training programs enable and further develop the data-driven capabilities of your own employees. We deliver long term data science and big data engineering capacity through our traineeships. When in need of a temporary capacity boost, we share our experienced big data experts with you. In Xomnia you will find the full-service big data partner to realize your data-driven ambitions. Last but not least our company is located at a unique and cozy location in the city center of Amsterdam. Oh and we have a boat. Every Friday afternoon we have drinks in our office and in the summer on our boat.

Interested in joining us as a Data Scientist? Get in touch and apply.

Do you need personal advice?
Please email Aniek for more information
 Aniek@xomnia.com]

[AmsterdamPicnic is an app-only supermarket. We're data driven with software at our core. Our world-class developers write immaculate code to support the world's fastest growing supermarket. We're on a quest for like-minded people to be part of the future of digital grocery shopping.

--------------------------
Where you fit in
--------------------------

As one of our Data Scientists, you work on creating automated systems to solve everyday problems by using data at scale. You don't stop after the prototype is done - you productionize it.

In a collaborative environment, you work with different people to identify issues and strategies. With the Growth team, you build a model that tells us how much orders we can expect in a day, week or month, so that our operations can grow accordingly. Together with Customer Success, you construct a system to classify and label issue types in the messages we receive from our customers. You are more than a model builder: you're an internal consultant, and your expertise and input are valued right from the start.

You might think – 'I like the sound of it, but 80% of my job is going to be cleaning data'. Not here. Our data is registered, logged, consistent...immaculate. There's no wasting time. You can immediately start writing prototypes and make an impact on the future of in-app grocery shopping.

We don't hide our developments. We open-source with the community that helped us grow. If you require more motivation to apply - check out our page: http://picnic.tech ( http://picnic.tech/ )

-----------------------------------
What challenges await you
-----------------------------------


Projects in various fields, such as:
Generating useful in-app grocery suggestions for our customers
Forecasting order volumes & article demand, used Picnic-wide
Predicting delivery drop-off times for our distribution
Categorizing and labeling Customer Success tickets
Speccing projects with business stakeholders
Creating prototypes, validating results and productionizing them on our Kubernetes cluster
Owning your projects: helping end users interpret the results, determining next steps, et cetera

------------------------------
Who you are
------------------------------


Master's degree or higher in AI, Computer Science or Mathematics
At least two years of experience in Data Science / Machine Learning
Superb communication with all kinds of colleagues:
Comfortable with taking responsibility and working independently at times
Solid Python and SQL programming skills
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and CI is a pre
Out-of-the-box thinking and initiative: Hands-on, nothing-is-impossible mindset
Quality control: Commitment to excellence, performance, and efficiency

----------------------------------------------------
‍ Technologies we use
----------------------------------------------------


Python (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, aiohttp - or we build our own packages)
SQL (Snowflake)
Git
Tableau

[AmsterdamJob Description

Following its considerable success in India, OYO in now looking to transform the European hospitality landscape by building a network of hotels, guest homes and holiday residences across the continent. As part of our ambitious expansion plans we are hiring Data Scientist across Europe. Working with the local business teams and supported by our new Technology Center in Amsterdam, you will be responsible for conceiving, building and supporting the products and services we need to make OYO successful in Europe. This is an exciting opportunity for an ambitious, entrepreneurial, energetic and experienced Data Scientist who believes in the OYO mission and puts the customer first!
What we’re looking for
The Data Scientist will help the team with building automated algorithms, the end to end data products and business insights generations. The role requires both high technical aptitude and problem-solving abilities, motivation, intellectual curiosity, and a passion for data discovery.
The Data Science team is a high profile team that is a center of innovation for the company and a major contributor to the company’s products and business.
Responsibilties
Closely working with the core team to design algorithms for new IP product and services
Conduct advanced statistical analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance
Develop new technological ways for solving high-end problems with data science & analytics
Designs experiments, test hypotheses and build models
Works with different stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome
Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms

Qualifications

Extensive background in data mining and statistical analysis
Able to understand and various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Deep understanding of statistical modeling (Regression, Clustering, Decision trees), machine learning, algorithms, data mining concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods.
Experience with deep learning, SVM, k-nearest neighbors, random forests, ensemble methods, Logistic Regression, Probability Theory, Bayesian/Markov networks etc.
Demonstrated programming skills in relevant languages, including R, Python, SQL etc.
Optional Skills: Spark, Hive, Pig, d3, Ruby
Graduate degree in computer science, operations research, statistics, physics, or mathematics is preferable
2+ years of related work experience
Great communication skills
Additional Information

OYO Acquires Leisure Group
OYO Vacation Homes Re-brands
Techcrunch Announcement
OYO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. OYO does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.]

Excellent statistical and mathematical skills and ready to make the difference in this new function?
What's your job?
As a Data Scientist you will be part of a the Data Scientist Team, a competence service function within Reporting & Analytics. You will be responsible for promoting and applying advanced analytics (AA) techniques within the Commercial organisation. AA requires the simultaneous application of statistics, computer programming and operations research for discovering data patterns, understanding correlations, and making predictions. As a Data Scientist in the commercial department you will be combining all in various areas. You will have close contact with Sales, Business Planning & Supply Chain and Outbound Logistics.
In this role your data-driven approaches will have a direct impact on the decision making in all of these areas.
Responsibilities:
Scoping and targeting AA application to realise business value
Developing AA models in Python, R, or other
Exploring data for correlations using tools like Spotfire
Training models with data and testing their performance
Visualising the outcomes of AA and interpreting the results
Running AA models regularly for business decision making
Building and expanding deep expertise in AA techniques
Supporting capability development on AA application in the organisation
Cooperating with external AA partners within and outside of the organisation
Is this you?
Education at Masters level
Excellent statistical and mathematical skills
Data modelling competence
Analytical tool expertise (R, Python, Spotfire, etc.)
Affinity with Machine Learning techniques and tools (PyCharm, Keras, xgboost, etc.)
Social skills to promote the application of AA in all Commercial functions
Communication skills to present the solutions and engage with decision makers
What do we offer?
One-year contract with the possibility to permanent.
A wide range of development and growth opportunities within Tata Steel.
Very interesting secondary terms such as a variable profit sharing and a fixed end-of-year bonus of 2% and 8% holiday allowance.
A minimum of 37 vacation days.
Excellent benefits including a beneficial pension scheme.
A salary that depends on your education and experience up to € 5.500,- gross per month.
Flexible working hours and a good work/life balance.
A role in which you can be a company expert by bringing forth technological insights based on detailed research analyses. These insights are utilized in innovative process and product development projects.
What's your department?
Reporting & Analytics (R&A) is a new function within Tata Steel Europe, driving the digitalisation with new tools and technologies and the application of big data and advanced analytics in the Commercial organisation. The function is critical for improving the supply chain performance, optimising the stock position, directing sales and customer service, and supporting marketing through a step change in the understanding of performance drivers and the application of leading-edge technologies.
R&A comprises of teams in the following functional areas, ensuring data consistency across Tata Steel Europe, supporting the growing needs for data management and analytics, as well as supporting Commercial steering:
Information management, data governance and master data management
Data engineering and reporting
Advanced analytics and data science
Business process management with Anaplan
Reporting and analytics development
The capabilities of R&A are a source of competitive advantage for Tata Steel Europe now and in the future.

[AmsterdamOnbepaalde tijdPMI is building a smoke-free future. This is your chance to be part of the biggest transformation in the history of our company.

The transformation touches every part of our business. Our products. The relationships we have with our customers. The partnerships we build. The messages we communicate. The technology we employ. And, every step of the way, data has a key part to play, making this an ideal time to join us.

We are seeking an Enterprise Data Scientist to join us in our central office in Amsterdam.
Together, we share a very exciting professional outlook. We invent and implement algorithms, we design and build analytical pipelines – all with leveraging from domains like statistics, machine learning, information and graph theory, data mining, optimization, network analysis etc. We work in international teams with huge cultural diversity and we interact not only with other fellow data scientists, but also with data engineers, DevOps, business owners, data architects, security and privacy experts, etc. We mostly write our analytical code in Python, but we're not afraid of R, Java and even Scala. Last but not least, we are strong supporters of Open Source.

Are you ready to crunch any data to generate business value? Are you fluent in Python and do you know what is necessary to produce high quality code for analytics? Do you know when to use ANOVA and when to use Kruskal-Wallis test? Have you been working in a multidisciplinary environment using agile methodology? With this skillset, you are an ideal fit for our Enterprise Analytics and Data department and we would like to hear from you!

You will mainly be:
Responsible of exploring exciting data science use cases and bringing them all the way to industrialized productsIn close collaboration with our various business stakeholders to answer their hungry needs of data-driven decisionsA solid pillar of our great team of data scientists, interacting closely with our data engineers, scrum master and product owners.

[Postcode 1017 in Amsterdam CentrumData Scientist


We are a fast-growing themed travel marketplace based in the heart of Amsterdam. We enable our customers to live unforgettable travel experiences via our 11 category sites from yoga retreats to safaris. Come join our ambitious and entrepreneurial international team!


As a Data Scientist at Tripaneer, you love using data to find areas of improvement which enable the business to grow. At Tripaneer, you will be responsible for guiding and supporting the team with data, reports and models, specifically our Marketing department. As we have a strong focus on growth, your analysis and models will need to be pragmatic and geared to the current focus of the company. You will work on generating new datasets and perform analysis from operational to managerial level. Additionally, you work on pragmatic algorithmic solutions to support the Marketing department in meeting their growth objectives.

Facilitate a data-driven culture (Eg: by presenting your analyses, finding areas for improvement in data and explaining those, empowering stakeholders to find and explore their own data, etc.)

Young, enthusiastic, international working environment
Tech-hub office located in the center of Amsterdam
Opportunity to make an impact in a fast-growing tech scaleup
Subsidized catered lunch
25 days holiday
Regular social activities and trips

[AmsterdamAre you a Data Scientist who is keen on using Natural Language Processing (NLP) in products that support thousands of researchers as well as universities and funding organizations? Are you familiar with large data processing frameworks like Apache Spark, and are you eager to work with large high-quality textual datasets? We have the right opportunity for you!

Introduction
Research Products is looking for a Data Scientist specialized in Natural Language Processing (NLP) to work collaboratively on text processing and classification capabilities that support new and existing customer-facing products such as Pure (indexing and classification), SciVal (discovery), and Funding Institutional (classification).

Role
You will be working in the NLP team in Research Products, which is responsible for text processing functionalities such as concept mining (indexing) and text classification for scientific article text. Many of such functionalities are delivered through Elsevier's Fingerprint Engine (FPE), a text mining toolkit with capabilities such as tagging, classification, discovery and reporting. The new position would involve development of NLP-based product features, support to other teams and products that rely on the text analysis capabilities, and data science activities in which applying NLP to the large datasets Elsevier has available play an important role. These activities include the improvement and development of semantic based matching algorithms and text classifiers.
The data scientist is expected to have the methodological skills and experience to employ various NLP techniques and to organize and wrangle large datasets from different sources for the purpose of information extraction, classification, matching/ranking, and linking. The data scientist is a member of the NLP team and works in cooperation with other teams in Research Products, such as the SciVal Content, Funding, Data, Core Recommenders, and Analytics teams.
What you should bring
MSc (or PhD) degree in Computer Science, Data Science, NLP or Computational Linguistics
3+ years of industry experience, involving NLP-focused (software) development
A proactive team player that can tackle most task independently
Solid data science skills, shown by experience and delivered projects
Experience with common NLP techniques and tooling, and machine learning
Experience with handling large textual datasets and big data platforms such as Apache Spark
Familiarity with relational databases (SQL), and experience with NoSQL databases is welcome
Demonstrable experience in programming, ideally with Java, Scala, or C#/++
Experience working in a software development team]

[AmsterdamLocation: Amsterdam (Netherlands) Education level: PhD

uniQure is dedicated to bring innovative therapies or unmet medical needs to patients. In doing so each function in uniQure is directly or indirectly responsible for the lives of patients. This responsibility should be part of our day-to-day working life by (i) living up to high quality standards and (ii) by recognizing the sense of urgency in areas of high medical need.

We are looking for a highly motivated and inquisitive Scientist. The position will focus on the Research and Development of novel gene therapy approaches designed to treat genetic diseases; starting in the third quarter 2019.

The Research and Development has several functions and responsibilities: including proof-of-mechanism and proof-of-concept studies, as well as the identification of therapeutic target leads and immunological testing. The group is a major contributor to the Research and Development activities of uniQure’s AAV-based gene therapy platform, and a key value generator.

The Scientist support Intellectual Property (IP) activities, whilst also having a broader scientific support role. The Scientist will additionally be involved in the research and development of novel gene therapies for genetic diseases under the supervision of the Director PKPD. The Scientist will also research, explore, analyse and validate AAV vectors for gene and small RNA-molecule delivery by use of in vitro and in vivo experiments. The Scientist will support the Director PKPD and he/she is involved in initiating new therapeutic leads, practical laboratory work, partly organising the work of technicians, experimental planning, data analyses and writing reports. The Scientist will participate in the discussion of new and ongoing projects, support the coordination and delegation of the research to other departments and institutions.

Job Objectives and Responsibilities

Provide wider scientific support within the department, e. intellectual property (IP) and additional support, such as competitive intelligence analyses
When necessary can participate directly in experimental work planned by the Director of PKPD, and/or other key team members
It is expected the role will entail approximately1/3rd lab-based work and 2/3rds scientific support functions
Brings up his/her ideas regarding the line of research and, upon mutual agreement, implements the new ideas and concepts, disseminates and reports the results
Plans his/her own work under supervision of the Director, sets priorities and timelines and adheres to these timelines
Is quality orientated (e. detail and data critical) and he/she evaluates his/her own behavior and corrects him/herself if needed. He/she proposes ways to improve quality and throughput
Efficiently disseminates scientific and other data to multiple internal stakeholders
Writes data reports and peer reviewed material for internal and external purposes
Updates project proposals

Core Competencies

Relevant affinity with wider scientific support, with a key interest in translational research, and the ability to clearly and accurately disseminate information from various sources, g. peer review and patent publications and other material
PhD, (translational) molecular cell biology, virology or related topic
In depth and preferably hands on knowledge of relevant molecular biological techniques ((cloning, plasmid purification and analysis, DNA and RNA isolation, PCR, qPCR, Western blotting, ELISA, cell-based biological assays (g. Luciferase))
Good scientific knowledge in the field of genetic metabolic diseases and gene regulation
Able to act in a fast changing and demanding environment, willing and able to demonstrate a hands-on attitude and the delivery and execution of pragmatic and solution driven approaches
Enthusiastic, able to support other departments with information practical work
Plans his/her own work with supervision of the Director
Eye for, and attention to detail, with an overview and planning vision
Able to communicate in a clear and concise manner, think through complex problems, express position in a structured manner and provide pragmatic solutions
Excellent knowledge of the English language (verbal, written and scientific)
Pro-active attitude, flexible and professional

Additional Competencies

Intellectual property, g. searches, review, etc, writing,
Scientific experience and interest in the area of virology, RNAi and metabolic diseases
Solution driven and goal directed
Adapts new information and ideas and applies this effectively to his/her own work.
Pro-active attitude, flexible and professional
Proven ability to work in a cross-functional environment
Able to move seamlessly to move projects forward with both internal and external stakeholders

Contract conditions

The contract is for an indefinite period, but only following a suitable trail period.]

[AmsterdamBackground
With the increasing attention on Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti Money Laundering (AML) and the development of complex models using data science techniques, ING is setting up a new validation team. As a start, this team will focus on compliance models used for KYC and AML globally. The KYC / AML models are designed to identify and detect patterns that are amongst others related to customer’s behaviour, activities and transactions. This team will help ING to further mitigate the risk of financial and economic crime. In the future, the scope of the team will be expanded to other data science areas as applied within ING.
ING’s Model Risk Management team is an energetic international team of highly qualified professionals. Currently, the Model Risk Management team exist of two validation tribes (Credit Risk and Market & Other Risks) and the Model Risk Oversight (MRO) tribe. The new data science validation team will start as squad in the MRO tribe.
The key objectives of the new consist of:
assuring the models are reliable, “fit for purpose”, perform adequately and are compliant with internal policies and evolving external regulations;
increasing the understanding of a model’s limitations and weaknesses; and
continuously improving the data science validation framework.
Your Responsibilities
As a model validator, your key responsibilities include:
Technical review of the models assessing the conceptual soundness and developmental evidence of a model, as well as compliance with regulations and internal policies by performing quantitative analyses and independent testing;
Writing detailed validation reports, including a model risk assessment and a description of the validation findings;
Interact with stakeholders including model developers, senior management, ECB and other regulators, and internal & external audit;
Keep track of new developments in data science and applicable regulation; and
Contribute to the continuous improvement of methodologies, standards and automation.
Profile
We look for a colleague with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and knack for always being a step ahead. You strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions.
You have a PhD or MSc degree in Mathematics, Physics, Econometrics, Quantitative Finance, Data Science or related field;
You have at least 3 years of experience in model validation or model risk management;
You have a passion for data science as applied in the banking sector; and
You are willing to travel.
What do we offer
A market conform salary (depending on relevant knowledge and experience).
A 40h (or 36h) working week.
A 13th month.
A public transport ticket for the Netherlands
Contribution to individual savings
Possibilities for training
An empowering culture & future career opportunities within ING]

Job_Title: Data Scientist Business Intelligence Personal Banking
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamBinnen ABN AMRO Retail vormt het Center of Expertise Business Intelligence (CoE BI) het kenniscentrum voor BI, data en analytics voor Personal Banking (PeBa) en het Contact Center (CC).

CoE BI is het eerste aanspreekpunt voor alle data gerelateerde vraagstukken en rapportages binnen PeBa. Hierbij kan je denken aan het verzorgen van inzichten in de voortgang op de gestelde doelen van PeBa - op verschillende management niveaus. Ook maken we kleine ad-hoc inzichten beschikbaar voor onze stakeholders.

Onze stakeholders zijn meer en meer gebaat bij inzicht in waarom iets gebeurt, naast inzicht in wat er gebeurt. Daarom zijn wij onze werkzaamheden aan het uitbreiden met het maken van diepere analyses. Samen met ons ga je hier vorm en invulling aan geven vanuit jouw expertise en ervaring. Binnen PeBa hebben we veel (klant)data tot onze beschikking, hier willen we meer en beter gebruik van maken.
Je werk
Samen met de belangrijkste stakeholders breng je de wens en problematiek scherp in kaart. Bij het scherpstellen van deze behoefte heb je de context waarin de vraag wordt gesteld helder voor ogen om rekening te houden met zowel proces, product, mens en technologie. Op deze manier ben je in staat de probleemstelling op een juiste manier te identificeren en te wegen. Je vertaalt de wens vervolgens naar concrete onderzoeksvragen die je gekwantificeerd onderzoekt. Hierbij ben je zelf verantwoordelijk voor zowel de ETL, analyse, visualisatie en communicatie. De analyse vertaal je naar concrete vervolg acties om zo de business een stap vooruit te helpen. Hiermee stel je hen in staat om tot fact-based besluitvorming te komen, op basis waarvan de doelstellingen gerealiseerd en overtroffen kunnen worden.
Je werkomgeving
CoE BI is een van de afdelingen binnen de afdeling Business Consulting & Culture (BC&C) van Personal Banking. BC&C ondersteund de medewerkers in het kantoren netwerk van ABN. Binnen het CoE BI zal je terecht komen in een klein team met veel eigen verantwoordelijkheden en vrijheid. Dit stelt jou in staat om verschillende zaken zelf op te pakken en jezelf op deze wijze verder te ontwikkelen in het analisten vak. Je kunt jezelf verder ontwikkelen in het analisten vak. Je wordt niet alleen gevraagd complexe analytische vraagstukken uit te werken, maar hier vooral je eigen ideeën op los te laten. Vanuit je expertise en ervaring met kwantitatieve vraagstukken geef je een extra versnelling aan de PeBa wens om meer kwantitatieve analyses te maken om de business (strategisch) te versterken.
Je profiel
Je bent een vakinhoudelijke ijzersterke Data Scientist met een visie op data. Je hebt uitstekende analytische skills en krijgt energie van het overtuigen van mensen op basis van data gedreven inzichten. Daarnaast weet je draagvlak te creëren voor je ideeën en adviezen.

Denk je dat je bij ons past? Check je profiel:

Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is een must;Kwantitatieve academische opleiding. (statistische invalshoek is een pre);Minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring (Consultancy ervaring is een pre);Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met kwantitatief werk op projectmatige basis;Je beheerst en hebt ervaring met zowel SQL als Python/R/Matlab;Je bent in staat om complexiteit begrijpelijk te maken en vind dit leuk om te doen;Weet inzichten goed te duiden in een grotere business context;Je hebt zelfkennis; je geeft en ontvangt opbouwende feedback.
We bieden
Wij bieden je de vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen, flexibel te werken en veel ruimte om te groeien
Wij helpen je om fit & vitaal te blijven
Een persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000 per jaar
Een OV-jaarabonnement of vervoersbudget, afhankelijk van de functie
Een goede pensioenregeling
Interesse?
Ben je geïnteresseerd? Reageer dan online op deze vacature. Voor meer informatie of een kop koffie, neem contact op met Erwin Tibben of Pjotr Abeling op +31 6 47274122 of +31 6 43497955. Wij maken graag kennis met je!]

[Postcode 1077 in Amsterdam ZuidAs a Data Analyst at Optiver you will be able to have a big impact on improving our current trading strategies through in-depth analysis of our trade data.

Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role.

More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy.]

[AmsterdamData Analytics is op zoek naar nieuwe Lead Data Scientists!Wil je onderdeel zijn van een enerverende data science reis met uitdagende projecten? Ben jij degene die van (niet-)gestructureerde data met algoritmes en data science toepassingen toegevoegde waarde kan creëren? Durf jij de uitdaging aan om met een team van data experts een vraagstuk van een klant op te lossen en te implementeren? Dan is dit jouw kans!Data Analytics – an Ortec Finance companyOnze organisatie heeft een uniek track-record op het gebied van “Advanced Analytics” en houdt zich al ruim 35 jaar bezig met het analyseren van data. Data Analytics, onderdeel van Ortec Finance, zorgt ervoor dat klanten beter inzicht krijgen in hun data en daar bedrijfsmatig hun voordeel mee kunnen doen. Data Analytics onderscheidt zich van andere aanbieders door niet alleen consultancy en opleiding te bieden, maar in het bijzonder door het daadwerkelijk oplossen van data science uitdagingen. Wij zijn in met name geïnteresseerd in de uitkomsten van de (big) data verwerking en analyses door het toepassen van de nieuwste technieken op het gebied van machine learning. Data Analytics levert zoveel mogelijk schaalbare oplossingen door gebruik te maken van bestaande platforms en infrastructuur van partijen zoals Google, Microsoft en IBM. Daarnaast maken we veelvuldig gebruik van Python, R en andere open source talen.Wat ga je doen als Lead Data Scientist?Steeds meer organisaties willen data omzetten in nieuwe diensten of processen, procesverbeteringen of willen met de data voorspellen wat het juiste aanbod is voor hun klant. Data Analytics speelt op deze behoefte in. Als Lead Data Scientist speel jij een cruciale rol in het transformatieproces van klanten door een business case op te lossen. Je helpt de juiste data te bewerken door het toepassen van statistische methoden, machine learning technieken of analytische benaderingen. Met jouw ervaring weet je het project inhoudelijk te coördineren en fungeer je als aanspreekpunt voor de klant. Vervolgens vertaal jij de uitkomsten naar waarde voor de klant.Wat maakt jou de ideale Lead Data Scientist?Deze rol vereist een HBO/WO opleiding in econometrie, business analytics, machine learning, artificial intelligence, informatiewetenschappen of aanverwante richting. Na jouw studie heb je 2-4 jaar gewerkt in data analytics, data science of machine learning.Op competentie gebied wil je de uitdaging aan gaan om klantproblemen op te lossen, word je enthousiast van data, kun je goed organiseren en communiceren met een klant, en ben je erg geïnteresseerd om nieuwe ontwikkelingen te volgen en te implementeren. Je werkt samen met proactieve, resultaatgerichte en enthousiaste collega’s en je bent bereid om veel en snel te leren. Je wordt natuurlijk begeleid in het traject om een data science expert te worden die de klant verwacht. Verder is het van belang dat je vloeiend Nederlands en Engels spreekt, je een geldig werkvisum hebt in Nederland en woonachtig bent in regio Amsterdam – Utrecht, zodat je eenvoudig kunt reizen naar klantlocaties.Daarnaast draag je bij door:Een grondige kennis van machine learning en artificial intelligence: advanced analytics, data mining, statistiek, wiskunde, natural language processing, neurale netwerken;Sterke affiniteit met technieken als R, Python of Javascript;In staat om op projectbasis in flexibele teams en op klantlocatie werkzaam te zijn;Ervaring met het verkennen, bewerken en visualiseren van data om nieuwe patronen te herkennen;Ervaring met projectbegeleiding en het liefst ervaring met werken in agile of scrum methodieken.Wat je kan verwachten van Data Analytics – een Ortec Finance organisatieMeewerken en meedenken aan innovatieve idee, oplossingen en technologieën;Een uitdagende, snel groeiende en ambitieuze (internationale) organisatie;Goede ontwikkelmogelijkheden op persoonlijk vlak, maar ook zeker op professioneel vlak;We hebben graag plezier!ArbeidsvoorwaardenWij bieden je een uitdagende en veelbelovende baan binnen een groeiende, internationale en inspirerende organisatie. Een prettige werkomgeving en veel mogelijkheden op zowel persoonlijk als professioneel gebied. We hebben een actieve personeelsvereniging die diverse activiteiten door het jaar heen organiseert! Je ontvangt een interessant en marktconform salaris, uiteraard afhankelijk van jouw opleiding en ervaring. Daarnaast bieden wij uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden:8% vakantiegeld;Een vaste 13e maand;Een interessante bonusregeling;Deelname aan de pensioenregeling;27 vakantiedagen (op fulltime basis);De mogelijkheid om ieder jaar extra dagen bij te kopen;Reiskostenvergoeding voor jouw dagelijkse km’s en een regeling voor zakelijke reizen;Een werkomgeving met enthousiaste en leuke collega’s!Meer informatie of solliciteren?Voor meer informatie over de functie kun je contact opnemen met een van onze HR collega’s via telefoonnummer 010 – 700 50 00. Ben je geïnteresseerd in deze functie, solliciteer dan via de sollicitatiebutton.We hopen je snel te ontmoeten!Soort dienstverband: FulltimeErvaring:data scientist: 3 jaar (Aanbevolen)Opleiding:Bachelor (Vereist)]

[HoofddorpReq ID: 22437
Location: Hoofddorp, NL
Category: Analysts
Opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team.
Technology
In this role you will join our Technology team. This team is Irdeto’s center of excellence for Technology Advancement, Innovation, Market Intelligence, IT and DevOps. We deliver outstanding service to our customers, both internal and external. We are dedicated to the lifecycle management of Irdeto’s products and services, and ensure our products operate flawlessly in the cloud. If you enjoy innovation, providing great support, smooth IT and Cloud processes and complicated technical challenges, you’ll love working with us.
As a Senior Data Scientist, you will design and optimize models for anomaly detection and classification and support the delivery of our data products. This is a hybrid role of data scientist and data engineer. You will implement algorithms from state-of-the-art papers, as well as deploy them in scale in production. You will be working closely with business and product leaders, developers, architects and analysts of different products across the company.
During your workday you will:
Clean and preprocess media piracy, videogames and business datasets, mostly time-series.
Train ML models, neural networks and other classifiers to detect anomalies.
Evaluate the models’ quality, conduct experiments to determine their performance on relevant business indicators.
Deploy models in production, maintain a continuous integration pipeline with monitoring and optimization of their performance.
Validate that updated models are fit for purpose, measure the variation of their behavior.
Collect results and present the improvements of the improvement actions.
Recommend the rate and collection of new attributes to enrich current datasets.
Required Knowledge & Skills:
Master in Artificial Intelligence or CS/Data Science track.
Python, pandas, scikit-learn.
Tensorflow, TFX principles using Airflow or Kubeflow.
SQL, Spark, Beam, AWS EMR, sagemaker, elasticsearch.
Kubernetes, helm, cloudformation, terraform, ansible.
Experience with open source software and version control systems
Why join Irdeto?
We are on a mission to build a secure future, where people can embrace connectivity without fear. Our lives are increasingly connected. At Irdeto, we enable people and companies to experience connectivity effortlessly by protecting them from cyber attacks. Security is the enabler of the connected world we live in. Our solutions and services ensure that you can enjoy the latest video games, the best blockbuster movies and your favorite live events. And it does not stop there; our technology also secures connected transport and IoT connected industries – just to name a few. With 50 years of expertise in security, we protect over 5 billion devices and applications for some of the world’s best-known brands.

What do we offer you?
At Irdeto, we know that it is the people who make our company a success. We encourage personal and professional growth and success among our globally diverse workforce by offering:
Competitive remuneration and benefits
Career and personal development opportunities
Flexible working spaces in state of the art offices
A focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness
Working for a truly global company with offices in 15+ countries
With 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, Irdeto is a solid company to join. We are looking for people who are energetic, dynamic and driven to be part of our community.
Welcome to Irdeto!]

Wat ga je doen?
At KLM we are increasingly becoming a data driven company where a growing number of employees rely on automated tools backed by data for decision making in the day-to-day operations as well as steering and strategic decision making for the long-term. Teams across KLM utilize cutting edge data processing technologies like Hadoop, Spark and Kafka, and techniques like machine learning and operations research to build these tools.
Working with us would mean that you are not only part of a leading international airline, that was elected as favourite employer by highly educated people in 2015, but also that you get to work in an environment that is both challenging and inspiring, with plenty of room for personal development. We find it very important that people enjoy what they do, because that brings the maximum benefit to both the company and the people themselves. Therefore, we motivate people to choose their career paths within our department and of course, as a department, we support them in achieving their goals.
As a Data Engineer you will be part of teams that build these tools and you will help them by building data pipelines, industrializing machine learning and operations research models and replacing legacy data warehousing systems with state-of-the-art data lake solutions. You will work on collecting, storing, processing, and analysing huge sets of data. You will be designing scalable and future-proof systems and working with large sets of structured and unstructured data. Close collaboration with data scientists, operations research experts and other data and software engineers in an agile way is an integral part of your work. You can also look forward to work closely with the business and co-create with gate agents, cabin personnel and other people that work in the operation.
At KLM, we're front-running and you'll work with ambitious, highly-skilled colleagues to make an impact on the aviation industry.
You will also coach your non-engineering team mates in the intricacies and best practices of data and software engineering, CI/CD, API design, and more.
Where do you land?
We are the business intelligence department within KLM. We are a team of experts who provide business intelligence solutions to different departments within KLM. We don't only specialize in traditional BI, but also take pride in calling ourselves one of the pioneering departments within KLM to work in big data technologies.
Jouw profiel
We are looking for passionate and talented Software Engineers who (aspire to) specialize in Data Engineering and for curious builders who are biased towards action, communication and are thriving in a fast-paced and international environment. We're looking for medior-senior Data Engineers.
We have found that people who match the following requirements are the ones who fit us best:
In-depth knowledge of - and experience with - the Hadoop ecosystem. For all technologies mentioned below, experience in a production environment is expected;
Real experience building production applications with Apache Spark;Real experience with Big Data processing, Big Data processing and Big Data storage;Real experience with columnar storage solutions like Apache HBase and/or Apache Cassandra; including knowledge about data modeling for columnar storage;Real experience with Apache Kafka;Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources.
Experience with 2 or more server-side programming languages, e.g. Python, Java, Scala, C++, etc. Solid background in Software Engineering:
Experience with building APIs and knowledge of REST API best practices;Knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment techniques;Proficient with automated testing;Understanding of common algorithms and data structures.
Experience with bringing (data science and/or operations research) models to production and supporting data scientists in industrializing their code;
Experience in coaching and knowledge sharing to familiarize teams with data and software engineering best practices;
Hands-on development experience, preferably in a Scrum/Agile setting;
Great communication skills, written and spoken (English) and team spirit;
Minimum of 1-3 year of experience building production-grade data processing systems as a Data Engineer.
Preferably Bachelor degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other relevant fields (less important in light of work experience) Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken). Knowledge of Dutch language is preferred.
Nice to have:
Experience with databases and SQL;Experience with Spark Streaming;Experience with Scala;Affinity with Machine Learning and/or Operations Research concepts.
Wat bieden wij?
A professional, friendly environment with a lot of interaction, where much is learned from each other;
A comprehensive package of fringe benefits including large discounts on airline tickets;
Free public transport around Schiphol and free parking at the business premises at Schiphol-Rijk;
A travel allowance;
25 vacation days and 5 extra (adv) days;
A laptop and mobile phone with voice & data plan which can also be used privately;
A good pension scheme with a substantial employer contribution;
Opportunities for personal development through training and education, including the KLM Academy;
Competitive monthly salary varying between Eur 2800-5500 depending on experience and background.
Een assessment en referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure. #KLM

[AmsterdamWij zijn op zoek naar enthousiaste Junior Data Analisten. Ben je gek op data en heb je interesse in het bouwen van innovatieve economische modellen? En wil je naast je studie een uitdagende functie bij een groeiende onderneming in Amsterdam? Dan maken we graag kennis met je!
Wat ga je doen?
Door de diversiteit aan werkzaamheden zijn wij op zoek naar iemand die niet alleen affiniteit met data heeft, maar die ook nieuwsgierig is en een brede interesse heeft. Studenten komen bij ons om ervaring op te doen, skills te ontwikkelen en mee te bouwen aan een innovatief bedrijf.

De werkzaamheden van een Junior Data Analist zijn gericht op het begrijpen, verwerken en analyseren van data. Bijvoorbeeld het verwerken van ruwe data van onze klanten, door deze te analyseren en vervolgens in een presentatie te visualiseren. Ook kunnen we je vragen om een specifieke markt in kaart te brengen, of een collega te helpen met het optimaliseren van een forecasting model. Het team werkt nauw samen op de verschillende projecten; je staat er dus nooit alleen voor.

De Junior Data Analisten die bij ons starten zijn vertrouwd met econometrie en hebben een basiservaring met programmeren. Bij ons krijg je de kans deze skills te ontwikkelen en te leren van het team om je heen.

Wat verwachten we van jou?
Bij Baken krijg je de mogelijkheid om in een omgeving met unieke vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid jezelf te te ontwikkelen richting Data Scientist en Consultancy functies. Daarvoor verwachten we inzet en ambitie, maar we begrijpen dat je als student nog geen expert bent. Wat we veel belangrijker vinden is dat je leergierig bent, houdt van een uitdaging en graag meebouwt aan een groeiend bedrijf.

[AmsterdamYoung Mavericks werkt aan de toekomstbestendigheid van organisaties en talent. We zijn digitale denkers die doen. Soms dwars, maar altijd gretig. Naar anders. Beter. Mooier.

een professioneel team van Data Scientists die jou een stap verder helpen in jouw ontwikkeling
inspirerende trainers en gastsprekers uit het vakgebied
uitwerking van uitdagende data cases van toonaangevende organisaties uit Nederland
een rol bij één van onze partners na het afronden van je Data Science opleiding

beschikt over een bèta-Master en hebt enige ervaring met programmeren in Python, R of Matlab
bent digitaal onderlegd, oplossingsgericht en beschikt over een growth mindset
krijgt een boost door het oplossen van problemen en wordt blij van data sets
gaat intellectuele uitdagingen aan en beschikt over een stevige dosis energie
beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk

[AmsterdamData Analytics is op zoek naar nieuwe Lead Data Scientists!Wil je onderdeel zijn van een enerverende data science reis met uitdagende projecten? Ben jij degene die van (niet-)gestructureerde data met algoritmes en data science toepassingen toegevoegde waarde kan creëren? Durf jij de uitdaging aan om met een team van data experts een vraagstuk van een klant op te lossen en te implementeren? Dan is dit jouw kans!Data Analytics – an Ortec Finance companyOnze organisatie heeft een uniek track-record op het gebied van “Advanced Analytics” en houdt zich al ruim 35 jaar bezig met het analyseren van data. Data Analytics, onderdeel van Ortec Finance, zorgt ervoor dat klanten beter inzicht krijgen in hun data en daar bedrijfsmatig hun voordeel mee kunnen doen. Data Analytics onderscheidt zich van andere aanbieders door niet alleen consultancy en opleiding te bieden, maar in het bijzonder door het daadwerkelijk oplossen van data science uitdagingen. Wij zijn in met name geïnteresseerd in de uitkomsten van de (big) data verwerking en analyses door het toepassen van de nieuwste technieken op het gebied van machine learning. Data Analytics levert zoveel mogelijk schaalbare oplossingen door gebruik te maken van bestaande platforms en infrastructuur van partijen zoals Google, Microsoft en IBM. Daarnaast maken we veelvuldig gebruik van Python, R en andere open source talen.Wat ga je doen als Lead Data Scientist?Steeds meer organisaties willen data omzetten in nieuwe diensten of processen, procesverbeteringen of willen met de data voorspellen wat het juiste aanbod is voor hun klant. Data Analytics speelt op deze behoefte in. Als Lead Data Scientist speel jij een cruciale rol in het transformatieproces van klanten door een business case op te lossen. Je helpt de juiste data te bewerken door het toepassen van statistische methoden, machine learning technieken of analytische benaderingen. Met jouw ervaring weet je het project inhoudelijk te coördineren en fungeer je als aanspreekpunt voor de klant. Na jouw studie heb je 2-4 jaar gewerkt in data analytics, data science of machine learning.Op competentie gebied wil je de uitdaging aan gaan om klantproblemen op te lossen, word je enthousiast van data, kun je goed organiseren en communiceren met een klant, en ben je erg geïnteresseerd om nieuwe ontwikkelingen te volgen en te implementeren. Je werkt samen met proactieve, resultaatgerichte en enthousiaste collega’s en je bent bereid om veel en snel te leren. [AmsterdamOur mission
Yolt is the smart-thinking money app on a mission to make money easy: You can sync your accounts together in one place, track your spending across different categories, set budgets, and look for deals with our growing list of in-app connections – and we have lots of exciting new features planned, too. With our mission in place, we launched in 2017 and haven’t looked back. With over half a million registered users across the UK, France and Italy, we’re working hard to empower our users every day.
Innovation is our driving force: We’re leveraging the power of PSD2 and Open Banking to deliver the most innovate money app on the market. This year, Yolt was awarded the Excellence in Innovation award at the Corporate Entrepreneur Awards, 2018 and the Most Innovative Java Project at NLJUG, 2018!
About the team
You'll join a team of highly skilled and inspiring people, from developers to copywriters, united in our mission to build Yolt, work hard, and celebrate our successes. As a venture of ING N.V., we operate in a unique space – backed by the power of a large multinational bank and driven by the entrepreneurial attitude of a start-up. We want to grow our team even further and help us bring Yolt to the next 500,000 people!
What you'll be doing as a Data Engineer
As a Senior Data Engineer you work in a team with other data analysts and scientists. You have a strong engineering background, preferably with experience in building and maintaining distributed systems. You are proficient on the JVM (Scala and Java) but preferably also have experience productionizing machine learning models in collaboration with the data scientists. You will be working on our streaming data enrichment pipeline which consists of microservices working with Kafka and Cassandra with the goal to enrich transaction data.
Currently a part of our environment uses Hadoop but we are transitioning towards our container platform in Kubernetes. Furthermore we are looking for a candidate with experience setting-up and working with cloud solutions like AWS Redshift.
What we're looking for in a Data Engineer
You have at least 3-5 years of relevant work experience as a (data) engineer and have worked in complex organizations delivering production ready software
Experience in Scala, Python and Spark
Experience with a microservices architecture and container platforms like Kubernetes
Good social and communication skills
Self-starting with an entrepreneurial spirit.
What's in it for you:
Flexible hours
Ability to travel to other sites and get to know the local teams and culture
Amazing future potential as we continue to scale and grow
Competitive salary and benefits
Inspiring, entrepreneurial environment with ambitious vision for the future
Supporting, fun-loving team of highly skilled people
If you can see yourself in one of Europe’s most innovative teams, apply today. We're looking forward to hearing from you!]

[AmsterdamBooking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team. As a Data Engineer, you will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to ensure we have high quality data to power our business in all departments. Decisions for every part of our business - from the front end experience to performance marketing to partner products - are driven by petabytes of our data via MySQL, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc. Your challenge will be to make sure we can utilize our petabyte scale data even more effectively to support business decisions and improve our products. Joining a cross functional team of developers, designers, data scientists, and product owners, we invite you to help us crunch the data to ensure our place as the planet’s #1 accommodation site.

B.responsible

As a Data Engineer, you are responsible for the development, performance, quality, and scaling of our data pipelines, with a special focus on data quality. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team.

Important aspects of the job include:

Rapidly developing next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance data pipelines.
Solving issues with data and data pipelines, prioritizing based on customer impact.
End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines.
Experimenting with new tools and technologies to meet business requirements regarding performance, scaling, and data quality.
Providing tools that enhance Data Quality company wide.
Providing self-organizing tools that help the analytics community discover data, assess quality, explore usage, and find peers with relevant expertise.
Acting as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Contributing to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts.
B.skilled

We are looking for driven Data Engineers who enjoy solving problems, who initiate solutions and discussions and who believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools.

The ones that fit us best are the people who match the following requirements:

Minimum of 3 years of experience in the field, using 2 or more server side programming languages - preferably Scala, Java, Python, Perl, etc.
Experience with building data pipelines in distributed environments with technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra, Kafka, Spark, HBase, MySQL, etc.
Demonstrable experience with SQL, HQL, CQL, etc.
Hands on experience of developing in and contributing to open source data technologies, such as Hadoop
Experience of working on systems on large scale
Good understanding of basic analytics and machine learning concepts
Preferably a university degree in Mathematics or Software Engineering
Excellent communication, written and spoken
B.offered

This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.]

[Postcode 1012 in Amsterdam CentrumData Engineer – DACH Region
We know that there are all kinds of data engineers, with varying levels of knowledge about different platforms and data sources. At InterWorks, we're more interested in candidates who are hard-working, smart and love what they do. We care more about overall database and analytical skills rather than experience with a certain database platform. Whether you have worked primarily in SQL Server, Oracle, or something else, we only ask that you have a strong understanding of SQL as a whole and can apply your skills within our fast paced and agile approach.
While some companies may hide their data engineers away in some dungeon, data engineers at InterWorks are social, friendly creatures. That is why being able to communicate with clients day in and day out is especially valuable. Our data consultants must be able to work closely with users in order to understand their needs and help them best as possible.
You might find it difficult to do the same thing each day. At InterWorks, Data Engineers can expect to work on diverse projects ranging from a few days to several months. Many of these projects include solving business problems using data from some of the largest organizations in the world. Projects also include working with disparate data sources (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, DB2, Excel, Hadoop, Text files, etc.) to unify client data, creating ETL processes based on client needs and managing client expectations.
InterWorks prides itself on having an exciting work environment, with a unique (and downright nerdy) company culture. InterWorks employees are some of the most intelligent and friendly people you will ever meet – they are the primary reason for the success of InterWorks. To keep this ball rolling, we have built a knowledge sharing culture around here where everybody gets involved. Tech talks and blogs, unlimited access to online courses and opportunities to top notch tech conferences constantly refine our skillsets. Joining the InterWorks team as a Data Engineer means joining a family and our family is growing faster than ever.

Excellent SQL skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Business acumen
Easily adaptable and flexible to changing situations
Passion for delivering compelling solutions that exceed client expectations
Fluent German and English
Hunger for variety accompanied by willingness to travel

Highly Desired:
Background in Software Engineering
Having built data pipelines yourself Experience with Visual Analytics tools (Tableau, QlikView, Cognos, or similar)
Experience with Web technologies (HTML, CSS, JS)

Founded on twenty years of business consulting experience and a culture of complete client satisfaction, InterWorks delivers the absolute best in full-spectrum IT and data solutions. From servers and storage to development and visualization, our talented team leverages industry-leading technology to help organizations across the globe build a foundation for sustained success.

Job_Title: Trainee - Digital Analytics [12 months] x 2 positions
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamTijdelijkWant to practice what you have learned at university? Do you want to experience hands-on what your dream job is like? Are you a sports lover who aspires to work in an international environment with responsibilities for own projects? Then a traineeship at adidas will be an opportunity for you to join a truly international business with an environment that is often described as dynamic, innovative, and culturally diverse!
Traineeship at adidas
The purpose of this traineeship is to provide the trainee with experience of the practical application of theoretical knowledge the traineeship student has already acquired at university and to acquire new skills and knowledge. This traineeship description contains tasks and responsibilities that will be learned step by step and the trainee will be accompanied by adidas employees at all times. adidas will ensure that the trainee is given tasks and responsibilities according to the level of competence of the trainee and any educational objectives for the traineeship period.
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization
At adidas, our love for sport drives who we are and what we do every day. Equally important is our passion for data and our aspiration to excel in insight-driven analytics.
Our goal is to take our digital analytics practice area to the next level. Our consumers are fluid and multi-faceted, which should be reflected in web analytics practice to maximize conversion and engagement horizontally.
We want to refine our existing global digital analytics activities by exploiting the vast amount of information and insights available through Clickstream data, Web Consumer Experience Feedback program and beyond. Your modus operandi is to drive the analytics function by providing actionable insights that drive strategies and business outcomes. As a Digital Analyst, you are a natural and fluent bridge builder, between analytics function and cross-functional stakeholders.
As a trainee in the field of Digital/Web analytics, you support the Web analytics team and direct stakeholders with web analytics through use of various analytics solutions. You will be working with the Web analytics team directly, as well as working frequently with the wider Digital Analytics team in various function (e.g. Traffic Generation, Consumer Analytics, Data Governance), User Experience, Consumer Engagement, local markets and Business Units, amongst others.
You will be pivotal in assisting analytics professionals and will have the opportunity to learn from them and gain insight into their main tasks and challenges.
Key Responsibilities
Providing Digital teams with insights through reports, dashboards and visualizations helping them answer business questions
Support day to day digital analytics needs from stakeholders across the wider organization
Perform the system administrator role and pick up ad hoc insights and reporting requests from web data
Analyze data with the purpose of understanding or drawing conclusions for decision making purposes
Inspect and evaluate the web analytics implementation for data quality purposes
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Genuine interest in the sporting goods industry, digital experience, and digital analytics
A self-starter & good communicator, open to feedback, proactive and a hands-on attitude
Open to learning on the job and relishes change as a constant
Fluent written and spoken English is a must
Advanced computer skills, proficiency in Microsoft Excel is a must
Comfortable with working with large data sets and applying explorative data analysis
Affinity with Web Analytics, preferably some exposure to tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or CoreMetrics (or the like)
Affinity with data visualizations tools like Tableau is a strong plus
Affinity with SQL, NoSQL, R, Python and Big Data Platforms/technical language is a strong plus
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications
Fully graduated with a Bachelor or Master degree in the area of Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Business or Marketing
Recent graduate (within the last 2 years)
Applied to EU citizens only due to work permit regulations
Traineeship start date
1 Mar 2020
Traineeship duration
12 months
Relocation
Basic relocation package
Next recruitment step
WePow pre-recorded video interview
Please expect a response within 3 weeks as of application date]
