[AmsterdamAll financial institutions have the duty to fight money laundering, financing of terrorism and financial fraud. Here at ING we “Hunt and Catch the BAD guys!” in order to become the most trustworthy bank in the world!
As a Financial Economic Crime Investigator you play a key role in hunting and catching the bad guys by analysing and investigating potentially unusual, high risky transactions/entities involved in money laundering, terrorism financing, criminal activities, etc.
This is an evolving journey as an investigator; at the beginning, you will be heavily involved in developing an in-house advanced analytics anti-money laundering platform with some world-class data scientists in the Wholesale Banking Advanced Analytics team, to create the tool for detecting and investigating unusual/ suspicious transaction behaviour. Afterwards, you will be able to use this platform for deep-dive investigations.
For the investigations, you report the conclusion of your research and consideration thoroughly motivating why you define the transaction as an unusual/ suspicious transaction. Your conclusions are then reviewed and validated by other expert functions in the bank. Depending on your expertise level and interest, you will also contribute to sharpening of the advanced analytics model and overall to the development of the anti-money laundering platform.
Who are we looking for?
Colleagues with various levels of seniority with a talent for taking it on and making it happen, enthusiasm for helping others to be successful and a knack for always being a step ahead. In other words, you strive to bring fresh ideas to life and embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment. You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to propose creative solutions to problems.
What will you be doing?
Manage unusual/suspicious activity case work in a timely and efficient manner. Execute a variety of tasks in support of the conduct of investigations.
Perform an investigation of all high risky entities flagged by advanced analytics based anti-money laundering system to determine whether transactions identified qualify as suspicious activity.
Summarize, in writing, suspicious activity for advanced investigation/validation.
Escalate cases and issues as appropriate for advanced investigation and analysis.
Build and maintain awareness of the broader context and implications of the various types of risk affecting the business (e.g., financial, legal, reputation, etc.)
Assist with filing of Suspicious Activity Reports
Collaborate across AML functions/ Lines of Business (LOBs) and serve as an AML subject matter expert
Coach less experienced colleagues
As a Hunter (Financial Economic Crime Analyst/Investigator) you will need:
Bachelor / Master level, preferably in the economic or legal field, such as legal services or MER (Management Economics and Law), Criminology, business economics or business administration, political science or other related fields;
Minimum of 2 years of experience in AML- fraud detection and investigation techniques, Transaction Monitoring, or other banking and/or regulatory affairs: Know Your Customer, (e.g. Financial Economic Crime), fiscal transparency and reporting (e.g. FATCA, Qualified Intermediary, Common Reporting Standards, Ultimate Beneficial Owner);
Minimum 3 - 5 years overall experience in bank operations and regulations (cross bank regulations, general banking processes, regulatory reporting, risk policies etc.)
Experience in preparing appropriate documentation of investigation performed;
Big plus: Ability to deep-dive the data using SQL and/or Python/R;
Big plus: Experience in financial economic crime prevention/investigation (law-enforcement, government, etc.)
Big plus: strong understanding in payment/ transaction analysis; knowledge about SWIFT data / messages;
Reading and understanding of Annual Reports;
Curious, quick learner: functional (AML, KYC, Fraud) and/or technical (SQL, Python/R)
Strong analytical skills, being creative and critical where you can make strong connections and draw conclusions on appropriateness of the business structure of a customer, business activities and cash flows;
Organized and structured, attention to detail, ability to process and understand large amounts of data;
Driven and customer focused, loving to collaborate with different people; strong communication skills;
Problem analysis and judgement (recognizing important information, identifying problems, researching and making connections)
Excellent knowledge of English (working language as well oral as written); fluency in other European languages is an advantage;
If you are a seasoned expert in the financial economic crime field looking for a new challenge or even for an opportunity to explore the new world of Artificial Intelligence applied to FEC, let’s talk. You might like what you hear.
We offer a clear purpose, a unique offer and a range of flexible work arrangements and other benefits:
Personal growth & challenging work with endless opportunities to realise your ambition
An informal, dynamic environment with innovative colleagues supporting your endeavours
A progressive and agile way of working, where new ideas are valued ahead of convention
The chance of using some of the most advanced technologies in combating financial crime
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
Public transport pass
27 vacation days with a 40-hour working week.
Pension scheme
13th month salary
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
8% Holiday payment]

[AmsterdamFulltime, Onbepaalde tijd€4.153 - €5.699 per maandJe werkt binnen de staf van de directie Financiële Dienstverlening (FD).

Je maakt via data analyses verbinding tussen primaire proces data en financiële data en ondersteunt daarmee het steeds verbeteren van de dienstverlening van de gemeente Amsterdam.

Zie onderaan voor een uitgebreidere beschrijving van de directie FD

Werkzaamheden en Resultaten

Het vertalen van datastructuren naar intelligenceproducten die bijdragen aan de ambities van FD en de stad Amsterdam. Juist door primaire data te koppelen met financiële data.
Een bijdrage leveren aan de creatie van kennis over de stad en gemeente.
Heeft ervaring met of een visie op hoe kwantitatieve data-analyses kunnen bijdragen aan innovatie van de aanpak van vraagstukken
Het op eigen initiatief starten, of in opdracht van partners in de stad, van projecten om tot nieuwe inzichten of nieuwe toepassingen van data te komen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het optimaliseren van het betaalproces, maar ook aan het verschaffen van vernieuwende inzichten in subsidiestromen.

Het vertalen van de behoefte van directies op het gebied van (financiële) data naar managementinformatie in AMI en de dienstverlening van de directie FD
Sturing geven aan de ordening en analyse van verzamelde gegevens en mede formuleren van conclusies;
Verantwoordelijk voor het, in samenwerking met de procesmanager en data scientist, voor het inrichten van datagovernance binnen FD.
Samenwerken met data lab en CTO om steeds te blijven innoveren en slim en goed gebruik te maken van de data.
Wij vragen:

Je bent een professional op het gebied van finance en data en beschikt in ieder geval over de volgende competenties, vaardigheden en ervaring:

Afgeronde relevante academische (master) opleiding, zoals bijvoorbeeld Economie, Bedrijfskunde, Econometrie eventueel aangevuld met een RA of RC opleiding

3-7 jaar ervaring in het voeren van overleg met het hoger management.
Aantoonbare ervaring als gesprekspartner voor MT en hoger management.
Bij voorkeur kennis van en 3-7 jaar ervaring op het gebied van advisering in een politiek-bestuurlijke context, in het bijzonder op het terrein van financiële processen.
Een grote mate van zelfstandigheid en flexibiliteit is vereist.
De volgende competenties op expert niveau;
Omgevingsbewustzijn
Samenwerken
Relatiebeheer
Resultaatgerichtheid
Overtuigingskracht
Initiatief
Duiding van de competenties

Omgevingsbewustzijn; Laat blijken goed geïnformeerd te zijn over vakinhoudelijke, organisatorische, maatschappelijke, politieke ontwikkelingen

of andere omgevingsfactoren en weet deze effectief te benutten voor de eigen functie of organisatie. Houdt rekening met de omgeving van zijn werk.

Samenwerken; Levert een constructieve bijdrage aan een gezamenlijk resultaat, in het bijzonder aan de sfeer en de relaties binnen de groep of het team. Draagt bij aan een stimulerende werksfeer en een gezamenlijk resultaat.

Relatiebeheer; Bouwt persoonlijke relaties op met klanten en andere contactpersonen, onderhoudt en benut ze. Bouwt relaties op en uit.

Resultaatgerichtheid; Concrete doelen als uitgangspunt nemen voor het eigen gedrag en hieraan vasthouden totdat het doel bereikt is. Is resultaatgericht met betrekking tot doelen in breder verband.

Overtuigingskracht; Oefent, op basis van persoonlijk overwicht, invloed uit op mensen en situaties, gericht op acceptatie en het overwinnen van weerstanden. Communiceert ideeën duidelijk en stellig. Kan groepen overtuigen.

Initiatief; Onderneemt zelfstandig actie. Signaleert kansen en zet deze om in verbeterings- en vernieuwingsacties, die bijdragen aan betere organisatieprestaties. Speelt actief in op kansen en verbeteringsmogelijkheden en neemt ook initiatieven die buiten de eigen taak liggen.

Wij bieden

Afhankelijk van je opleiding en werkervaring bedraagt het salaris minimaal € 4.153,- en maximaal € 5.699,- (salarisschaal 12) bruto per maand op basis van 36 uren per week;
Naast een 36-urige werkweek kun je rekenen op goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB). Het IKB bedraagt 17,05 % van je brutosalaris en kun je keuzes maken die passen bij jouw levensfase, persoonlijke wensen en doelen;
Een vast dienstverband volgt, nadat een tijdelijke aanstelling bij wijze van proef (1 jaar) succesvol is doorlopen en bij gebleken geschiktheid;
De gemeente Amsterdam kent prima opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden plus een goed pakket secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Deze secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden bestaan o.a. uit opname in het ABP-pensioenfonds, een maandelijkse bijdrage in de ziektekostenverzekering;
Goede balans tussen werk-privé.
De organisatie

De directie FD maakt deel uit van de financiële functie van de Gemeente Amsterdam waarin de Directie Middelen en Control kaderstellend is en de FD adviserend en uitvoerend.

FD staat voor een transparante en betrouwbare financiële administratie, efficiënte processen, en gedegen en proactief advies. Dit doen we voor en met alle organisatieonderdelen van de gemeente Amsterdam en ten behoeve van haar bestuur en burgers.

FD wil een excellente organisatie worden die zeer goede financiële dienstverlening levert aan interne en externe stakeholders. Dit willen wij bereiken door keten georiënteerde en efficiënte werkprocessen op basis van uniforme en gestandaardiseerde werkwijzen.

Staf

De Staf binnen FD ondersteunt het management van de directie, als ook brede advisering wanneer het gaat om bestuurlijke en ambtelijke context van de directie Financiën. De staf zorgt dat er kwalitatief volwaardige besluitvorming plaatsvindt, zowel binnen de FD, GMT als

wethouder en B&W. De staf vormt ook een liaison richting de verschillende partners zoals datalab, communicatie, P&O en IV/ICT.

Sollicitatieprocedure

Uw reactie, voorzien van motivatiebrief en CV, zien wij graag tegemoet onder vermelding van Senior Data Analist.

De gemeente Amsterdam wil een diverse en inclusieve organisatie zijn. Een organisatie die ruimte biedt aan iedereen en die de kracht van de diversiteit van medewerkers gebruikt om betere resultaten te halen voor de stad. Talent als basis, diversiteit als kracht. We streven ernaar dat het personeelsbestand een afspiegeling is van de beroepsbevolking van Amsterdam met al haar aanwezige verschillen. Vacatures staan open voor iedereen, tenzij uitdrukkelijk anders vermeld.

Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Vragen over deze vacature

Neem voor meer informatie over de functie of procedure contact op met Mohamed Chaaibi, recruiter, 06 46 34 15 88 of m.chaaibi@amsterdam.nl

[AmsterdamStageBen je op zoek naar het ideale bedrijf om je vaardigheden te testen en te verbeteren? Een plek waar je kunt uitgroeien tot de data scientist die je wil worden? Zoek niet verder! ABN AMRO biedt je de mogelijkheid om jezelf te ontwikkelen, samen met de beste professionals in het bedrijf. Wij zijn op zoek naar jou!
Je werk
Binnen ABN AMRO zijn er veel lopende projecten, om deze te kunnen volgen, gebruiken wij een agile portfolio management tool. Op dit moment werkt dit tool niet efficiënt genoeg. Zo worden niet alle projectonderdelen gelinkt aan hoofdprojecten en zijn inschattingen voor de duur van een project niet accuraat. Als stagiaire binnen de Performance & Analytics team ben jij samen met ons verantwoordelijk om de project data te verbeteren en te verrijken. Om dit doel te bereiken starten we dit verbetertraject waarin we:
het ophalen, opslaan en kwaliteit van de projectdata willen verbeteren. Het betreft een grote dataset 5 miljoen records.
met behulp van de data die wel gelinkt is de missende links voorspellen;
met de data van afgeronde projecten willen we de inschattingen voor tijdsduur verbeteren;
gebruik maken van Natural Language Processing om tekstelementen uit de data records te analyseren;
Jouw Activiteiten:
Data ophalen via rest API en opslaan op onze Azure omgeving.
Met behulp van Natural Language Processing tekstuele data geschikt maken voor gebruik in modellen. Denk aan word-vectorizing, word embeddings, etc.
Machine Learning toepassen op de data voor het oplossen van de genoemde problemen
Visualiseren van de uitkomsten.
Creative concepten bedenken voor het dooronwikkeling van de project.
Je werkomgeving
Als stagiaire ben jij een deel van de Performance & Analytics team binnen de IT Office. Het team bestaat uit ca. 15 specialisten en consultants op het gebied van data, proces en risk management met merendeels jonge ambitieuze mensen die door samen te werken en van elkaar te leren het beste resultaat willen neerzetten. Het team is zelf-organiserend, wat inhoudt dat er veel vrijheid is om zelf te bepalen wat het beste past bij het team, uiteraard binnen de gegeven kaders. Het hoofdkantoor op de Zuidas (Amsterdam) is je vaste werkomgeving, maar wanneer nodig verricht je ook werkzaamheden op andere locaties van de bank.
Je profiel
Je bent afgestudeerd of tenminste 3e jaar WO student.
Je studie heeft betrekking op het gebied van Computer Science, Data Science & Engineering, Natural Language Processing & Statistics of gerelateerd
Je hebt affiniteit met Python
Je bent beschikbaar voor een stage van 4-6 maanden, met als startmaand Dec./Jan.
Probleemoplosser: je analytische vaardigheden en creativiteit zijn dermate ontwikkeld om met realistische oplossingen te komen.
Data affiniteit: je bent ervaren in het werken met data en het interpreteren van analyses.
Teamspeler: je bent een sociaal persoon die graag in groepen werkt en niet alleen verantwoordelijkheden deelt, maar ook een lach, koffie en natuurlijk succes!
Wat bieden wij
Ben je op zoek naar een verrijkende stage om jezelf te ontwikkelen? Wil je werken in een van de beste werkomgevingen van Nederland? ? Dan nodigen wij je uit om hier te komen om samen met ons geschiedenis te schrijven, om je stempel te drukken door middel van je harde werk, inzet en gezelschap.Daarom moedigen we je bij ABN AMRO aan om jezelf te ontwikkelen tot het broodnodige talent waar de wereld op wacht! Je zult werken met de beste professionals in de business en ook met de nieuwste technologieën, in een creatieve, flexibele en relaxte sfeer. We bieden alle ABN AMRO stagiaires een werklaptop, een maandelijkse compensatie (€600 voor MSc studenten en €450 BSc studenten), een persoonlijke ontwikkelingscoach en nog veel meer zodat jij je maximale potentieel kan benutten! Wij bieden je de mogelijkheid om op te vallen en een verschil te maken.Geloof je het niet? We nodigen je uit om het zelf te ervaren.
 direct!
Ben je zelfverzekerd genoeg om een waardevol lid van ons team te worden, reageer dan direct! En vergeet niet; een goed doordacht en gestructureerde CV en motivatiebrief kunnen je onderscheiden van de rest!

Hoe dit te doen?
Zet alleen baanrelevante items op je CV en in je brief.
In je brief presenteer je jezelf kort en vertel je ons waarom je geïnteresseerd bent in deze vacature in het bijzonder en het werken bij ABN AMRO in het algemeen. Vervolgens leg je uit hoe je waarde kunt toevoegen aan ons team, door te wijzen op je relevante vaardigheden en ervaring.
Noem ten slotte altijd je beschikbaarheidsperiode (bijvoorbeeld vanaf februari 2020 tot juli 2020) en het doel van je stage (bijvoorbeeld scriptieonderzoek of werkervaring).
 Wij verheugen ons erop om je te leren kennen! Twijfels, vragen of complimenten voor ons? Stuur ons een e-mail naar: it.internships@nl.abnamro.comLet op: je moet beschikken over een geldig werkvergunning of over een stageovereenkomst als student]

Do you want to use your experience with IT systems and data to keep our marketing machine running at ever increasing rates of effectivity? Do you like coding as much as working out new ideas with your commercial colleagues? Then join KLM as Data Engineer in the Benelux Marketing Department!
Initiatief
Innovatie
Plannen en organiseren
Resultaat- & commerciële gerichtheid
Realisatie van doelen
Werken in teamverband
Wat ga je doen?
You will work in the marketing department of the Benelux division, KLM’s home market. In true engineering fashion, you provide the oil to keep the marketing machine running at ever increasing rates of personalization and effectivity. You invent new clever solutions and use your business sense to think of the next best thing we can do with our data. You allow us to leverage this data to its maximum business potential: growing revenue, increasing customer satisfaction and gaining cost efficiencies. As a member of the Marketing Science team, you have ample opportunity to learn and grow, and most important: your impact is visible!

Next to this, your responsibilities are:
Maintaining and developing our team’s SQL database that’s used for descriptive and predictive analytics, build ETL pipelines for new data sources and connect with other departments for cooperationMaintaining and building out our state-of-the-art segmentation/personalization platform built in the CloudSupporting your data science teammates in bringing predictive models to a production state (setting up pipelines, optimizing code)Support the sending of marketing e-mails, set up of personalized campaign pages and the execution of A/B tests from a technical perspectiveProactively connect with other colleagues within and outside the department to exchange knowledge and make sure we use the best data sources and tools available in the companyActively contribute to the Marketing Science roadmap

Where will you land?
You will do this as part of the Marketing Science team located in KLM’s Amstelveen HQ, a young and ambitious team consisting of data scientists and analysts (7 people at the moment). We work together with one big goal: improving everything we do in the marketing channel by making smart use of data. To accomplish this, you will actively engage with the other teams in our department, like e-marketing, e-commerce and pricing.
Jouw profiel
You are an ambitious team player, who is eager to make an impact, and your business sense tells you how. You like to connect with people and share your knowledge. Nobody will tell you to Google it, because you already did. You understand that data is the new oil, or even gold. When you hear Python, you don’t think about a snake because you know your programming languages. Actually, you were already coding before you had your first beer.

Next to this you have:
university degree (preferably Master) in a business or quantitative discipline (e.g. Econometrics, Economics, Business Administration, Statistics)at least a few years of working experience in a relevant positionstrong affinity with data and IT systemsPython skillsno anxiety of the following: HTML/CSS/JavaScript, REST APIs, SQL, Google BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform, Docker, Kubernetes, DMPs, Tag Management Systems, Google Analytics, Optimizely, Hadoop/HDFS, Shell scripting, GIT, Airflow, CI/CD, and did we say Python?Salesforce Marketing Cloud experience is a plusno issues with quickly learning new technologiesexcellent communication skills in both Dutch and English (both written and spoken)
Wat bieden wij?
A place in a commercial, fast-paced but fun working environment, with a regular Friday afternoon drink. Next to this we offer:
An attractive salary to match the weight of your luggage (EUR 3.200 - EUR 4.200)Profit sharing up to 20%, and bonus scheme up to 12% of your annual salaryGood arrangement of secondary working conditions, like an excellent pension scheme, reductions on flight tickets, flexibility, travel allowance and free public transportation around Schiphol25 days of paid holiday and 5 ADV (working time reduction scheme) days.Extensive study and training opportunities for personal development.A job at the cutting edge when it comes to technology

Ready for your next destination?

You will be notified regarding your application within 10 business days after the deadline (mentioned at the top of this vacancy).

[Postcode 1012 in Amsterdam Centrum€2.835 - €4.274 per maandWe seek a highly qualified scientific programmer for advanced applications in relation to Computational Biomedicine, executing on high-end massively parallel computing systems.
What are you going to do?
The main focus will be on the development and maintenance of our software portfolio (for an example see our open-source cellular flow modelling toolkit Hemocell and to contribute to workflows in relation to in-silico stroke trials (see INSIST). You will work, together with PhD students and Postdocs, on new, specialized applications of our software, as well as on improving the performance of our software. These applications are often embedded in large international projects in cooperation with external partners in e.g. Sheffield, London, or Geneva. You will support our scientific team to realize efficient HPC simulation solutions with these codes.
This position can give grounds to fast professional development in parallel numerical techniques, simulation methods, and application of state-of-the-art computational solutions for large-scale systems, and High Performance Computing on Europe’s largest supercomputers.
What do we require?
The candidates should have at least a Master’s degree in Computational Science or a related field, with experience in High Performance Computing. The candidate should be first and foremost an excellent programmer, fluent in C++ and Python, with experience in complex software engineering projects, including collaborative software development. Since most work revolves around numerical modelling, knowledge and general interest of solving scientific problems with numerical techniques is important. Furthermore, most work is done in collaboration with others, therefore the will and the capability to communicate with scientists from different disciplines (for instance biomedicine, physics, computer science) is necessary.
The following is considered an advantage for this position:
experience with scientific codes, including open-source ones such as: Palabos, HemeLB, Espresso, LAMMPS;
knowledge of HPC job scheduling systems (e.g. slurm, PBS);
knowledge of any of the following programming languages: Fortran, C#, Java, julia;
knowledge of the lattice Boltzmann method;
knowledge of workflow systems, e.g. Taverna;
familiarity with container technologies (e.g. Docker, Singularity);
motivation to read, process, and understand scientific papers (maybe even author a few).
Our offer
A temporary contract for 38 hours per week for a period of three years in the rank of ‘ICT developer’.
The salary, depending on qualifications and relevant experience before the beginning of the employment contract, will be €2,835 to € 3,895 (scale 9) to €2,709 to €4,274 (scale 10) gross per month, based on fulltime (38 hours a week), exclusive 8 % holiday allowance and 8.3 % end-of-year bonus. A favorable tax agreement, the ‘30% ruling’, may apply to non-Dutch applicants. Please note that for this position you have to be permitted to work in the Netherlands. The Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities is applicable.
Some further things we offer:
very friendly, interactive and international working environment;
new building located near the city center (20 minutes by bicycle) of one of Europe’s most beautiful and lively cities;
access to high-end computing facilities (e.g. cluster with 4,000+ cores).
English is the working language within the Informatics Institute. Moreover, since Amsterdam is a very international city where almost everybody speaks and understands English, candidates need not be afraid of the language barrier.
Are you curious about our extensive package of secondary employment benefits? Then find out more about working at the Faculty of Science.
Questions?
Do you have questions about this vacancy? Or do you want to know more about our organisation? Please contact:
Prof. Alfons Hoekstra
T: +31 (0)20 525 7543
About the Faculty of Science
The Faculty of Science has a student body of around 6,500, as well as 1,600 members of staff working in education, research or support services. Researchers and students at the Faculty of Science are fascinated by every aspect of how the world works, be it elementary particles, the birth of the universe or the functioning of the brain.
The mission of the Informatics Institute is to perform curiosity-driven and use-inspired fundamental research in Computer Science. The main research themes are Artificial Intelligence, Computational Science and Systems and Network Engineering. Our research involves complex information systems at large, with a focus on collaborative, data driven, computational and intelligent systems, all with a strong interactive component.
The Computational Science Lab of the Informatics Institute aims to make dynamic complex systems tractable via computational science. We study a broad range of dynamics systems in fields ranging from biomedicine to urban, or socioeconomic systems. We also develop theory of dynamic complex systems based on concepts of information processing.
Job application
The UvA is an equal-opportunity employer. We prioritise diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We value a spirit of enquiry and perseverance, provide the space to keep asking questions, and promote a culture of curiosity and creativity.
The Informatics Institute strives for a better gender balance in its staff. We therefore strongly encourage women to apply for this position.
Do you recognize yourself in the job profile? Then we look forward to receiving your CV and cover letter by 31 december 2019. You may apply online by using the link below.
Applications should include:
a curriculum vitae (including an url allowing download of pdf of MSc thesis - if relevant);
a letter of motivation (at most 1 page) explaining why you are interested in this position;
a list of all university courses taken, including a transcript of grades;
the name and contact details (including email address) of two referees who can provide details about your profile (one of whom should be the main supervisor of your Master thesis).

[AmsterdamAls Data Scientist ben je specialist op het gebied van Advanced Analytics en houd je je bezig met het analyseren van data om trends en mogelijk afwijkingen te ontdekken en te kunnen verklaren bij ING.
Wat je doet
Je bent onderdeel van het Client Analytics team en werkt zowel voor Commercial Banking als Corporate Banking.
Je inventariseert de behoeften en beantwoordt concrete vragen vanuit de business.
Je durft kritische vragen te stellen als dat nodig is en komt proactief met voorstellen
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het optimaliseren van het gebruik van Advanced Analytics toepassingen binnen de zakelijke bank.
Je komt proactief met ideeën om zoveel mogelijk waardevolle informatie uit de beschikbare data te halen en weet anderen hierin mee te nemen.
Je inventariseert de behoefte aan analyses, adviseert over de verschillende mogelijkheden en challenget daar waar nodig.
Je voert de analyses uit en geeft een toelichting op de gepresenteerde resultaten.
Dit alles doe je in nauwe samenwerking met andere onderdelen binnen de organisatie.
Wat wij vragen
Je bent klantgericht en hebt een drive om te vernieuwen en verbeteren.
Je voelt je ondernemer binnen de bank en hebt dan ook oog voor zowel commerciële kansen als risico’s.
Je wilt jezelf voortdurend verbeteren en je staat open voor de veranderingen die ervoor moeten zorgen dat we als team beter worden.
Je bent een team player en je ziet samenwerken met anderen als vanzelfsprekend.
Herken jij jezelf hierin? Check dan je profiel:

WO-werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur een opleiding Wiskunde, (Technische) Natuurkunde, Econometrie of Bedrijfskundige Informatica.
Minimaal 12 jaar ervaring in een commercieel zakelijke omgeving;
Kennis van data analyse technieken, statistisch modelleren en machine learning, zowel de theorie als praktische toepassing daarvan;
Kennis van en ervaring met Big Data ecosystemen o.a. Hadoop, SPARK, Map Reduce, Hive, Pig, HBase, parallel computing methodieken (algoritmen) m.b.v. Hadoop;
Kennis en ervaring met tooling als SAS, R en bijvoorbeeld Python;
Kennis en ervaring met verschillende vormen van data-visualisatie+
Kennis van ondersteunende diensten, project management en management informatie;
Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift is vereist voor deze functie (a good command of the Dutch language is required for this job).
Wat wij bieden

Bij Accentia staat jouw carrière centraal. Alles draait om jouw vrijheid, jouw ontwikkeling en jouw succes. Je bepaalt zelf je inzet, opdracht en carrière. Accentia faciliteert en jij kiest. Wij geloven in jouw talent. We ondersteunen je waar nodig om het maximale in je naar boven te halen. Met opleiding, training en coaching. Zo fungeren we als sparringpartner op de inhoud, bieden we coaching op het gebied van persoonlijke en professionele vaardigheden en faciliteren we trainingen en opleidingen.

In een dienstverband bij Accentia ontvang je een vast maandsalaris en geniet je daarnaast goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.

Sollicitatie

[Postcode 1066 in Amsterdam Nieuw-WestYour function within the department
The PhD student will join the research group of John Haanen, which is part of the division of Molecular Oncology & Immunology. Our research is focused on T cell immunology in cancer, and the development and clinical testing of novel T cell therapies.

Your role
In our group, we are interested in understanding the immune response against cancer, whether mounted spontaneously or augmented by (immuno)therapy. A special focus lies on the way in which T cells are capable of recognizing tumor cells, and the biology that is associated with their capacity to do so. We have recently developed a platform that uses synthetic T cell receptor (TCR) libraries to assess the tumor-specificity of tumor-resident T cells (Scheper et al. 2019 Nat Med), and would like to deploy this technology to study the biology of tumor-specific and bystander T cells in more detail. We are looking for an enthusiastic PhD candidate to participate in this effort, which will strongly lean on next-generation techniques such as single-cell RNA sequencing. An affinity towards such techniques, and acquiring the skillset to work with these data, is therefore considered crucial.
Your profile
We seek to recruit a highly motivated and enthusiastic PhD candidate with an interest in combining novel technologies with translational research. If you meet the following requirements and are interested in this position we would like to invite you to apply.
You have a master degree in biology, biomedical sciences, biochemistry or related fields (University level).
You are a precise worker with a good sense of responsibility.
Excellent (English) communication skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (consisting of scientists, pharmacists, technicians and clinicians) are essential.
You have a flexible and proactive working attitude.
Experience with cell culture, flow cytometry, retroviral transductions, molecular biology, and NGS data analysis is advantageous.
Your career opportunities and terms of employment
You will join a dynamic international research division and collaborate with scientists and clinicians within and outside the NKI-AVL with expertise in different disciplines. The NKI offers an inspiring and interactive research environment, state-of-the-art facilities, and ample training opportunities. If you are currently living abroad and plan to move to the Netherlands we have apartments for rent in the vicinity of our institute. (At the moment we do have a waiting list)
The appointment will be for 4 years. The gross salary per month will range from € 2.665,- to € 3.282, according to our standard PhD scales. The terms of employment will be in accordance with the CAO Ziekenhuizen (Collective Labour Agreement for Hospitals) and can be consulted at:
 http://www.nvz-ziekenhuizen.nl/cao-kenniscentrum/cao/download]

Job_Title: Data Professional (data scientist, data engineer, data analist)
Job_Description:
[Postcode 1011 in Amsterdam CentrumBedrijfsomschrijving
Yacht specializes in human resource for temporary and permanent jobs with the top 30 companies in the Netherlands.

Functieomschrijving
Join the leading companies in IT
Are you looking for a new challenge? Have you ever thought about the Netherlands as your next career destination? Come to one of the most innovative countries in the world, where you will experience a great living and working environment. Join our community of Data professionals and team at Yacht and be part of Mostdata.

MostData community
MostData is the Yacht Community by and for Data professionals. We are constantly looking for the most challenging positions at our clients so that you can work on meaningful and technically advanced data projects. Amongst our clients are ING, ABN AMRO, Rabobank (the 3 largest banks in the Netherlands), eBay, VodafoneZiggo, KPN, Liberty Global, Philips, and many more interesting tech companies. We invest in improving your skills through a tailor-made education program. At our Yacht Academy, you will be offered various possibilities to gain and share knowledge through training, workshops and tech talks. And we organize events such as meetups, VR zombie shootings (which is quite fun actually) and bbq’s, to chill out and have a good time together.

Yacht is one of the leading HR companies in the Netherlands. Our mother company Randstad Holding is the leading HR company in the world. For our MostData community, we focus on data analysts, data scientists and data engineers. Our MostDev community has a focus on development positions for front-end, back-end, and full developers. Want to know more? Watch this video about the Most Dev community: https://youtu.be/VttLo1rjhCM

About you
You have a great interest in data analysis, data engineering or data science. Both during and outside office hours you are always looking for opportunities to develop yourself. You know how to make the next step and go from looking in the past to predicting the future! To do this you are working with the latest technologies such as Hadoop, Kafka, Splunk, Python, R, Hive, Matlab, SAS, Ruby or Perl. You are also making your way into Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Elasticsearch. Nex, to that you have experience with Cloud platforms such as Google, AWS or Azure.

Working in the Netherlands
When you have decided that Yacht is going to be your next employer, we are going to help you relocate. We have a special department to support you: the Expat Center. They will take care of applying for your visa, help you find housing and book your flight. We will even pay for your flight, your first month of rent and for the visa application. That is how we ensure that your arrival in the Netherlands goes as smoothly as possible.

What does that look like? Watch this video: https://youtu.be/U_UzTZMuDu0

Functie-eisen
This is what we expect from you:
Degree in Computer Science / IT
5+ years of experience in development
Professional experience with the newest technologies
Speaking English fluently and having great communication skills
Being flexible in working for different clients

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
What do you get in return?
One of the coolest communities to work with
A salary, depending on your work experience
Your own budget for education purposes
A single person who guides you
Help with relocating and applying for visa]

[AmsterdamParttimeBinnen onze jonge Urban Science club laat jij direct jouw footprint achter. Wij coderen, bouwen, creëren, ontwerpen en werken nauw samen met onze klanten om hun verwachtingen te overtreffen.
Wij zijn een snel groeiende start-up en geloven dat we met data de wereld kunnen verbeteren. Zoals onze naam al doet vermoeden: binnen een urban environment! Wij houden van gave challenges, nemen onze verantwoordelijkheden en hebben veel fun met elkaar. Er is al een plek gereserveerd voor jou in onze unit in de start up omgeving van Amsterdam, B. Building. Hier kunnen wij samen onze talenten volledig laten ontspruiten!
Hoe ziet jouw uitdaging eruit?
Als onze Data Engineer weet jij perfect de invulling van de informatiebehoeftes van onze klanten naar een hoger level te brengen. In het woud van spreadsheets en rapportages zorg jij voor structuur en kwaliteit. Natuurlijk met behulp van de tooling van o.a. Microsoft en IBM, je werkt dan ook met de allernieuwste platformen.

En jouw verantwoordelijkheden? In de breedste zin: vanaf de informatieanalyse, het technische en functionele ontwerp, de daadwerkelijke ontwikkeling van de ETL procedures, het datawarehouse en de gehele implementatie bij onze klanten.

Maar niet alleen jouw technische input en skills zijn van belang. Je heb je ook een belangrijke rol op functioneel niveau. Je werkt nauw samen met onze klanten, architecten en BI consultants. En in de ondersteuning van eindgebruikers!

Als onze data engineer ben jij binnen dit vlak in de lead in de ontwikkeling van onze intelligente applicaties. Vanaf de voorbereiding van het project tot en met het uiteindelijke beheer! Bij de advisering over de architectuur, de te gebruiken software en de impact op juiste data stromen voor een optimale organisatie.

En jij weet als geen ander hoe je nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen in onze organisatie dient te verankeren. Je bent de voorloper die collega's hierin actief meeneemt. Maar niet alleen onze collega’s. Jij vindt het ook tof om de klant te enthousiasmeren en aan te tonen dat onze intelligente apps de juiste oplossing zijn.
Wat vragen wij van jou?
De afgelopen 2 jaar heb je al ervaring opgedaan als BI’er of Data-Engineer.
Jij weet dat een goede communicatie cruciaal is en bent een kei in LSD’en (luisteren, samenvatten en doorvragen).
Een hoog klant- en kwaliteitsbewustzijn is voor jou als een tweede natuur.
Jij bent onze expert in datawarehousing, dimensioneel modelleren, ETL en business intelligence. En je helpt ons verder met methodieken zoals Kimball en/of Data Vault.
Jouw interesses reiken verder en ook naar Cloud oplossingen zoals Azure SQL Datawarehouse, Azure Data Factory en Data Lake Analytics.
Voor velen onbekend maar voor jou gesneden koek: jouw ervaring in technologieën als SSIS en SSAS en bij voorkeur SSRS en Power BI.
Jij bent in staat om over de grenzen van de strikte applicatie ontwikkeling heen te kijken en ook aangrenzende gebieden als business analyse en infrastructuur in je werkzaamheden te betrekken.
Wat bieden wij jou?
Je gaat aan de slag met uitdagende en gave projecten.
Je mag gaan werken met de nieuwste tooling.
Wij delen graag onze kennis met elkaar! We houden regelmatig informatie, trainings- en inspiratiesessies om deze kennis met elkaar te delen.
Inspiratie doe je ook op in je omgeving. Daarom een plek in het hart van een start up ecosysteem: B. Building in Amsterdam.
Onze jonge club bestaat uit een hecht team van professionele BI’ers & Data scientisten.
Wij hebben geen standaard opleidingsbudgetten. Jij bepaalt hoe jouw loopbaan eruit ziet en wij investeren daar graag in;
Uitstekend salaris;
Leaseauto of mobiliteitsvergoeding, smartphone en laptop;
25 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid meer dagen op te bouwen;
De mogelijkheid om parttime te werken (minimaal 32 uur);
Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een premievrij pensioen en de mogelijkheid gunstig aandelen te kopen.
Wat als ik deze baan graag wil?
Dus: is jouw interesse gewekt? Let us know, wij kijken uit naar jouw sollicitatie!
En om naar de toekomst te kijken: jij bepaalt jouw carrière. Wij bieden je de vrijheid om door te groeien in de richting die je wilt. Wij zijn onderdeel van een groter geheel en er zijn diverse loopbaanpaden mogelijk.
Mocht je nog vragen hebben, neem dan contact op met Frank Verhoog op 06-50618052 of stuur een mailtje naar frank.verhoog@axians.com]

[Postcode 1066 in Amsterdam Nieuw-WestYour function within the department
The Netherlands Cancer Institute - Antoni van Leeuwenhoek hospital (NKI-AVL) is a Comprehensive Cancer Center. We are an independent organization where patient care and scientific research are closely linked. Research topics within the NKI cover all major areas of cancer research, with special emphasis on five themes: basic research, image-guided treatment, immune therapy, personalized medicine and survivorship. Within the Wesseling research group we are currently looking for a postdoc.

Background of our research
Breast cancer is a heterogeneous disease ranging from being non-hazardous to life threatening. Accurate pathological and molecular analyses are key to make accurate predictions regarding prognosis and response to treatment. At the Wesseling group, we aim to find, validate, and implement biomarkers to make more precise and personalized predictions regarding prognosis and response to treatment. We have two major research themes. First, we try to find biomarkers for neoadjuvant chemotherapy response. For this goal we have a unique collection of tissue biopsies, as well as extended clinical data available. A variety of molecular techniques is employed. Second, we aim to make a distinction between aggressive and indolent ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), a breast cancer precursor lesion. This research theme is carried out by integrating epidemiology, pathology and molecular analysis. The Wesseling research group currently consists of Jelle Wesseling (PI and pathologist), Esther Lips (staff scientist), a computational biology postdoc, 6 (physician)-PhD students, and three research technicians.

This function
For our DCIS research theme we are looking for a talented postdoc to join the PRECISION team. The PRECISION project is a large international research effort, launched by Jelle Wesseling at the NKI together with local and international collaborators. The PRECISION project is funded through a CRUK “Grand Challenge” award of € 17.5 million and will run for 5 years https://www.dcisprecision.org/
PRECISION’s aim is to make a distinction between ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) prone to progression from DCIS that will remain silent. To better understand DCIS development and progression a deep molecular characterization will be performed. The postdoc will initiate studies with fresh normal and DCIS tissue material, and will perform multiregional analysis with a variety of molecular techniques, i.e. single cell sequencing, mass spectrometry, etcetera. Studies will be performed in close collaboration with the Jonkers and van Rheenen labs, as well as our international research partners.

Your profile
Your profile: a postdoc with excellent technical and organizational skills
We are seeking a highly committed postdoc with expertise in molecular biology and translational research. Experience in oncology is a pre, as well as large scale data analysis. In addition, good communication skills are essential, as we are working in a multidisciplinary team.
Your career opportunities and terms of employment
The gross salary per month will be € 3.490,- to € 3.917,- (salary scale 55), and depends on previous experience. The terms of employment will be in accordance with the CAO Ziekenhuizen (Collective Labor Agreement for Hospitals).]

[Postcode 1098 in Amsterdam OostParttimeElectric Ant Lab is a simulation software company at the Amsterdam Science Park. Our clients are chemistry focused R&D scientists within large multinationals. They use our simulation models and browser based tool RheoCube as an alternative to the physical lab approach of trial-and-error that is used for prototyping new products and for applied material research.

Our Science & Modelling Team is the scientific client-facing group within Electric Ant Lab. This team consists of simulation modelling experts and scientific consultants who build the models for our clients and assist them with translation of their physical system to the digital lab. Next to customer focus the Science Team is also responsible for the scientific research that is needed to make RheoCube a user-friendly tool.

Check out electricant.com and rheocube.com to get an impression of our services and our virtual lab tool RheoCube.


The Student Research Assistant Role

To help us speed up our research we are looking for (preferably) Chemistry students with some research experience (for example from a bachelor internship). We are looking for students for experimental and literature/theoretical projects, these task can be combined or split depending on the experience of the applicants. All task will be related to HSP and how it can be used as input for simulations. For the experimental part we are looking for someone who has some experience in an analytical lab. This work will be conducted at the location of our partner VLCI (vlci.biz), also located at Science Park Amsterdam. For the literature/theoretical part we prefer students with an interest in physical chemistry and thermodynamics.


We prefer students who can work during the summer for about 20 hours per week. More or less hours can be arranged depending on the projects. If successful we might offer you to continue after the summer as a part time job next to your studies.


If you’re interested in being part of an enthusiastic team building the virtual complex-fluids lab of the future, we could be the right fit for you. We offer an inspiring work and team environment, so expect to learn a lot from other chemists and EAL. Or you might even pick up some other skills, e.g. programming or sales.

You can expect a decent salary for this part time job.


General requirements

Background in Chemistry (or related discipline)
Some research experience
Flexible and pro-active attitude
Able to work independently
For the experimental part (at VLCI):

Experience with working in an (analytical)chemistry lab
Safety focused
Accurate worker
For the literature/theory part (at EAL):

Experience in searching, reading and interpretation of scientific literature
Able to draw conclusions from complex scientific data
Some interest in thermodynamics and physical chemistry]

[AmsterdamLow latency, high availability systems
We are a Dutch scale-up founded by David de Jong and Ruben Gersons with offices in Amsterdam and New York. Our focus? Helping advertising technology vendors to discover what (connected) devices belong to the same person and/or household.

This means that we sift through hundreds of billions of lines every day, extracting the most accurate matches.

We are looking for a backend engineer, who will be responsible for creating real-time APIs, some with super low latency requirements, settings up fast distributed value lookups and implementing data security.

Who are you?

2 years of (relevant) experience.
Minimum of bachelor’s degree in computer science, math or engineering (or proof of equal skill level).
Ready to work in a startup environment. Self manageable.
Skills

Expert in coding languages like Go, Node.js.

[AmsterdamWe are looking for a skilled and driven Machine Learning Engineer to help us build the leading trading platform for the heavy machinery industry.

About TRADUS

TRADUS.com ( http://www.tradus.com ) is a global online marketplace for used heavy machinery and commercial vehicles. Our mission is to revolutionize the Heavy Machinery industry by empowering sellers and buyers with smart data to make transactions more efficient and transparent – anywhere in the world.

We currently use ML to give buyers and sellers transparency when searching for a piece of heavy machinery - we call it the Tradus Market Value (TMV). We are committed to delivering working projects, we work in an agile environment, with an 80/20 mindset - we test and learn, and fast.

Your responsibilities:
We're looking for someone to help us truly scale our data operations. You will join our team of data professionals and we expect you to play an important role in our team's growth and capabilities as we scale:


Integrate and ingestion of raw data sources such as transactional platform data and clickstream data
Transform data through scalable ETL pipelines
Design and develop statistical models and machine learning applications together with fellow Data Scientists and Software Engineers
Work with your team on feature engineering
Set up tests and experiments and analyze the results
Deploy and maintain APIs that reliably and with increasing accuracy serve millions of predictions

Your tools include:
AWS (lambda serverless, Redshift, EC2, Sagemaker, Kinesis, etc), Python ML ecosystem, SQL, Matillion ETL

About you

You know your machine learning and you can produce smart models to solve real world problems. Most importantly, you are a good communicator and are able to explain complex problems and engineering challenges to your colleagues:


Experience implementing ML algorithms in high-level languages (e.g. Python)
Experience with ETL processes
Experience in Supervised/Unsupervised Learning.
Experience working with cutting-edge ML frameworks and algorithms.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms & principles, and numerical optimisation
You have excellent development skills, preferably Python ecosystem (e.g. Jupyter, numpy, scikit-learn, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)
Familiarity with AWS (e.g. Sagemaker, Batch, Lambda, Kinesis)
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role
You are an effective communicator; you work well in teams across borders
A degree or qualification in applied sciences, maths or statistics

What we will give you


Sit at the forefront of building an AI/ML based product that revolutionizes a dusty industry with Big Data and smart technology
Join the international Tradus team - 15+ different nationalities of passionate people all learning from one another and hungry to build the best-in-class user experience in Heavy Machinery
International career opportunities within and beyond Tradus - as part of the OLX Group network with more than 5,000 employees in over 40 markets

What does it feel like working at TRADUS?

We are a multicultural team of approximately 20+ passionate and driven startup minds - working to disrupt the way heavy machinery is traded out of our cool central office near the Amstel Station in Amsterdam.

We're focused on building a product our customers love, we value speed over perfection, creativity and risk-taking vs processes and control, and above all we hold ourselves accountable to the growth of TRADUS.

We TeamUp across functions and countries on all things we do. We live the customer and are curious to get to know their pain points inside out – across all different country settings. We take charge and focus on results – to build a successful sustainable business each and every day. We keep it simple – the world is already complicated, so let's simplify whenever we can.]

[AmsterdamExperience: Professional experience in predictive modeling or relevant analytics consulting for a Fortune 500-scale company

Product performance classification approaches

Demonstrate ability to manage multiple priorities and projects, including keeping team to project timelines and expected deliverable quality.

Job_Title: PhD student | ‘Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) guided cardiac ablation’
Job_Description:
[Postcode 1081 in Amsterdam ZuidYour challenge
The cardiac MRI research group of the departments of Cardiology, Radiology and Nuclear Medicine and Biomedical Engineering & Physics of the Amsterdam UMC is hiring a PhD-student to develop MRI techniques and post-processing tools for MRI guided cardiac ablations. Recently, the Amsterdam UMC has launched an ambitious MRI guided cardiac interventions (preclinical and clinical) research program to translate cardiac catheter ablation procedures from an X-ray approach into a fully integrated (diagnostics & therapy) single-modality MRI-guided (radiation-free) strategy.
The aim of the current project is to develop improved real-time 3D catheter tracking and periprocedural lesion visualization during cardiac ablation. In addition, we aim for accelerated image-reconstruction and post-processing.
We will establish a MRI-compatible explanted beating pig heart test platform to develop, test and optimize our MRI techniques as well as our image post-processing strategies. In our group we have developed several strategies for MRI scan acceleration which will be further developed for real-time applications. Tissue mapping strategies during ablation will be validated by histological examinations of the specimens obtained by the MRI-guided biopsies. Achievements will directly be translated to the already running clinical MRI-guided cardiac interventions program.

Your profile
We are looking for a candidate with an MSc degree in Biomedical Engineering, Biomedical Sciences, Physics or computer science, a solid mathematical background, sound programming skills or similar, as well as affinity to translational research with a keen interest in applying advanced techniques in medical research to improve -cardiac- care.
Basic knowledge of magnetic resonance, numerical optimization, or image analysis is an advantage. Our preferred candidate is a positively minded scientist and teamplayer, able to work both independently and in a multidisciplinary team, has good communication skills, with verbal and written skills in English, motivated to learn new approaches and ready to work hard to build an international scientific career. Knowledge and experience in pulse programming, reconstruction and post processing of MRI data and programming skills (Python, Matlab) is highly desirable.

Your work environment
We offer a resourceful, multidisciplinary and stimulating scientific environment, allowing for top-notch translational clinical research. We are well-equipped with several state-of-the-art 1.5 and 3.0 Tesla MRI scanners. You will be working in an international team of both technical and clinical researchers. The PhD project will be jointly supervised by experts in medical imaging (prof. Gustav Strijkers and prof. Aart Nederveen) as well as by clinical experts in the field of clinical cardiac MRI and interventional cardiology (dr. Marco Götte and dr. Cor Allaart, respectively).

We offer
Salary Scale PHD: 2422 tot 3103 euro gross when employed full-time (depending on qualifications and experience).

In addition we offer:
– The base salary does not include allowances for irregular shifts, holiday pay (8%) and a year-end bonus (8.3%).
– Pension is accrued at the ABP. VUmc contributes a large part of the premium (70%).
– In addition to excellent accessibility by public transport, we reimburse 75% of your OV travel costs (commuting costs).

The position is for 4 years and is available immediately.
Working at Amsterdam UMC means working in an inspiring and professional environment in which developing one`s talents and skills is encouraged. We offer you ample opportunity for development, deepening and broadening, additional training and a place to grow! Working at Amsterdam UMC, VUmc location means working in an inspiring and professional environment where development is encouraged in every espect.

For more information about our employment conditions, please visit our website.

Information and application
Don’t hesitate to call us!
If you’re interested about this position, you can contact prof. Aart Nederveen or dr. Marco Götte, via telephone number +31 (0)20 444 0123.
If you need more information about the application procedure, contact Brend de Jong, corporate recruiter at + 31 (0)20 444 5635.

You can apply till 1 December 2019 by using the apply button.

Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.]

Zij hebben belangrijke samenwerkingen in elk continent. Omdat hun impact zo groot is zien zij in dat zij ook een maatschappelijke waarde te vervullen hebben. Hierbij investeren ze veel in de infrastructuur en hebben zij 12x een Duurzaamheid Award gewonnen. Daarnaast heeft jouw nieuwe werkgever meerdere malen in de top 10 gestaan voor meest favoriete werkgever van Nederland. Jij bent nu nodig! Jij zal het eerste aanspreekpunt worden van een team van 4FTE. Hierbij zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor coaching en persoonlijke ontwikkelingvan de teamleden. Het plannen voor de resources van het team en het zorgdragen voor de juiste competenties en vaardigheden. Samen met jouw team analyseer en optimaliseer jij de totale cross device customer journey en hou jij je bezig met het bouwen van een machine learning modelen het uitvoeren van een exploraty data analyses. Aan de hand van deze inzichten kunnen zij hun media inkoop bepalen. Jouw afdeling bestaat uit 25 collega’s met 5 teams. Met jouw werkzaamheden zal je naast Data Scientisten en Marketing nauw samenwerken met Web Analisten, Development, Sales.
Wat wordt er van jou verwacht?
Minimaal HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau
Minimaal drie jaar relevante ervaring
Je bent bekend met Python, Spark, R en Google BigQuery

Je spreekt zowel Nederlands als Engels

[Amsterdam€2.835 - €4.274 per maandScientific Programmer Computational Biomedicine
Faculty of Science – Informatics Institute
Werken bij de UvA
Werken bij de UvA
Vacatures
Scientific Programmer Computational Biomedicine
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Werk en privé
Loopbaanontwikkeling en professionalisering
Academische omgeving
HR Excellence in Research
Promoveren
Informatie voor sollicitanten
Relink: werkervaringsproject voor vluchtelingen
Scientific Programmer Computational Biomedicine
Publicatiedatum 1 november 2019

Sluitingsdatum 31 december 2019

Opleidingsniveau Master's degree

Functieomvang 38 hours per week

Salarisindicatie €2,835 to €4,274 gross per month

Vacaturenummer 19-737

We seek a highly qualified scientific programmer for advanced applications in relation to Computational Biomedicine, executing on high-end massively parallel computing systems.
What are you going to do?
The main focus will be on the development and maintenance of our software portfolio (for an example see our open-source cellular flow modelling toolkit Hemocell and to contribute to workflows in relation to in-silico stroke trials (see INSIST). You will work, together with PhD students and Postdocs, on new, specialized applications of our software, as well as on improving the performance of our software. These applications are often embedded in large international projects in cooperation with external partners in e.g. Sheffield, London, or Geneva. You will support our scientific team to realize efficient HPC simulation solutions with these codes.
This position can give grounds to fast professional development in parallel numerical techniques, simulation methods, and application of state-of-the-art computational solutions for large-scale systems, and High Performance Computing on Europe’s largest supercomputers.
What do we require?
The candidates should have at least a Master’s degree in Computational Science or a related field, with experience in High Performance Computing. The candidate should be first and foremost an excellent programmer, fluent in C++ and Python, with experience in complex software engineering projects, including collaborative software development. Since most work revolves around numerical modelling, knowledge and general interest of solving scientific problems with numerical techniques is important. Furthermore, most work is done in collaboration with others, therefore the will and the capability to communicate with scientists from different disciplines (for instance biomedicine, physics, computer science) is necessary.
The following is considered an advantage for this position:
experience with scientific codes, including open-source ones such as: Palabos, HemeLB, Espresso, LAMMPS;
knowledge of HPC job scheduling systems (e.g. slurm, PBS);
knowledge of any of the following programming languages: Fortran, C#, Java, julia;
knowledge of the lattice Boltzmann method;
knowledge of workflow systems, e.g. Taverna;
familiarity with container technologies (e.g. Docker, Singularity);
motivation to read, process, and understand scientific papers (maybe even author a few).
Our offer
A temporary contract for 38 hours per week for a period of three years in the rank of ‘ICT developer’.
The salary, depending on qualifications and relevant experience before the beginning of the employment contract, will be €2,835 to € 3,895 (scale 9) to €2,709 to €4,274 (scale 10) gross per month, based on fulltime (38 hours a week), exclusive 8 % holiday allowance and 8.3 % end-of-year bonus. A favorable tax agreement, the ‘30% ruling’, may apply to non-Dutch applicants. Please note that for this position you have to be permitted to work in the Netherlands. The Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities is applicable.
Some further things we offer:
very friendly, interactive and international working environment;
new building located near the city center (20 minutes by bicycle) of one of Europe’s most beautiful and lively cities;
access to high-end computing facilities (e.g. cluster with 4,000+ cores).
English is the working language within the Informatics Institute. Moreover, since Amsterdam is a very international city where almost everybody speaks and understands English, candidates need not be afraid of the language barrier.
Are you curious about our extensive package of secondary employment benefits? Then find out more about working at the Faculty of Science.
Questions?
Do you have questions about this vacancy? Or do you want to know more about our organisation? Please contact:
Prof. Alfons Hoekstra
T: +31 (0)20 525 7543
About the Faculty of Science
The Faculty of Science has a student body of around 6,500, as well as 1,600 members of staff working in education, research or support services. Researchers and students at the Faculty of Science are fascinated by every aspect of how the world works, be it elementary particles, the birth of the universe or the functioning of the brain.
The mission of the Informatics Institute is to perform curiosity-driven and use-inspired fundamental research in Computer Science. The main research themes are Artificial Intelligence, Computational Science and Systems and Network Engineering. Our research involves complex information systems at large, with a focus on collaborative, data driven, computational and intelligent systems, all with a strong interactive component.
The Computational Science Lab of the Informatics Institute aims to make dynamic complex systems tractable via computational science. We study a broad range of dynamics systems in fields ranging from biomedicine to urban, or socioeconomic systems. We also develop theory of dynamic complex systems based on concepts of information processing.
Job application
The UvA is an equal-opportunity employer. We prioritise diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We value a spirit of enquiry and perseverance, provide the space to keep asking questions, and promote a culture of curiosity and creativity.
The Informatics Institute strives for a better gender balance in its staff. We therefore strongly encourage women to apply for this position.
Do you recognize yourself in the job profile? Then we look forward to receiving your CV and cover letter by 31 december 2019. You may apply online by using the link below.
Applications should include:
a curriculum vitae (including an url allowing download of pdf of MSc thesis - if relevant);
a letter of motivation (at most 1 page) explaining why you are interested in this position;
a list of all university courses taken, including a transcript of grades;
the name and contact details (including email address) of two referees who can provide details about your profile (one of whom should be the main supervisor of your Master thesis).
 #LI-DNP
No agencies please]

[AmsterdamBepaalde tijdGÉANT operates a variety of services, spanning from network, cloud and Trust and Identity services.

Building on the success of federated access, GÉANT has developed the eduTEAMS service, which is part of the Trust and Identity portfolio.
eduTEAMS enables research communities to securely access and share common resources and services. Leveraging the federated identities available from the global eduGAIN service as well as identities handled by social identity providers (i.e. Google, Facebook, etc.), eduTEAMS enables collaborative communities (such as research communities) to securely authenticate and identify their users, organize them in groups, assign them roles and centrally manage access rights for their resources.

In this varied and exciting role, you will be responsible for further development and operation of eduTEAMS. You will join the eduTEAMS DevOps team which comprises already a number of experienced developers and System Engineers. You will be following the agile methodology and will be interacting with the rest of the team.
This is a permanent and full-time role in our office in Amsterdam. It will be offered as a 1-year definite contract, with the possibility of becoming indefinite thereafter.

Our ideal candidate
To be successful in this role you must have proficiency with Linux Distribution (Debian / Ubuntu / CentOS) and the command line. You must have In-depth knowledge of Python and be proficient with git and git workflows. Hands-on experience with software automation and in-depth knowledge of Ansible are both required.
We are looking for someone who enjoys working in an open and collaborative manner while working on large, complex software projects.

Why work for GÉANT?
We offer a blazing-fast, cutting-edge network that connects scientists, researchers and academics across Europe and the world.
Thanks to our terabit network, 50 million researchers, scientists, academics and students can share record volumes of data unconstrained by location, solving some of mankind’s biggest challenges.
Work at GÉANT and you’ll be supporting critical research into sustainable energy, deep space, high-energy physics, earth observation, environmental disasters, medicine and more!

Benefits of working for GÉANT
You’ll receive excellent benefits at GÉANT – we offer a generous holiday allowance and a 5% end of year allowance as standard. We also invest heavily in learning to help our people become the best at what they do.
Where the role and service allow, we offer flexible working (around core business hours) and the opportunity to work from home on an occasional basis.
The other benefits you receive will depend on the country you are employed in, but you can rest assured that these will include an appropriate pension scheme and the possibility of joining a collective medical insurance.]

Job_Title: PhD position in Gravitational Wave astrophysics
Job_Description:
[Postcode 1098 in Amsterdam OostTijdelijkPhD position in Gravitational Wave astrophysics
PhD position in Gravitational Wave astrophysics
Published Deadline Location

18 Oct 15 Jan Amsterdam

JOB DESCRIPTION
The gravitational physics group at Nikhef invites applications for a PhD position in gravitational wave astrophysics
with an emphasis on signals from binary neutron star and neutron star-black hole coalescences

Nikhef is the national institute for subatomic physics in The Netherlands. At Nikhef, approximately 175 physicists and 75 technical staff members work together on theoretical and experimental research in the fields of particle- and astroparticle physics. Nikhef includes a collaboration between 6 major Dutch universities and the Nikhef research institute.

The position
The successful candidate will be part of the team of data analysts and phenomenologists led by Prof. Dr. C. Van Den Broeck and Dr. S. Caudill, which currently consists of 4 postdocs and 4 PhD students and will grow substantially over the next year. In addition, the gravitational physics division at Nikhef (led by Prof. F. Linde) has close ties with gravitational wave researchers at universities and institutes across the Netherlands, which apart from instrumentalists includes astronomers, astrophysicists, and theorists, such as Baumann, Bertone, Groot, Hinderer, Jonker, Levan, Moesta, Nelemans, and Nissanke. There is also vibrant collaboration with individuals and groups around the world.
REQUIREMENTS
Requirements We are looking for a candidate with a (almost) completed master degree in physics, in a relevant field. The ideal candidate has a strong interest in data analysis and has some research experience in astrophysics.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT
Offer
The candidate will be employed by the NWO-I-foundation and will obtain the status of junior scientist. He/she will receive a 4 year contract. Your gross monthly starting salary will be € 2.346,-, increasing to € 3.007,- in the fourth year. The conditions of employment of the NWO-I-foundation are excellent and can be found on www.nwo-i.nl.

Information and application
Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply by clicking the 'Apply Now' button below. Please be prepared to upload a cover letter, research statement and curriculum vitae. Also, please have the email addresses ready of at least one reference who is willing to send a letter of recommendation on your behalf. The deadline for full consideration is January 15th, 2020.

Further information can be obtained from Prof. Dr. C. Van Den Broeck (vdbroeck@nikhef.nl)]

[Postcode 1062 in Amsterdam Nieuw-WestThe marketing department at ZIVVER is not the usual one, we are part of a company that is growing in breakneck speed, so there is never a dull moment with us. Are you ready to delete the word repetition out of your vocabulary? Look no further!


The Marketing and Sales Data Analyst is at the core of everything we do in Marketing and Sales. Based on your deep analysis, understanding of customer behavior, trends and insights you form the basis of future decisions. This is one of the most important and crucial roles in the Marketing team. It encompasses building fully transparent marketing funnels and reports, doing statistical analysis to find behavioural trends and helping the team to be more data driven in everything they do, from Facebook campaigns to cold-calls to industry events. An awesome role in an awesome company.


Hot take

ROI is king.
People who 'want to do more with AI' make you itch.
Value delivered over technical novelty.


A day at ZIVVER

You walk into the office with a crystal clear picture of what you want to get done today. You combine driving structural improvements in data infrastructure and analysis with serving the ongoing data needs of marketing and sales and need great focus to balance the two.


You start off by responding to comments from the data team on your merge request. You are working on connecting web traffic data to data on sales opportunities in the data warehouse to better analyze the return on marketing spend. Having handled the comments, you join the data team stand-up and talk the team through your progress and your plan for the day.


Next, you check in with the marketing team to report on your findings about a recent LinkedIn campaign that we ran. You recommend that we keep producing content on this topic, but try to more specifically target information security officers. The VP marketing mentions that a similar campaign was done a few months ago and asks you to confirm this by looking into which of leads generated by that campaign were actually converted to closed deals.

While you are at this, one of your sales colleagues stops by to ask about a lead qualification model that you recently released. Explaining is your thing: in less than 10 minutes the salesperson knows exactly which of his leads are hot and sprints back to his desk to start calling.


Near the end of the day you are done with the campaign analysis and can confirm that focusing on information security officers seems to give the best return. You see that your changes to the data warehouse have been accepted and released. You go home satisfied, knowing that you helped the sales and marketing teams determine what to do and that because of your work on infrastructure, you can do this even better tomorrow.


Responsibility

Meeting the short- and long term data needs of the marketing and sales teams, by

Defining and prioritising data solutions (one-off analyses, dashboards, models, data infrastructure) to build.
Giving engineers input on infrastructure requirements for exposing useful data.
Building data solutions to convert exposed data to actionable insights.
Driving the basing of actions on insights through education and evangelization.


Benefits

Ownership: you own data for sales and marketing. You will be instrumental in making our most important business area much more effective;
An exciting, fast-growing, energetic environment;
Flexible working hours;
A pension plan;
Free lunch;
Great office and awesome people with different nationalities;
At least €1.000,- per year on personal development budget.

Skills / Experience

3-5 years experience with data analysis in a fast growth organisation.
Technical background (physics, computer science, econometrics, etc.).
Proven ability to define and prioritize projects based on business value.
SQL knowledge and experience.
Experience with analyzing data...
for B2B marketing purposes.
for related commercial areas, such as B2B software sales and customer success.
using HubSpot, Google Analytics or Salesforce.
Knowledge of Python, R or another scripting language.


Attitude / Personality

Pragmatic: business value over tinkering.
Curious: willing and able to learn fast.
Open to feedback.
Humble: make other teams successful.
Proactive: drive business value]
