[Postcode 1076 in Amsterdam ZuidParttimeMachine Learning + Software Engineering Researcher in the project “Fine-Grained Analysis of Software Ecosystems as Networks” (FASTEN)
Location: Amsterdam
Project duration: 2 years
Start date: 2020
Summary
This position offers the unique opportunity to progress your research career in a challenging industrial context, focusing on innovation and pragmatic solutions for software improvement, while still maintaining scientific standards of quality. The Software Improvement Group has research at its core, with a dedicated research team hosting several PhD and Postdoc researchers, several active collaborations with academic partners, and plenty of colleagues with PhD degrees. The FASTEN project asks for a rich skillset: software engineering expertise combined with machine learning and/or statistical techniques, scientific curiosity and proficiency, the ability to publish, and the drive to integrate research results into daily practice. In this position you will be creating the next-gen software risk analysis models and tools, which will have a lasting impact on software development practice.
About SIG
SIG gives technology leaders the visibility they need to address current software problems and prevent future ones from ever happening. Drawing on proprietary methods and decades of expertise, SIG helps organisations fundamentally improve the security and performance of the enterprise applications that support every aspect of their businesses.
SIG operates a unique software evaluation laboratory governed by the Quality Management System as required by the ISO/IEC 17025 international standard for testing and calibration laboratories. The only organisation in the world certified by TÜViT for Trusted Product Maintainability, SIG is headquartered in Amsterdam with regional offices in the Nordics, Belgium, Germany and Greece. SIG serves companies in Europe, the United States, and Asia.
About the FASTEN project
Abstract
A popular form of software reuse involves linking open source software (OSS) libraries hosted on centralised code repositories, such as Maven or PyPI. Developers only need to declare dependencies to external libraries, and automated tools make them available to the workspace of the project. As recent events such as the leftpad incident, which led to hundreds of thousands of websites to stop working, and the Equifax data breach, which led to a leak of hundreds of thousands of credit card numbers, have demonstrated, dependencies on networks of external libraries can introduce to projects significant operational and compliance risk as well as difficult to assess security implications. Solving these problems would boost the efficiency and production quality of software development companies by allowing them to reuse OSS code with confidence, covering a large untapped potential.

To address this situation, the FASTEN project introduces fine-grained, method-level, tracking of dependencies on top of existing dependency management networks. Specifically, the project will introduce a service that tracks dependencies at the method call-graph level and performs sophisticated analyses of i) security vulnerability propagation, ii) licensing compliance, and iii) dependency risk profiles. To facilitate adoption, FASTEN will bring those analyses to the hands of developers by integrating the analysis service to popular package managers, for the Java, C, and Python programming languages.
The project consortium consists of Delft University of Technology, Athens Univ. of Economics and Business, Universit à degli studi di Milano, XWiki SAS, Endocode AG, Software Improvement Group, and OW2.


SIG Work Package
SIG is leading the work package titled “Security, Quality and Risk”, which will focus on exploiting the FASTEN techniques for better, more accurate analysis of both the quality and the risks of software systems: a key element in translating the technical achievements of FASTEN to better insights for software development organisations. This work package will develop a method for aggregating properties of libraries and software components. This aggregation can benefit from FASTEN results in two ways: (1) it can be more accurate and insightful by using the detailed insights about the dependencies in software (2) In addition to conventional quality and risk measurements, such as maintainability metrics previously developed and used by SIG. In this work package we will also collect and aggregate the insights from change impact analysis, and compliance work packages, to come up with overall risk profiles of software systems and/or individual libraries.

As an ML+SE Researcher you will be providing SIG’s contribution to the FASTEN project. This consists of both conceptual and applied research in the intersection of the machine learning and software engineering research fields, aiming for concrete innovations within the company. You will be tasked e.g. with creating new conceptual risk models regarding quality and security based on the FASTEN dependency networks, prototyping ML and/or statistical solutions, performing validation studies, generating exploitation ideas, and helping drive integration with the company’s existing software stack.
You will be part of the Research team at SIG’s Amsterdam office, where you will participate in team activities, get coaching from senior staff, and have day-to-day interaction opportunities with the consulting and software development branches within the company.
PhD(preferred) or MSc degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Artificial Intelligence.
Excellent ML and data science skills: R, Python, TensorFlow, Keras, or similar toolsets.
Ample of experience with software engineering in general-purpose technologies.
Skills and experience in empirical research, preferably with industry.
Strong analytical and communication skills, able to coach fellow researchers and interns.
Track-record of dissemination and ambition to further increase (academic) visibility.
Affinity with a business environment and a client-oriented culture.
3+ years of research experience, of which a minimum of 1 year in IT industry.
Excellent command of English (both verbally and in writing).]

[Postcode 1017 in Amsterdam CentrumWill you join us on a journey to disrupt the trillion dollar travel industry? We are looking for the best and brightest who share our passion for travellers, data, and product.


FindHotel believes travel is the one thing that really opens minds to new ideas, cultures, and ways of thinking. Our mission is to get every traveller in the world the best accommodation deal. From adventure travel and backpacking to honeymoons and family vacations, we deeply care so that every traveller can make the best informed accommodation choice at the absolute best conditions for every trip.


We are growing fast and looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join us in becoming a global travel category leader.

We build highly performant, scalable services and components that power our product and provide our users with the best content and deals the accommodation industry has to offer. Scalability, reliability, and great performances are the core of what we build. We work with modern stacks (Go, Elixir, Node.js, Python) and, as we embrace the DevOps culture, our infrastructure-as-code in the cloud (AWS) is managed via tools like Docker, Jenkins, and Terraform.


Should you join us, not only you will get exposed to some bright engineers with a passion for delivering great software, you will also get the chance to collaborate with team members from a broader range of disciplines, including data analysts and scientists, product owners, UX experts, and marketing specialists.


What you will actually be doing / responsibilities

Work in a team to solve challenging problems, integrating accommodation providers and building blazing-fast services that serve their data
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities for improvements in terms of performance and code quality
Help improving our infrastructure and scale it to support our continuous growth in a cost-effective way
Support the growth of junior and intermediate engineers by coaching them in their daily tasks, as well as raising the bar of how things are done within both your team and the bigger engineering group
What a day in the office might look like

In the morning, you and your fellow engineers sit down with the Product Owner to discuss the performance of a not-so-fast API endpoint. Comparing the ideal performance to the data collected by our monitoring systems, you brainstorm together a few ideas of how to improve the service's performance and design a scalable solution. After lunch, you jump onto an open issue and prepare a pull request that improves the infrastructure's reliability for one of the most delicate components. Before the end of the day, you put together some ideas on how to improve another component's design and organize an architecture review session with some engineers across teams to discuss the benefits and costs of your proposed solution.

Who we are looking for / requirements

You have at least 6 years experience in back-end development using a modern set up and tooling
You have a great understanding of APIs, databases, data structures, queues, and all things back-end, with a strong passion for automation
You have worked on a production system that was exposed to significant scale (whether traffic or amount of data) and you are excited by these kinds of challenges
You have a sense of pragmatism, constantly finding the right balance between achieving technical excellence and delivering value to the end users
You are flexible, curious, and data-guided in helping us decide what to work on next
You engage with your team and all the engineering group actively, sharing knowledge and best practices in order to improve with them every day
You have production experience working with AWS and you have taken care of CI / deployments / infrastructure in the past
Production experience with Golang is a big plus
Experience with Terraform is a nice to have
Do you want to know if FindHotel is the right place for you? Find out by reading our CEO's blog post

What we need you for:
We need you to maintain and optimize our current infrastructure. You will build new scalable ingestion components, as well as guide our data scientists and engineers into getting their code into production in a responsible manner. In your role as an SRE you are part of the infrastructure team and work closely with our R&D team. As we know that focus is key for an SRE we will not bother you with customer products, front-end development or other distractions so you can fully focus on technical challenges.

Responsibilities include:
Develop and maintain our high performance infrastructure
Improve scalability and efficiency of our infrastructure.
Guide our data scientists into writing reliable code that integrates with our systems
Manage the metrics, alerting and general signaling of all our systems
Automate common tasks within our infrastructure
Document and communicate architecture
Investigate malfunctions in our infrastructure

Deployment: Ansible, Bash, Google Cloud, AWS, Linux
ML: Python, PyTorch, OpenNMT, CUDA

Competitive pay: good primary and secondary benefits

International team
Personal development: surrounded by the best and brightest tech talent
Flat hierarchy where your work will directly touch our clients
Catered lunch and Friday afternoon drinks

What working at Owlin is like
Take your bike, tram or just walk to our office in the center of Amsterdam (De Pijp). Gaze at the queue of tourists in line for the Heineken Brewery and, as you arrive, remind yourself that your office has a better view and a better terrace than the late Freddy Heineken.

You determine your own starting time at Owlin, but we usually start around 9 o’clock. We try to keep the office a bit quiet during the mornings so that everybody can find a concentrated work environment. Around noon every day, we all have a big (and free) lunch together. We have a diverse team with multiple nationalities and try to keep our lunches just as varied. We typically discuss any kind of topic, from the latest television series to the impact of gravity on light, while eating.

Everybody works in the same space at large personal desks, and we even offer some smaller spaces where you can sit to discuss or program meetings with your colleagues. If we are discussing our work, it really doesn’t matter what your job title or background is; we take pride in always letting the best arguments win the discussion. People with a vision and a drive to change things get a lot of freedom and recognition at Owlin for their efforts.]

[AmsterdamStage3D Hubs is more than 3D printing, and we're only getting BIGGER!

The 3DHubs R&D Department is looking for an intern starting from January 2020.

3D Hubs makes high-quality manufacturing methods instantly accessible to Engineers all over the world with our digital platform. And behind the scenes we're equipping our Software Products for ever more tangible applications within the $13 trillion Manufacturing Industry. This is an Internship position in an R&D team that designs and builds mathematical models and Machine Learning algorithms. These models analyse and generate pricing for three dimensional CAD designs for Mechanical Engineers from all over the world, prior to their automated manufacturing by our network of suppliers. Highly organized and structured worker

Why 3D Hubs?

Dynamic, international team of 80+ people from (30+ nationalities), growing to 100+ this year
Awesome office location in the Amsterdam Houthavens
Free healthy lunches and team bonding over Friday events
Learn more about us on our Office Instagram and Careers page
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

The story of 3D Hubs
3D Hubs makes manufacturing easy from prototyping to production. The online platform provides readily available production capacity for the fastest lead times and most price-competitive parts. Simply upload designs to receive instant quotes for 3D printing, CNC machining and Injection Molding. 3D Hubs’ automated Design for Manufacturing (DFM) analysis detects any potential issues before production begins, eliminating risk for customers.

Founded in 2013, 3D Hubs has produced more than 2,000,000 parts, serving engineering companies of all sizes.
Apply for this job]

[AmsterdamYour job
The Senior Model Validator is a member of the ALM & Capital Model Validation team as an expert model validator. The Senior Validator performs high quality validations mainly in the ALM & Capital domain. These validations contribute to identifying and mitigating the model risk at ABN AMRO in line with internal and external requirements and reflecting best market practices. The Senior Model Validator has in-depth specialist knowledge of the models used for risk management in the ALM and/or EC area, methodologies and the business using these, as well as of processes relevant to their area of expertise. The Senior forms an independent expert view on the mathematical consistency of the models, their suitability for the intended use, the accuracy of the models and their proposed implementation. The Senior Model Validator has a coaching role towards the Model Validator and Associate Model Validators. In addition, the Senior can act as a delegate for the Team Lead Model Validation.
Your working environment
The Model Risk Management department consists of four Model Validation teams (Innovation & Projects, Credit Risk Model Validation, ALM & Capital Model Validation and Valuation & Market Risk Model Validation) and one Model Risk Management Office. Together these teams safeguard the Model Risk Management Framework of the bank. Validation is a powerful tool in model risk management and is a regulatory obligation. In this context, validation refers to the critical inspection of a model by a department separate from the one developing the model. The findings of the validation are presented in a validation report. Such a report will typically contain a recommendation towards the risk committee mandated to grant model approvals, as well as proposals for mitigating action in case model deficiencies have been identified. The ALM & Capital Model team validates the models employed for managing the market (e.g. interest rate) and liquidity risks associated with the products in the banking book of the ABN AMRO Bank. The scope of this validation team includes a variety of models ranging from the behavioural Interest Rate Mortgage Model to Market Risk in the Banking Book Economic Capital model. The validator in this team has a key role of:
assessing the quality of the data used for the development of the prototype model;
examining the correctness of the methodology and assumptions;
forming independent opinion on the model’s performance;
assessing the compliance of the model with respect to internal and external regulations;
checking the final implementation of the model in the production environment;
The team examines, verifies and challenges various modelling techniques scaling from logistic regressions and time-series analysis to Monte-Carlo simulations and machine learning techniques. The validators often employ those for building challenger models as an alternative to the methods proposed by Modelling. By analysing the key components of the model the validator identify issues, proposes improvement opportunities, identifies the model risk and shares the result with relevant parties. The team creates high quality validation reports and provides them to the senior management as well as to other key stakeholders. The ALM & Capital Model Validation team has a mandate to escalate the issues to the CRO of the bank.
Your profile
General- University degree in a quantitative discipline, e.g. (financial) mathematics, (theoretical) physics, econometrics or similar, at least at Master level. A PhD and/or additional. Qualification (e.g. FRM, CFA, CQF certificates, or second Master degree in economics, finance or similar) is desirable.
At least 8 years of relevant work experience in a quantitative role in the financial industry (e.g. modeller, model validator, quantitative risk manager, quant developer, quantitative consultant) and/or in related research.Full professional proficiency of English, capable to influence internal stakeholders.Specific knowledgeKnowledge, understanding of and experience with:Time series analyses and forecasting;Monte-Carlo simulation;Behavioural models;Econometrics and/or fundaments of Mathematical Finance, Statistical and Numerical Methods used in Quantitative Finance.Is at pace with the most recent developments in the field:Expert experience with and understanding of Interest Rate Risk, Liquidity Risk, Funds Transfer Price and/or Economic Capital models.Expert experience in handling, pre-processing and assessing the quality of (large) data sets.Advanced experience with modern programming languages, e.g. Python, MATLAB, C++ and/or database tooling, e.g., SQL, SAS and their application in statistical analysis.Proficient knowledge of MS Office programmes, in particular Word and Excel.Knowledge of ABN AMRO’s data landscape and business objectives.
What we offer
International multi-cultural working environment
Great colleagues
Challenging work
Unique opportunity to interact with multiple departments within the bank
Flexible working hours
Future career development
Wide-range of training courses
Competitive salary and excellent benefits
Interested?
At ABN AMRO, we use our knowledge, expertise and network to help our clients within and outside the Netherlands achieve their goals based on responsible decisions. Our clients’ interests always come first. We want clients to understand our products, and we sometimes say ‘no’ if a product involves a risk that is too high for the client. Putting clients’ interests first also means communicating in plain language and crafting smart solutions that genuinely make a difference. That is our goal. We are ongoing recruiting highly skilled people who can reinforce our team. We are happy receiving your application if you think you meet the recruitment criteria. The interview process consists of multiple interviews in which we focus on your experience, skills and knowledge. Besides that we are also interested to learn more about you; what thrives you, what do you consider as your qualities and area(s) of development. Please get in touch with Sabrina Wandl (sabrina.wandl@nl.abnamro.com, Team Lead) in case you like to learn more about the position and get in touch with Arjan Zwaan (arjan.zwaan@nl.abnamro.com, Recruiter) if you like to learn more about the interview process.Please only apply to one vacancy; the position that fits best with your experience, skills and knowledge.]

Job_Title: PhD student, AI for good: Crowdsourced Data Science for Responsible Production
Job_Description:
[Postcode 1012 in Amsterdam Centrum€2.325 - €2.972 per maandThe Amsterdam Business School (ABS) is one of the two schools of the University of Amsterdam’s Faculty of Economics and Business. The school’s core subjects are Corporate Governance, Entrepreneurship, and Big Data / Business Analytics. The ABS has almost 3,000 students and the equivalent of 120 full-time academic staff. This faculty is divided among six sections (Accounting, Entrepreneurship & Innovation, Finance, Leadership & Management, International Strategy & Marketing, and Operations Management) that conduct top-level research published in prestigious international journals.
The International Strategy & Marketing section and the Data Science for Business Analytics chair are looking for a PhD candidate for an interdisciplinary project using computer science to design accountability innovations aiming to improve responsible production in developing countries with weak institutions. The technology will increase transparency, allowing stakeholders such as practitioners, civil society activists, and community organizers to raise attention to irresponsible production and labour violations, as well as highlight initiatives to promote responsible production and decent work. The project aims to promote stakeholder dialogue to promote businesses accountability for remedies, and justice for vulnerable individuals and communities impacted by business supply chains in Africa. This project will be undertaken in close collaboration with the Computer Science Department of the VU Amsterdam, specifically, the focus on AI for good / ICT for development (ICT4D).
Job description
Are you the excellent AI, data science, or computer science student that wants to pursue AI for good? Do you want to develop innovative techniques that can make a real change in society? If the answer is yes than this is the position for you. In the CARPA project you will extend a mobile app to crowdsource data in targeted countries in Africa. You will then research and develop data science techniques (machine learning, predictive modeling, information visualization, interactive learning) to improve data quality, analyze this data and make it available through a web based application. Relevant research questions include the following:
Whether technology-based accountability innovations can improve corporate governance and sustainable corporate behavior in states with weak institutions?
How to optimize the user experience to ensure uptake of the App and website by interested stakeholders and how best to ensure the quality, quantity, and reliability of crowdsourcing contributions?
How to contextualize this information in an automatic manner, and how to provide access to this data in a way that supports deep understanding of the results and serendipitous findings?
Successful candidates will present their research findings at prestigious computer science and management science conferences and publish in top-tier journals.
Requirements
A Master’s degree in the area of computer science, data science, artificial intelligence, information technology, business analytics or a related discipline;
excellent grades and a strong interest in applied and quantitative research methods;
motivation to build socially relevant computer science applications (AI for good / ICT for development);
well-developed analytical skills, strong organization and communication skills, an entrepreneurial mind set, and perseverance;
the ability to work independently and to be proactive in developing the research project;
good programming skills in e.g. Python and Javascript, experience in developing apps and web based solutions;
mastery of both written and spoken English. Working knowledge of French is helpful.
Position entails possibility to travel to workshops in South Africa, Mali, Rwanda and/or Democratic Republic of Congo.
Further information
Further information may be obtained from:
Michelle Westermann-Behaylo
Marcel Worring
or
Victor de Boer
Appointment
We offer a challenging job with ample opportunity for personal development in an attractive international work environment. ABS is a growing, research driven business school at an internationally recognized university that has the ambition to become a leading international player in the field of management research and education. ABS is located in the heart of Amsterdam, the cultural and financial capital of the Netherlands. Amsterdam offers a cosmopolitan living environment with excellent connections to the rest of the world.
You will be appointed for an initial period of 18 months with a possibility to extend it for another 2,5 years, pending positive evaluation. As part of your contract, you will spend 20% of your time on teaching. You will be classified as PhD candidate (promovendus) in the Dutch University job-ranking system (UFO), providing a gross monthly starting salary of €2.325 in the first year (which increases to €2.972 in the final year) with an additional end-of-year bonus (8.3%) and holiday allowance (8%), in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities.
Job application
The UvA is an equal-opportunity employer. We prioritise diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We value a spirit of enquiry and perseverance, provide the space to keep asking questions, and promote a culture of curiosity and creativity.
Applicants should send a letter of application accompanied by a curriculum vitae and names of references. In addition, applicants should include a copy of their Master thesis. Applicants that are currently studying for a Master degree should include a short description of their Master thesis project (max. 2 pages) and a copy of their Bachelor thesis. Please include the job reference number.
The closing date is 1 December 2019. You may apply electronically by clicking on the link below. We cannot process applications if they are not send through that link. #LI-DNP
No agencies please]

[AmsterdamWe are looking for a skilled and driven Machine Learning Engineer to help us build the leading trading platform for the heavy machinery industry.
About TRADUS
TRADUS.com is a global online marketplace for used heavy machinery and commercial vehicles. Our mission is to revolutionize the Heavy Machinery industry by empowering sellers and buyers with smart data to make transactions more efficient and transparent – anywhere in the world.
We currently use ML to give buyers and sellers transparency when searching for a piece of heavy machinery - we call it the Tradus Market Value (TMV). We are committed to delivering working projects, we work in an agile environment, with an 80/20 mindset - we test and learn, and fast.
Your responsibilities:
We’re looking for someone to help us truly scale our data operations. You will join our team of data professionals and we expect you to play an important role in our team’s growth and capabilities as we scale:
Integrate and ingestion of raw data sources such as transactional platform data and clickstream data
Transform data through scalable ETL pipelines
Design and develop statistical models and machine learning applications together with fellow Data Scientists and Software Engineers
Work with your team on feature engineering
Set up tests and experiments and analyze the results
Deploy and maintain APIs that reliably and with increasing accuracy serve millions of predictions
Your tools include:
AWS (lambda serverless, Redshift, EC2, Sagemaker, Kinesis, etc), Python ML ecosystem, SQL, Matillion ETL
About you
You know your machine learning and you can produce smart models to solve real world problems. Most importantly, you are a good communicator and are able to explain complex problems and engineering challenges to your colleagues:
Experience implementing ML algorithms in high-level languages (e.g. Python)
Experience with ETL processes
Experience in Supervised/Unsupervised Learning.
Experience working with cutting-edge ML frameworks and algorithms.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms & principles, and numerical optimisation
You have excellent development skills, preferably Python ecosystem (e.g. Jupyter, numpy, scikit-learn, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)
Familiarity with AWS (e.g. Sagemaker, Batch, Lambda, Kinesis)
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role
You are an effective communicator; you work well in teams across borders
A degree or qualification in applied sciences, maths or statistics
What we will give you
Sit at the forefront of building an AI/ML based product that revolutionizes a dusty industry with Big Data and smart technology
Join the international Tradus team - 15+ different nationalities of passionate people all learning from one another and hungry to build the best-in-class user experience in Heavy Machinery
International career opportunities within and beyond Tradus - as part of the OLX Group network with more than 5,000 employees in over 40 markets
What does it feel like working at TRADUS?
We are a multicultural team of approximately 20+ passionate and driven startup minds - working to disrupt the way heavy machinery is traded out of our cool central office near the Amstel Station in Amsterdam.
We’re focused on building a product our customers love, we value speed over perfection, creativity and risk-taking vs processes and control, and above all we hold ourselves accountable to the growth of TRADUS.
We TeamUp across functions and countries on all things we do. We live the customer and are curious to get to know their pain points inside out – across all different country settings. We take charge and focus on results – to build a successful sustainable business each and every day. We keep it simple – the world is already complicated, so let’s simplify whenever we can.]

Job_Title: Stageplaats data analyse bij het Smart Citizens Lab
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamStageGa jij graag nieuwe uitdagingen aan op het gebied van Citizen Science? Wil jij ons helpen om onze data analyse workflow verder te ontwikkelen en te delen? En ben je goed in het vertalen van data naar bruikbare inzichten? Kom dan stage lopen bij het Code-team en draag bij aan een reeks projecten van het Smart Citizens Lab.

In het Smart Citizens Lab verkennen we de tools en applicaties waarmee burgers de wereld om zich heen in kaart kunnen brengen. In de afgelopen jaren zijn diverse open hardware tools beschikbaar gekomen en online dataplatforms ontwikkeld waarmee burgers de mogelijkheid hebben gekregen om zélf hun omgeving te meten en actie te ondernemen. Door het gezamenlijk meten van de omgeving krijgen mensen meer inzicht in de effecten hun eigen omgeving en hun leefstijl. Binnen het Smart Citizens Lab onderzoeken we hoe sensortechnologie bij kan dragen aan het verstevigen van de rol van de burger in vraagstukken rondom leefbaarheid en duurzaamheid.
Wat ga je doen?
Je komt te werken bij het Code-team in het Smart Citizens Lab, en werkt samen met sterk inhoudelijk gedreven collega’s op het gebied van technologie en maatschappij (zowel in de organisatie als internationale collega’s). In je stage ga je aan de slag met de diverse facetten van data analyse in verschillende projecten.

In het project Hollandse Luchten onderzoeken we hoe burgers met sensoren meer inzicht kunnen krijgen in luchtkwaliteit. In drie pilots brengen we de luchtkwaliteit in kaart en zetten we de inzichten uit de data gezamenlijk om in oplossingen en actie.
Amsterdam Sounds richt zich op geluidsoverlast in de stad. In nauwe samenwerking met partners faciliteren we Amsterdammers om geluid te meten op plekken in de stad waar veel overlast wordt ervaren. Met dit burgermeetnet willen we ruimte creëren voor een ander gesprek tussen betrokkenen, hernieuwd vertrouwen en nieuw beleid dat aansluit bij de lokale behoefte.

In Mobility Urban Values onderzoeken we hoe co-creatie en co-design overheden en gemeenschappen kunnen ondersteunen bij het herinrichten van mobiliteit in de stedelijke omgeving. Daarbij brengen we ook de leefomgeving in kaart door het meten van de luchtkwaliteit en geluid in de omgeving.
Wie ben jij?
Jij hebt een nieuwsgierige mentaliteit en je kunt goed samenwerken. Je hebt sterke analytische vaardigheden en je voelt je verbonden met de missie van het team: het democratiseren van de toegang tot technologie.

Je volgt een relevante studie;
Ervaring met de data analyse workflow (data opschonen en data analyses, kwaliteit van de resultaten, visualisatie en conclusies trekken);
Affiniteit met het meten en analyseren van: lucht-, water-, geluidskwaliteitdata.
Interesse in validatie, verificatie en normalisatie van sensordata;
Creatieve coder (bijvoorbeeld Python of R);
Interesse in machine learning.
Wij bieden
Je vervult je functie in een dynamische werkomgeving, met veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng en creativiteit. De werklocaties zijn Huis De Pinto en de Waag, in het centrum van Amsterdam. Waag onderschrijft de Code Cultural Governance en Code Culturele Diversiteit. We bieden een stage van vier tot zes maanden (periode is bespreekbaar), waarin je tussen de 24 en 40 uur per week werkt. Stagiairs ontvangen een toelage van 300 euro per maand (op basis van een contract van 40 uur per week).

Voor inhoudelijke vragen naar aanleiding van deze vacature kan je contact opnemen met Judith Veenkamp (020 - 557 9898).]

[AmsterdamWe are Signify, the new company name of Philips Lighting.
We’re the world leader in lighting for professionals, consumers and for the Internet of Things. Our passion for sustainability makes us one of the top 10 greenest companies in the world.

What you’ll need
Are you a highly talented analyst who can support our Leadership Team to make the right decisions? Are you interested in innovation and seeking new challenges? This is a unique opportunity to influence strategy, innovation and growth in a global company. We are looking for you if you can bring together the right balance of analytical insights, problem solving rigor, people skills, and pragmatism to turn your thinking into decisions and actions.

Demonstrable experience in creating (model-based) forecasts
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills; capable of driving insight to action
Fluency in written and spoken English; ability to speak another language (e.g., Dutch, German, Hindi, Mandarin Chinese) is helpful
A willingness to travel (25%)
What you’ll get in return…
Competitive salary depending on experience
A variable bonus based on both Signify results and personal performance
25 Days of holidays and the possibility to purchase up to 20 extra days off annually
Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personalized learning platform, free training and coaching
Solid company pension scheme and attractive collective health insurance package
Opportunity to buy Signify shares and products with discount
What we promise
We’re committed to the continuous development of our employees, using our learning to shape the future of light and create a sustainable future.
Join the undisputed leader in the lighting industry and be part of our diverse global team. #WeAreSignify #SignifyLife]

[AmsterdamFacebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
The Marketing Science measurement team is charged with driving good measurement, demonstrating the ROI/value of the platform, developing best practices and informing product development. The Marketing Science Partner, Benelux position will work with internal and external stakeholders to advise clients and the industry on measurement strategy and work with them on an ongoing basis to adopt better measurement as a way to improve business performance.


Facebook is seeking a highly quantitative measurement professional with direct response/performance market experience to drive the Facebook measurement and Direct Response (DR) strategy for the Benelux region. We're looking for people with strong DR and critical thinking skills to successfully influence how clients, agencies and the wider industry conduct and use measurement.


This role involves developing strong client relationships, engaging and influencing key clients, designing tests and research to help understand and improve the effectiveness of their advertising across digital platforms and across media from a DR perspective.


We are looking for someone with deep digital knowledge plus the ability to work in a complex environment with many stakeholders including product, engineers, creative and marketing. Conclusions from this work will identify how a client can act to drive business impact.


The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook and online advertising, intellectually curious, a fast learner and able to move fast while keeping focused on high impact projects. They should demonstrate a strong understanding of the media landscape and the ability to apply statistical techniques to understand consumer behaviour and advertising effectiveness through innovative analytics, methodologies and products across a number of verticals.


This position is full time and located in our Amsterdam office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with Facebook sales team to drive deep, strategic relationships with Facebook clients and agencies through identity based measurement and ‘learning agendas’ that highlight how a client can improve business outcomes by employing better measurement techniques
Manage a complex set of client relationships across industry and client groups, functions, brands, agencies, to drive clients measurement objectives
Conduct in-depth custom analysis and ad effectiveness studies to understand the relative impact of different marketing strategies across digital platforms and across media
Communicate complex research results to general audience
Provide feedback to and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, R&D, and Partnerships to identify opportunities for new features, products and partnerships and drive client engagement around measurement innovation, including products alphas and beta
Educate clients, agencies and the industry on Facebook measurement and research capabilities
Work on White Papers and thought leadership pieces on ‘good measurement’, DR and performance marketing measurement
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+yrs experience in DR/Performance Marketing with an analytical / statistical background
Bachelors degree or an advanced degree in statistics, economics, behavioral or social science / related quantitative degree preferred
A solid understanding of the advertising industry (especially online) and measurement methods/technologies most commonly used
Excellent understanding of online media, social platforms, related APIs, ad products and ad tech
Client-facing experience, including experience driving change through adoption of new products or research methods
Strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to communicate technical content to general audience
Experience of independently scoping and executing analytical projects from start to finish
Experience of analysing and manipulate data sets to understand patterns and provide client insights
Experience working with large data sets, statistical software such as R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, STATA and hive and /or SQL
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.]

Affinity with Predictive Analytics and Machine Learning

[AmsterdamJunior Finance BI Analyst

With a headcount of already 90+ people across the company (Brazil and the Netherlands) and still growing the tech & product team in Amsterdam, we would like to add a Finance BI Analyst to the team with a solid background in financial dashboarding and credit card fraud prevention. who will help us professionalize the organisation and provide insightful analysis of current business trends, develop our credit card fraud prevention system and financial metrics along with recommendations for improvements.

Our why
In Brazil, and many other countries for that matter, 90% of the population uses gas cylinders to provide their homes with gas for cooking family dinners. However, these gas cylinders need to be replaced every few weeks. The old world distribution model is currently leading but Chama provides an alternative solution in the form of a mobile platform from which Brazilians can choose their preferred dealer based on price, quality or ETA.

Role description
To anticipate on further growth of the we are looking for a Finance BI Analyst who is analytically strong, has a solid credit card fraud prevention background and is able to work in a fast paced technology scale-up environment. The ideal candidate is looking for an opportunity to make a significant impact on the performance of a commercial business whilst playing a key role to advance financial analytics and develop the payment processing controls within Chama.

Main responsibilities:

To create valuable insights and answer information needs the Financial BI Analyst will work together with the BI team on creating dashboards that combine operational and financial data.
Improve credit card fraud prevention rules and monitoring of chargebacks in the payment service provider.
In this role you have to wake up wanting to fight credit card fraud and improve financial insights, you will provide the information the finance team needs to improve their work.
Requirements

Proven knowledge of fraud detection, preferably with Adyen
At minimum 1 year of working experience in an online platform business.
At minimum 1 year of working experience in a finance function.
BI tooling experience with Tableau and Alteryx,
Database experience with Google Bigquery and Microsoft SQL Server,
Knowledge of Oracle Netsuite or similar ERP and CRM system,
Coding experience in R, python, C#, Java, and Javascript
Strong presentation and communication skills
Has at minimum a bachelor's degree in an analytics area (Econometrics, Statistics, Engineering)
You are currently living in the Amsterdam Area, or have a EU passport]

Op de afdeling Marketing Data Science analyseren en optimaliseren we de totale customer journey van KLM. Dagelijks hebben we cross-device- en -channel-uitdagingen, die schreeuwen om een slimmere en meer datadriven aanpak. En daar hebben we jou voor nodig!
Interpersoonlijke sensitiviteit
Initiatief
Motiveren van anderen
Realisatie van doelen
Organisatiebewustzijn
Verzamelen van informatie
Opbouwen en onderhouden van relaties
Werken in teamverband
Mondeling communiceren
Wat ga je doen?
Als marketing data science lead is je uiteindelijke doel: verkeer, boekingen en omzet genereren op klm.com. Je team en jij hebben hiervoor de beschikking over zes marketingkanalen: e-mail, search, metasearch, affiliation, display en video. Jullie bepalen de waarde van elk kanaal, en dragen bij aan een integrale marketingaanpak. Bijvoorbeeld door een exploratory data analysis uit te voeren of een machine learning-model te bouwen, waarmee betrokken teams makkelijker beslissingen nemen.

Een ander groot project van je team: van big naar small data gaan. Overstappen naar een custom-made benadering. Daarom ben jij medeverantwoordelijk voor het Data Management Platform (DMP), waarin alle kanalen aan elkaar worden gekoppeld en je de informatiestromen kunt beheren.

Jij bent de lead, en dus functioneel de meest ervaren medewerker in je team. Dit betekent dat jij:het eerste aanspreekpunt bent voor je team;je teamleden coacht en helpt bij hun persoonlijke ontwikkeling;verantwoordelijk bent voor de resources van je team;zorgt dat jij de juiste competenties, vaardigheden en kennis in je team hebt, én deze steeds verder ontwikkelt.

Waar land je?
Je komt terecht bij E-Acquisition, onderdeel van KLM Digital. Je standplaats: ons hoofdkantoor in Amstelveen. In een open en gezellig sfeer werk je met een supergemotiveerd team van zo’n dertig collega’s, onder meer met kanaalmanagers, campagnemanagers en jouw datateam. We hebben vijf teams, met elk één lead. In jouw team zitten vier collega’s. Jullie werken nauw samen met webanalisten, E-Development, E-Sales, verschillende KLM-vestigingen, Marketing, area-organisaties, Revenue Management en Procurement.
Jouw profiel
Je werkt snel, pragmatisch, resultaatgericht, doortastend en graag samen: precies wat je nodig hebt om snel te aarden in het team. Je hebt een analytisch vermogen waar je ‘u’ tegen zegt. Met jouw communicatieskills leg je makkelijk contact met collega’s, die je ook nog eens perfect kunt uitleggen wat je team en jij eigenlijk doen – hoe weinig ze er ook van wisten. Bovendien heb je uitstekende commerciële vaardigheden.

Verder heb je:een universitair diploma in econometrie, informatica, (toegepaste) wiskunde, business analytics, technische bedrijfskunde of iets vergelijkbaars;ervaring met online marketing en multi channel exploitation;ervaring met een team aansturen en coachen;ervaring met Python, Spark, PySpark of R om data te verkrijgen, analyseren en modelleren;kennis van online technieken;een uitstekende beheersing van Nederlands en Engels.

Een uitdagende rol bij de beste werkgever van Nederland
Een brutosalaris tussen € 3.876 en € 4.707 per maand
Je brutojaarsalaris komt uit op € 57.710 tot € 70.077 (rekening houdend met een gemiddelde winstdeling, een gemiddelde tot goede variabele bonus, duurzaam inzetbaarheidsbudget en vakantiegeld)

[AmsterdamBepaalde tijdWe are currently looking for a Machine Learning Scientist for an international company in Amsterdam area .
Are you a Machine Learning Scientist and do you know of the state-of-the-art tooling in capturing textual content and translating human annotations to machine models? Have you experience in working with big data? We have the right opportunity for you!
Focus of the position
As a Machine Learning Scientist, you will be working with our business units on developing services that analyze, annotate and structure content found in scientific articles. We want to develop automated text classification and entity linking targeting specific problems in scientific manuscript structuring, author and reference identification. Ultimately, machine learning tools may suggest annotations and structured meta-data that are as good as human- generated data and even replace human annotations. Our solutions depend heavily on concept indexing or annotation, relationship extraction, extracting data from formatted text, images, mathematical expressions and tables. As a Machine Learning Scientist, you will have experience solving content analysis problems using supervised or unsupervised machine learning methodologies, you know of the state-of-the-art tooling in processing textual content at a large scale and be familiar with analyzing image data. You have a good understanding of the current Machine Learning libraries and have used at least some of them, solving real life problems. You are a hands-on person that does not care about Java or Python but about the right approach to the problem.
Main Activities and Responsibilities
Develop and apply machine learning methods in different pro jects
· The suitable candidate will bring active experience in information extraction from textual and image data and work on the projects that require large data processing
· Applying and developing machine learning techniques, the Machine Learning Scientist will drive the implementation of automated recognition processes, to improve them in cost and time-efficiency
· Using the available data, the Machine Learning Scientist will actively promote new ideas to enhance our competitive offerings
· The Machine Learning Scientist will actively contribute to product and operational content strategies by identifying and ingesting new technical capabilities to forward the company’s mission of leading the way in advancing science, technology and medicine
Serve as internal and external specialist on Machine Learning techniques
· The suitable candidate will serve as the Machine Learning Scientist in the Digital Content Services team.
· The Machine Learning Scientist will also be able to act as a liaison between IT developers and (content) subject matters experts, translating information needs into software developme nt
Qualifications
· PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Data Science, Computational Linguistics or an associated area
· A creative problem solver with a strong knowledge of statistics, text analytics and machine learning methods and strategies
· Ability to drive new developments and implement process changes and disruptive technologies in the organization
· Good communication and documentation skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical professionals
· Experience working with a variety of stakeholders at the mid and senior management leve
Technical skills
· Experience with applying Machine Learning methodologies, such as SVM, Deep Neural Networks, LSTMs, CRFs models for sequence recognition/ prediction
· Experience with Natural Language Processing. Familiarity with image analysis is a plus.
· Scientific software development experience, preferably in Python or Java.
· Handling XML data, and experience using *nix systems, open source software and libraries
· Experience with Spark is a plus
· Familiarity with agile software development
· Support technical scoping, design solutions requirements and testing, maintain documentation and perform code reviews
· Know how to improve efficiency of existing code and optimize performance
Does this role spark your interest? Then please provide me with your most recent resume and contact details, so that we can discuss this vacancy more detailed by phone!]

[AmsterdamFulltime, StageAt TomTom…

You’ll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow’s mobility for the better.
We are proud to be one team of more than 5,000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions.
We are looking for a curious and inventive security analyst intern who has a hacker mentality (willing to learn and break things apart) to join our Product Security Group Team responsible for software security in our Navigation product unit at TomTom.

What you’ll do
Managing software security issues in product designs and/or implementations related to ecosystem of Product Unit - Navigation;
Helping develop and maintain security requirements for product development team;
Participate in threat assessments and software security workshops;
Keeping up to date on new vulnerability information and determining its relevance to PU NAV;
Working closely with our Chief Security Architect, Product Security Group team members, Software Development teams to help them build security knowledge and resolve product security related problem;
What you’ll need
Demonstrated in-depth technical knowledge of Java, Python and Swift programming language;
Must work well in a collaborative environment, including working with other teams in different geo-locations
Basic knowledge of agile software development activities
You have to be an EU citizen or enrolled in a Dutch university.
You have to be enrolled in an university as a full time student during the whole period of your internship.

BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience
Experience performing Vulnerability discovery
Experience performing threat assessments on computer systems

We’re Navigation, a product unit within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. We develop software for onboard, hybrid, and online navigation applications – used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. Using a Navigation Data Standard (NDS) run-time format, our software includes navigation domain logic for traffic-dependent routing, route guidance, map visualization, search, positioning and machine learning-based predictions and suggestions. After you apply

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer

We celebrate diversity, thrive on each other’s differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment at our offices around the world. Naturally, we do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, national origin, genetics, or age.

[AmsterdamWe are looking for a skilled and driven Machine Learning Engineer to help us build the leading trading platform for the heavy machinery industry.

Transform data through scalable ETL pipelines
Design and develop statistical models and machine learning applications together with fellow Data Scientists and Software Engineers
Work with your team on feature engineering
Set up tests and experiments and analyze the results
Deploy and maintain APIs that reliably and with increasing accuracy serve millions of predictions
Your tools include:
AWS (lambda serverless, Redshift, EC2, Sagemaker, Kinesis, etc), Python ML ecosystem, SQL, Matillion ETL
About you

Experience implementing ML algorithms in high-level languages (e.g. Python)

Experience in Supervised/Unsupervised Learning.
Experience working with cutting-edge ML frameworks and algorithms.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms & principles, and numerical optimisation
You have excellent development skills, preferably Python ecosystem (e.g. Jupyter, numpy, scikit-learn, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)
Familiarity with AWS (e.g. Sagemaker, Batch, Lambda, Kinesis)
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role
You are an effective communicator; you work well in teams across borders
A degree or qualification in applied sciences, maths or statistics
What we will give you
Sit at the forefront of building an AI/ML based product that revolutionizes a dusty industry with Big Data and smart technology
Join the international Tradus team - 15+ different nationalities of passionate people all learning from one another and hungry to build the best-in-class user experience in Heavy Machinery
International career opportunities within and beyond Tradus - as part of the OLX Group network with more than 5,000 employees in over 40 markets
What does it feel like working at TRADUS?
We are a multicultural team of approximately 20+ passionate and driven startup minds - working to disrupt the way heavy machinery is traded out of our cool central office near the Amstel Station in Amsterdam.
We’re focused on building a product our customers love, we value speed over perfection, creativity and risk-taking vs processes and control, and above all we hold ourselves accountable to the growth of TRADUS.
We TeamUp across functions and countries on all things we do. We live the customer and are curious to get to know their pain points inside out – across all different country settings. We take charge and focus on results – to build a successful sustainable business each and every day. We keep it simple – the world is already complicated, so let’s simplify whenever we can.]

[AmsterdamAls dochter van Hot ITem bevindt Future Facts zich in een unieke positie. Hot ITem is specialist in Performance Improvement met behulp van BI & besturing en heeft daarom veel kennis van het ontsluiten van data, maar ziet dat haar klanten worstelen om volledig de waarde uit data te halen. Waar Hot ITem specialist is in het ontsluiten van data en besturing, volgt Future Facts deze dienstverlening op door met slimme analyses extra waarde uit de data te halen.

Op zoek naar concrete voorbeelden? Bekijk dan verschillende klantcases op de website van Future Facts of beluister hieronder de podcast van collega Bastiaan Sjardin over de waarde van het datawarehouse, data lake en data maturity.
Jouw rol als Big Data Engineer
Als Big Data Engineer kom je te werken in een hecht en ambitieus team. Samen creëren jullie échte waarde voor onze klanten door het implementeren van Big Data-oplossingen, vaak vanuit de cloud. Jij legt de basis voor excellente analyses. Je verzamelt, stroomlijnt, verwerkt en analyseert alle beschikbare data, gestructureerd of ongestructureerd.
Je bent expert in het opzetten en inrichten van schaalbare en toekomstbestendige (Big Data) analytics-architecturen voor onze klanten. Concreet bestaan je werkzaamheden uit:
het ontwerpen van Big Data-architecturen;
het inrichten van de (cloud-)omgevingen;
het opzetten van data-pipelines;
de implementatie (industrialisatie) van modellen.
Daarnaast bieden we volop mogelijkheden om expert te blijven in de snel veranderende wereld van Big Data, zoals Tracks en Trainingen, het behalen van de juiste certificering, stand-ups met collega's of intervisie met een Technical Lead. Kies vooral de methode die het beste bij jou past!
Wat bieden wij
Een afwisselende rol bij een jong, groeiend bedrijf met projecten die echt het verschil maken;
Een groep vriendelijke, no-nonsens collega’s die behoren tot de beste data professionals van Nederland;
Een goed bereikbare werkplek in Amsterdam met een prachtig uitzicht over het IJ;
Een concurrerend salaris, telefoon en laptop zijn vanzelfsprekend. Het stapje extra doen wij door jou een leasebedrag, privé internet- en onkostenvergoeding te bieden;
Een gym, dakterras en Danz Café waar je altijd even een praatje kunt maken met je collega’s.
Tom Rijntjes
'Bij Future Facts kan je je op veel gebieden ontwikkelen in het advanced analytics veld; van coaching tot advisering en van het opzetten van een infrastructuur tot modellen naar een hoger plan trekken. Verbreden kan hier echt!'
Wat breng jij mee
Goede kennis van de Nederlandse taal
+3 jaar ervaring in Big Data
WO-opleiding in een kwantitatieve richting zoals Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Wiskunde, Computer Science of Statistiek
Kennis van één of meerdere programmeertalen (Python, JAVA, SCALA, Javascript, C++, C#)
Kennis van Big Data processing (Spark/PySpark, Kafka, Informatica BDM, etc.)
Kennis van Big Data storage technologieën (HDFS/S3/ADLS/GFS, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redshift, MongoDB, Neo4J, FlockDB, etc.)
Kennis van cloud-platformen (AWS, Azure, Google)
Extra: Programmeervaardigheden in data analyse tools (Python, R, Matlab) is mooi meegenomen
Over Future Facts
Future Facts is een jong, dynamisch bedrijf met een passie en geloof in de kracht van feiten. Wij zijn een dochteronderneming van Hot ITem, een bekende speler op het gebied van Performance Improvement en Business Intelligence. Future Facts is volop aan het groeien. Wij zoeken nieuwe medewerkers met dezelfde passie, die samen met ons deze groei willen meemaken en vormgeven.
Future Facts helpt haar klanten extra waarde en inzicht te halen uit beschikbare data. Hiermee kan de klant haar beslissingen op feiten baseren of zelfs uitspraken doen over de toekomst. Zo verbeteren we marketing, sales, riskmanagement, debiteurenbeheer en verschillende operationele processen.
Ga naar de website van Future Facts voor meer informatie.
Over Hot ITem
Hot ITem is in 1998 gestart vanuit de filosofie dat persoonlijke ontwikkeling leidt tot groei van de medewerker, onze klanten en onze organisatie. In de afgelopen jaren hebben we ervaren dat deze filosofie écht werkt. We staan voor een scherpe aanpak waarin we doorbraken creëren op het gebied van prestatieverbetering. Daarbij rusten we niet voordat de oplossing is geïmplementeerd en de baten door de klant zijn geïncasseerd.
Al sinds 1998 helpen wij onze klanten hun performance te verbeteren met onze integrale aanpak: dienstverlening in samenhang met besturing, processen, ICT, organisatie en mensen. Organisaties hebben een strategie, met daaraan gekoppeld verschillende doelen. Zij willen bijvoorbeeld kostenbesparend werken, een groter marktaandeel verwerven of een nieuw product introduceren. Daar worden afspraken over gemaakt en targets voor gesteld. Hot ITem levert de inzichten die leiden tot concrete verbeteracties.
Bedrijfscultuur
We zijn een platte organisatie met een open cultuur, je hebt niet met veel hiërarchie te maken. Je werkt met gedreven collega’s die de klant echt willen helpen en gaan voor het eindresultaat. Groei is ons middelpunt. Scherp, inspirerend, verantwoordelijk en sociaal zijn hierbij onze kernwaarden.

Lees meer over onze bedrijfscultuur
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Wij zorgen goed voor onze medewerkers. Naast een prettige werkomgeving en een concurrerend salaris bieden wij je een grote diversiteit aan secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden.]

[AmsterdamDo you want to be in the middle of unprecedented transformation of the mobility ecosystem? Are you keen to oversee the Datasets of the largest lease organization in the world?

Do you recognize yourself being a business savvy, agile, and innovative Sr. Digital Analyst? We would love to hear from you!

What's the role of Digital Analytics?

Being the key driving forces behind the digital transformation and customer-driven approach we are going through, the Data and Digital Analytics team is;


Dedicated to the gathering and interpretation of online and offline data for driving first-in-class customer experiences.
Passionate about impactful insights across the organizations.
Guiding company decisions and create a fact-based culture in an insight driven organization.

Who are we looking for?

A business savvy, agile, and innovative Sr. Digital Analyst, who is;


Highly-driven and experienced digital analyst.
Passionate about solving complex business problems and deliver business impact.
Experienced of establishing best-in-class enterprise digital analytics eco-system, exploring advanced analytical & data visualization techniques to optimize digital customer journey(s) & financial impact.

What are you going to do?

The goal is to provide actionable insights to hypothesize and answer critical business questions, thus driving strategies and decision-making process. Which means;


Collect, track, mine and analyze data to extract fact-based insights pertaining to digital customer journey in our digital business.
Act as domain owner for analytics expertise. Drive global scale projects in the fields of: digital Voice of Customer Insights, interactive dashboard, data newsroom concept, Customer Segmentation, Personalization, Audience Management, enterprise analytics implementation, business intake on database integration, etc.
Support the Head of Digital Analytics in blue printing, establishing, and rolling out the Digital Customer Journey KPI framework as Digital Single Source of Truth for Leaseplan.

What do you need to do the job?


Bachelor/Master degree in Business, Marketing or quantitative field (Math, Science etc.).
Minimum of 5+ years of experience in eCommerce/ Digital Marketing business intelligence environment
Reporting skills including business intelligence, data visualization and dashboarding. Multi data source blending is a must-have.
You have hands on experience using Web Analytics (Adobe/Google), DMP (Krux/Adobe Audience Manager), SalesForce Cloud, Personalization (Target/Monetate/Maxymiser), Advance Analytics (Python/R/Spark), Visualization & Data Blending (Tableau/MicroStrategy/Alteryx/SQL).

Who are we?

We are a growing, fun & experienced team. There are 10 of us: The Head, 3 sr. analysts, 2 technical analysts, 2 data management specialists, and 2 data visualists. We work closely with other disciplines in data - data engineering & data science. Key business collaborators are: Digital Marketing, Product, Technology, as well as business units and markets.]

Job_Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer | Amsterdam & Utrecht
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamSenior Machine Learning Engineer | Amsterdam & Utrecht
One of the Netherlands’ leading data consultancies are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer. You work extensively in-house partnered with clients, rather than the usual project-based model.
Clients include a global name in sporting wear, Africa’s fastest-growing tech startup and a Dutch insurance market leader. Support from the consultancy in training is strong, as is working flexibility. CTOs have joined due to the advanced working environment.
Senior Machine Learning Engineer Duties:

Working in close collaboration with senior stakeholders, data engineers, data scientists to deliver a scalable, reliable and flexible solution.
Partner long term with a customer to deliver multiple data products, drive their data strategy forward and set a future-facing architecture.
Bring Machine Learning products from conception to production with control over the end-to-end data life cycle, modelling, infrastructure and visualisation.
Senior Machine Learning Engineer Guarantees:

Freedom to develop data product strategy along with senior stakeholders, acting as the data expert in the room asking the right questions.
Experiment and innovate with new technologies to investigate new ways of advancing data within businesses.
Great chance to learn from your colleagues, all top data experts in the Netherlands.
Senior Machine Learning Engineer Ideals:

The technical approach is largely agnostic and solutions focussed dependent on business requirements. However, the typical tools and technologies they look for include Spark, Cloud Platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), Kafka, NoSQL DBs, Hadoop, ElasticSearch, Docker and Kubernetes. .
Knowledge of more than one programming language from Python, Java, Scala, R. SQL is a pre-requisite.
Confidence in selecting and designing a range of algorithmic solutions from logistic regression through to RNNs.
English speaking is essential, Dutch is preferred.
Senior Machine Learning Engineer Soft Skills:

Excellent communication skills. You will be working with the business to architect scalable solutions and set a feasible roadmap for their delivery.
Innovative mindset. Companies are looking to disrupt traditional ways of working and are putting ML at the core of this transformation. Do it differently.
A desire to be part of a dynamic and growing company at the top of its game.
Interested? For more of the juicy bits contact angus@orange-quarter.com]

[Amsterdam€80.000 per jaarJouw baan: Senior Front end Developer Amsterdam
Werk jij graag aan producten die helpen om dromen van miljoenen mensen uit te laten komen?
Werk jij graag aan een revolutionair platform dat de laatste vijf jaar wereldwijd is gegroeid?
Experimenteer jij graag met de nieuwste EcmaScript tools en heb jij ook gevoel voor mobile development?
Wil jij innovatieve oplossingen bouwen met jonge slimme engineers in een groeiende en platte organisatie op een A-locatie?
Heb jij graag veel vrijheid in je werk en kies jij graag zelf uit waar je aan werkt, wanneer en hoe lang?
Klinkt dit als de baan voor jou? Lees dan snel verder!
Jouw werkgever: Helpt miljoenen mensen wereldwijd hun doelen te behalen!
Deze tech driven organisatie is opgezet door een groep mechanical engineers die een oplossing hebben bedacht om mensen betere toegang tot kennismateriaal te bieden. Met hun platform zijn ze in zeven jaar uitgegroeid tot grootste in hun niche en daardoor kennen zij in Europa al een monopolie positie. Door groei van het engineering team en de buitenlandse successen zijn zij nu klaar om de rest van de wereld te veroveren! Door je nu aan te sluiten kan je als senior front end developer kan jij meebeslissen over de te varen koers. Jij bepaalt o.a. de architectuur en welke tools er nodig zijn om deze missie te volbrengen. De organisatie is zeer internationaal, jong en werkt volledig agile met een platte structuur. Iedereen is gelijk en werkt aan dezelfde missie; mensen helpen hun dromen waar te maken! Op een geweldig ruim kantoor aan de grachten werk je met het engineering team naast een prachtige tuin. Binnen de organisatie is er vanuit de vrijheid die men heeft een hechte cultuur ontstaan. Alle belangrijke beslissingen worden in overleg met elkaar gemaakt. Ook wordt er elke dag samen geluncht (eigen chef!) en zijn er volop teamuitjes.
Jouw baan: Senior Front end Developer Amsterdam
Als senior front end developer bouw je aan oplossingen in React en de nieuwste EcmaScript, samen met het team experimenteer je met nieuwe tools en telkens ga je op zoek naar de beste oplossing. Het engineering team bestaat uit 8 man en als senior bestaat er voor jou de mogelijkheid om snel door te groeien als lead. Sinds een half jaar hebben ze ook twee Data Scientist aangenomen die hun producten nog slimmer maken. Het team zal volgend jaar meer opschalen omdat ze flink gaan investeren om binnen 3 jaar de grootste van de wereld te worden! Binnen het internationale team worden succes gevierd en op vrijdag gaan de discolampen en rookmachines op kantoor aan om met zijn allen gezellig samen te zijn. Omdat het team volledig autonoom werkt, is er veel vrijheid om samen te kiezen wat voor jou het beste werkt. Omdat je je in een nieuwe niche verplaatst, is er nog steeds veel ruimte om te experimenteren en coole nieuwe functies te bouwen voor de nieuwe klanten die binnenkomen. Stack waar ze nu mee werken bestaat uit: React, Redux, NodeJS (SSR), A/B testing, PHP, Laravel. Als front end developer kom je ook in aanraking met mobile als iOS/Android en React Native.
Wat wordt er gevraagd?
3+ jaar professionele software engineering ervaring
Ruime kennis en ervaring van React
Half jaar ervaring binnen mobile developement als React- Native
iOS/Android ervaring is gewenst
Kennis van Node en PHP is gewenst
Telkens willen werken met de laatste JavaScript tools
Potentie om anderen te inspireren en mee te nemen in zijn/haar ideeën
Wat wordt er geboden?
Salaris tot € 80.000 per jaar o.b.v. kennis en ervaring
Flexibele werktijden en thuiswerkmogelijkheden (max 2 dagen)
Ruim trainingsbudget van € 2.000,-
Lunch regeling (Chef kok op maandag t/m donderdag)
Aandelen opties (10%)
25 vakantiedagen (meer indien nodig voor familiebezoek, huwelijkreis)
Mogelijkheid om snel door te groeien als Lead, Architect!
Nieuwste Hardware uitzoeken
Wil jij als senior front end developer meebouwen aan een missie om dromen van mensen te verwezenlijken en nog succesvoller te laten zijn?
Solliciteer dan direct via het onderstaande formulier of mail je CV naar Melchior Schimmel via m.schimmel@codeguild.nl.]

Job_Title: Insights en CRM Manager (Dutch speaking) Completed assignment
Job_Description:
[Amsterdam€70.000 per jaarBen jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging waarin je jouw analytische, strategische en leidinggevende kwaliteiten kan inzetten om deze toonaangevende dienstverlener naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Lees dan nu deze vacature en ik hoor graag van je!
Organisatie
Deze vooraanstaande dienstverlener staat aan de vooravond van verdere digitalisering op het kruisvlak van legal tech en fintech. Dit biedt kansen voor het efficiënter en kostenbesparend inrichten van marketing, klantcontactstrategie en de (interne) werkprocessen. Als een van de grootste dienstverleners in Nederland is het de ambitie en de “next step” om service en marketing automation naar het volgende niveau te brengen en customer journey te optimaliseren.

Jij bent als de nieuwe Insights en CRM Manager verantwoordelijk voor het werving van nieuwe klanten (zakelijk en particulier), cross-sell, loyaliteit op basis van data en AI. Je ontwikkelt “next best actions” en bent verantwoordelijk voor de strategische doorontwikkeling van CRM en toepassing customer intelligence tools. Jij informeert het marketing team en commercie middels dashboards over performance van de klantenportefeuilles, lead funnels en adviseert over verbeteringen. Je geeft leiding aan een team van 5 specialisten, waarvan 3 data-scientist en 2 CRM-specialisten.
Functie omschrijving
De verantwoordelijkheden van de Insights en CRM Manager bestaat uit 3 componenten:

Customer Intelligence: het uitdagen van het Customer Intelligence team om betere modellen te maken met als doel om klantwaarde te verhogen. Bijvoorbeeld door klantgedrag te voorspellen en wat de “best next actions” zijn. Zelf deelnemen aan scrumteams en POC’s
CRM: de begeleiding van de implementatie van een CRM systeem, waarbij het belangrijk is dat je een duidelijke visie hebt op het gebied van CRM en deze ook op de juiste wijze weet over te brengen aan de interne stakeholders
Dashboarding: er wordt verwacht dat het team dashboards creëert waar op een heldere wijze informatie wordt gepresenteerd aan de rest van de organisatie
Functie eisen Insights en CRM Manager
Specifieke eisen voor de vacature van Insights en CRM Manager zijn:

Je hebt een universitaire opleiding, liefst economie, econometrie of bedrijfskunde, minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring
Je bent bekend met lead nurturing en het werken met platforms zoals Salesforce/ Microsoft dynamics of vergelijkbaar
Je bent bekend met tools zoals SPSS, R, Qlikview Designer
Je weet complexe vraagstukken snel te doorgronden, je denkt in oplossingen en hebt het vermogen deze op een eenvoudige wijze aan anderen over te brengen
Je bent pro-actief, nieuwsgierig, ondernemend en vind het plezierig om in teamverband te werken
Aanbod
Deze vacature is een mooie kans om binnen een gevestigde organisatie impact te maken en een belangrijke rol te spelen in de online groeiambities die daar liggen. Er is veel ruimte voor innovatie en ontwikkeling en je komt te werken in een klein dynamisch team. Uiteraard hoort hier een passend basissalaris bij en zal dit aangevuld worden met goede secundaire voorwaarden.]

[AmsterdamHello there! We’re glad you could join us. Improve Digital is looking for talented Software Development Engineers to join our growing development team in our Amsterdam office.

We develop and maintain real-time high-volume services responsible for selling online advertisement in web and mobile environments. Our customers use the services we provide to monetize the traffic on their websites and in their mobile applications. Through our operations we generate terabytes of new data every day; part of our work is designing and implementing flows for processing this data to provide accurate insights and performance indicators to our customers.

Our development initiatives have three main areas of focus. The first is in the building of services that have exceptionally tight requirements regarding predictable response times at high 9s. These services will be part of the ad decision process, so each millisecond is precious! The second area lies in data collection and processing capability. This involves contributing to the data infrastructure (based on Kafka and Hadoop among others) required for such capability as well as building applications that consume and act upon the data delivered by the streaming data systems.

The third area is customer facing web applications and APIs that allow ad ops and developers employed by our clients to configure our services and measure their performance.

We have largely standardized on the JVM as our backend development platform of choice, so the most common language in our software stack is Java. We also employ a whole range of scripting languages from Python to Lua making use of their flexibility. We don’t choose languages or tools based on artificial standards, we believe in the right tool for the job.

The engineering team is multi-disciplinary and you will be working closely with Data Scientist, Data Engineer and Database Administrator colleagues so eagerness to learn is essential.

This is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to acquire skills and experience through hands-on development, research and conference attendance in a range of technologies and use this to have a real impact on the business.

What you’ll be doing in this role:

Design and implementation of high-volume business-critical software, either processing real-time data or developing real-time services
Work with technical and non-technical staff to identify requirements and take these through implementation
Contribute to the definition of the company’s broader architecture
Help define and perform proof of concept and implementation of new architectural concepts and tools
What we’re looking for in a candidate:

Strong server-focused software development experience, ideally with platforms based on the JVM
Understanding of broader system concerns such as reliability, scalability and deployment mechanisms
Any experience building services where a low-latency predictable response is critical is a major advantage
Any experience dealing with large data volumes is a plus
Good familiarity with Linux (we mostly use CentOS)
Experience working in an agile environment (particularly with Scrum or TDD) is highly desirable
Understanding of the online advertising technology landscape is useful but not essential
If that sounds good so far, here’s how you can apply or ask a question:

To apply, just click on the apply button, fill in the online form and attach your CV and cover letter. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at [email address].

Here’s what happens after you send your application:

You’ll receive an email confirming our hiring department has received your application. You’ll then be updated by email as to what the next stage in the application process is.

If you’re wondering what working here is like:


In case you haven’t checked it out yet, our careers page should give you a good idea of the day-to-day. Whether you’re an online advertisement veteran or off to Google what ‘programmatic’ means, we’d like to invite you to help us create the future of online advertising.]

[Amstelveen€4.500 - €6.000 per maandLead Developer gezocht!
Our company & our culture
