[DiemenBedrijfsomschrijving
YACHT trainees focust op het vinden, ontwikkelen en binden van hoogopgeleid talent (HBO/WO) met maximaal 2 jaar werkervaring binnen de vakgebieden finance, legal, supply chain management & procurement, marketing & communicatie engineering en IT.

Werken voor Yacht
Yacht is dé organisatie van en voor professionals. Wij verbinden professionals en organisaties die het verschil willen maken. Ons doel is optimaal resultaat: jou als professional uitdagend werk bieden waarmee jij de organisaties van onze opdrachtgevers blijvend verbetert. Geïnteresseerd?

Dan willen we jou graag beter leren kennen.

Functieomschrijving
Yacht zoekt Data talent! Ben jij een junior of startend Business analist, BI specialist, data analist of data scientist en ben jij op zoek naar een traineeship dat bijdraagt aan jouw ontwikkeling tot een toekomstbestendige vakspecialist met management skills? Lees dan snel verder!

Het YACHT IT traineeship
Yacht heeft vijf jaar geleden het Yacht traineeship opgezet om een springplank te creëren voor jong talent. Inmiddels heeft Yacht Trainee meer dan 330 trainees in dienst binnen de vakgebieden IT, Engineering, HR, Finance, Legal en SCM&P. Het Yacht traineeship IT bestaat uit twee tracks:

In ons traineeship ga je drie keer één jaar aan de slag bij toonaangevende opdrachtgevers zoals KLM, ABN Amro, GGD, Randstad, UWV of Philips. Tijdens deze periode leer je verschillende organisaties van binnenuit kennen, zit je bovenop de business en los je uitdagende vraagstukken op.

Naast je werk bij onze talentpartners staat jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling centraal en wordt je intensief begeleid. Via het traineeship ontwikkel je jouw soft- en hard skills. In onze #Schoolofwork zoomen we in op je soft skills. Eens in de 3 maanden duik je met jouw klas mede trainees, de schoolbanken in en leer je meer over jezelf, je kwaliteiten, hoe je invloed uit kunt oefenen op anderen en leer je je staande te houden in een veranderende arbeidsmarkt. Jouw coach van de #Schoolofwork gaat daarbij persoonlijk met jouw in gesprek. Vanuit Yacht begeleiden we je eveneens. We zien je regelmatig.

Je hard skills ontwikkel je op je opdracht daarbij kun je deelnemen aan hard skill trainingen bij ons op kantoor. Bijvoorbeeld op het gebied van Python, R, SQL of machine learning ook is er een groot netwerk van IT collega's waar je mee kunt sparren.

Daarbij leer je van ons hoe belangrijk het is om je eigen netwerk op te bouwen. Het is onze overtuiging dat je door het benutten van je netwerk je eigen regisseur bent van jouw carrière.

Functie-eisen
Een (bijna) afgeronde technische/BETA HBO of WO opleiding (bijvoorbeeld Business Information Technology, Natuurkunde, Wiskunde, Econometrie, Bewegingswetenschappen)
0-2 jaar relevante stage/werkervaring binnen in Data analyse, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Big data of (Advanced) Analytics
Een aantoonbare interesse in/affiniteit met data,
Kennis van minimaal twee van de volgende technieken/tools en nieuwsgierig naar andere tools zoals Python, R, Excel, SQL, VBA, Qlik, Tableau en/of Matlab

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Een marktconform startsalaris, 8% vakantiegeld en 25 vakantiedagen. Daarnaast ontvang je van ons een vergoeding van €25,- netto per maand voor laptop/telefoon. Ook bieden wij je een goede pensioensregeling.

Als IT trainee maak je deel uit van ons netwerk en veel gezelligheid in de vorm van kennis- en netwerk events, barbecues, varen op de grachten, ski-reis en bedrijfsfeesten.

Lijkt het jouw interessant om binnenkort te starten met ons IT traineeship als reageer dan op deze vacature. In ons traineeship starten doorlopend nieuwe trainees. Er is dus geen deadline om te solliciteren!]

[AmsterdamSenior Analytics Consultant (NL)


What Does The Party Look Like?
We are the best analytics team in Europe. Biztory is a Tableau Gold Partner and our skilled and certified team of consultants bring our clients significant technical and business consulting expertise. We help individuals, departments, enterprises and even third parties to value data by embedding Tableau into their own platforms.

We're a €1bn start-up ... the best of both worlds. Biztory is a small, agile company with the flexibility to react to the changing winds of the market. We enjoy the backing and strength of a large company, with entrepreneurship in its DNA. We're one of more than 400 companies in the Cronos Group.

We get stuff done! We have offices across Europe in Belgium, Netherlands, Germany + the UK and we won Tableau EMEA Partner of the Year. Our customers span industries and their use cases are as interesting as they are diverse but we enjoy fixing their data, informing their people and enriching their customer experiences.

We love our people. We love helping people find answers in their data. Easier. Faster. Some of us have tattoos, some drive Teslas, some play video games and some cook amazing BBQ. We have two competing apparel entrepreneurs and an Iron Viz Champion! We guide, inform, and train! We're nothing without trust so we maintain a flat management structure, talk to anyone about anything.
Requirements
What Do You Bring To The Party?
You love data! A passion for all things data, a strong analytical mind and a love for solving problems is exactly what we're looking for. You'll need to be passionate about learning and mastering new techniques and technologies (maybe even new languages).

You play well with others. You're intellectually curious and you're a clear, confident, concise communicator. [Postcode 1013 in AmsterdamAre you a Medior .NET Developer looking work at a start-up? Do you want to work on an intelligent FinTech platform using communities to fight financial crimes?

For our client in Amsterdam we are looking for a:

Medior .NET Developer

Our client was founded in 2008 by an entrepreneur who met an airline fraud analyst who was sharing data of fraudulent transactions with his co-workers via a shared Excel-sheet. They decided to cooperate and build an online tool using a digital agency. It is their mission to enable and promote the cooperation against fraud between companies by sharing data.
The company in total has 16 colleagues working both in The Netherlands as well as abroad. Because the company started growing very rapidly about 2 years ago, there is a start-up mentality. They have recently moved into a big start-up hub where you feel the energy of cool things in the making. Lunch is always together with the team and on Friday afternoon they make use of their game room, holding a PS2, PS4, pool-table and table-tennis. Also, once per year they do a trip together.

The company builds three core products. A fraud forum, where fraud-chasers share their knowledge and ask for advice. The platform, where all the data is housed. In the platform there is a very smart AI algorithm at work that can detect fraudulent transactions. Finally, there is the communication tool where merchants can communicate with their bank to alert them in case of fraudulent transactions. The tooling is also connected to law-enforcement to enable them to track down criminals and arrest them. All the software is built in a .NET architecture using C#, Azure, ASP.NET, MVC, WCF, SQL and TFS.

For the Medior .NET Developer there is an opportunity to further commercialize the products. Currently, they are in the process of finding the right way to use the Azure cloud and from the latest update they have released they have acquired a lot of feedback and tips from the community for new features to be built. You will work in a team of 2 .NET Developers lead by a CTO and will closely cooperate with 2 data-scientists who are building the new AI algorithms.

Profile of the Medior .NET Developer:
You have a University work- and think level
You have at leas 2 years’ experience as a .NET Developer
You are fluent in C#
You have demonstrable skills in ASP.NET, MVC and/or WCF
You have experience in SQL and Azure experience as a plus
You are a EU-citizen and residing in The Netherlands
You are fluent in English


Packagedeal:
Up to €4.500,00 gross monthly salary based on skills, expertise and fulltime (40 hours)
24 holidays
Travel reimbursement
Fixed workplace in the office
Flexible working hours
Education budget
Growth Opportunities
Working from home is possible
Yearly team-outings
Friday afternoon drinks


Interested?
Send your resume to woutersoons@sterrk.nl or call him at 020-2044516 / 06-53734203. Then we will have a cup of coffee soon!]

[AmsterdamBegrijp jij computertaal? Voor veel mensen is computertaal niet eenvoudig omdat het niet begrepen wordt en er vroeger veel minder aandacht aan besteed werd. Voor jongeren is dit een ander verhaal. Zij leven in de moderne 21e eeuw en wordt er op school zelfs les gegeven in dit vakgebied! Als docent weet jij niet beter en heb je de laatste, vernieuwde technische snufjes ontdekt.

Een docent informatica geeft les aan leerlingen of studenten op het gebied van informatica. ICT oftewel "Informatie en Communicatie Technologie" is een vakgebied dat zich met informatiesystemen, telecommunicatie en computers bezig houdt. Voor de leerlingen is de ICT branche een belangrijk gebied. De jonge generatie groeit vandaag de dag op met alles wat met de ICT te maken heeft en kan hierdoor vaak beter meekomen met de verschillende soorten lesstof. Als docent zal je proberen alles van informatica over te brengen op de leerlingen. Het is belangrijk dat je voldoende inhoudelijke kennis bezit van de ICT-wereld om les te kunnen geven. Alleen theoretische kennis zal doorgaans niet voldoende zijn, omdat je op veel scholen praktijkles zal moeten geven. Meerdere scholen in en rondom Amsterdam, Haarlem en Almere hebben ruimte voor een docent informatica. Staat jouw woonplaats of regio er niet tussen? Dan gaan wij op zoek naar een andere mogelijkheid voor jou.

Informatica is niet voor iedereen een helder begrip en binnen de praktijk spreekt men vaak meer van specifieke beroepen, zoals programmeur, data scientist of netwerkbeheerder. Ben jij zelf een programmeur of softwareontwikkelaar en geef jij graag les in het voortgezet onderwijs? Dan kijken wij graag met je mee! OnderwijsPost heeft meerdere parttime en fulltime functies die we graag met je bespreken. Door jouw CV te uploaden via de link, kunnen wij direct met jou in contact komen.
Daar tegenover staat
Tijdelijke of vaste opdrachten zijn mogelijk, de keuze is aan jou.
Wij vergoeden je reiskosten op basis van €0.19 cent per kilometer.
Ga mee met onze leuke bedrijfsuitjes en maak kennis met een groot netwerk van onderwijsprofessionals.
Een sparringpartner op inhoud, voor als het even tegen zit.
Trainingen via de OnderwijsPost Academy.
Begeleiding gedurende je loopbaan vanuit het hoofdkantoor of op locatie. Telefonisch kan natuurlijk ook!
Een goed salaris volgens de schalen van de CAO Onderwijs.
Wie zijn wij?
OnderwijsPost is een arbeidsbemiddelingsbureau gespecialiseerd in het onderwijs. Wij brengen al jaren op succesvolle wijze opdrachtgevers en professionals bij elkaar binnen alle lagen van het onderwijs en de kinderopvang! Hierbij gaat het om zowel kortdurende vervangingen als vaste dienstverbanden. Persoonlijke aandacht is voor ons erg belangrijk om de wensen van onze professionals en opdrachtgevers goed in kaart te brengen. Veel van onze recruiters en accountmanagers hebben zelf een achtergrond in het onderwijs en begrijpen hierdoor het werkveld. Met onze OnderwijsPost Academy trainingen kunnen professionals zich blijven ontwikkelen en gezellige uitjes zorgen voor een groot onderwijs netwerk!

Je bent in het bezit van een 1e of 2e graads lesbevoegdheid.
Je hebt een goed klassenmanagement, je kunt orde houden en weet de leerlingen voor je te winnen.
Je hebt kennis van automatisering, wetenschap en internet
Je bent enthousiast en leergierig.
Je bent pedagogisch sterk en creëert een veilig pedagogisch leerklimaat.]

Job_Title: Software Developer (front-end, back-end or full stack)
Job_Description:
[Postcode 1011 in Amsterdam CentrumBedrijfsomschrijving
CONNECTING PROFESSIONALS
Yacht is specialized in connecting highly trained and experienced professionals with organizations, through recruitment and secondment. Yacht is part of Randstad, a global leader in recruitment and human resource solutions, founded in the Netherlands in 1960. Together we are active in over 40 countries and providing employment opportunities for more than 29,000 people.

CHALLENGING PROJECTS AND JOBS
We offer challenging projects and jobs at innovative startups and multinationals in Information Technology, Finance and Engineering, such as Siemens, ASML(LINK) and Philips (LINK). We are the driving force behind the careers of hundreds of professionals. Both our clients and candidates value our in-depth knowledge of the client market.

GET TO KNOW YOU
Beyond the basic skill requirements and your educational background, we’re interested in knowing you as a person. What drives you? What is your definition of success? Before introducing you to our clients, we will take your goals and preferences into account, out of respect for the organization ánd you.

Functieomschrijving
Join the leading companies in IT
Are you looking for a new challenge? Have you ever thought about the Netherlands as your next career destination? Come to one of the most innovative countries in the world, where you will experience a great living and working environment. Join our developers team at Yacht and be part of our Most Dev community.

Most Dev community
Most Dev is the Yacht Community by and for developers and data professionals. We are constantly looking for the most challenging positions at our clients, so that you can work on meaningful and technically advanced projects. We invest in improving your skills through a tailor made education program. At our Yacht Academy you will be offered various possibilities to gain and share knowledge through training, workshops and tech talks. And we organize events such as hackathons, VR zombie shootings (which is quite fun actually) and bbq’s, to chill out and have a good time together.

Want to know more? Watch this video about the Most Dev community: https://youtu.be/VttLo1rjhCM

Yacht is one of the leading HR companies in the Netherlands. We focus on development positions for front-end, back-end and full stack developers, as well as data scientists and data engineers. Amongst our clients are ING, ABN AMRO, Rabobank (the 3 largest banks in the Netherlands), eBay, VodafoneZiggo, Philips and many more interesting tech companies.

About you
You are completely king or queen in software development. Whether you are focussed on Java or Javascript, know everything about Angular or React or are master in data engineering - you are always looking to improve yourself. Whether you call yourself front-end, back-end and full stack developer, your knowledge is up-to-date, you like working in Agile/Scrum environments and are willing to share your experience with others.

Working in the Netherlands
When you have decided that Yacht is going to be your next employer, we are going to help you relocate. We have a special department to support you: the Expat Center. They will take care of applying for your visa, help you find housing and book your flight. We will even pay for your flight, your first month of rent and for the visa application. That is how we ensure that your arrival in the Netherlands goes as smoothly as possible.

What does that look like? Watch this video: https://youtu.be/U_UzTZMuDu0


Functie-eisen
This is what we expect from you:
Degree in Computer Science / IT
5+ years of experience in development
Professional experience with the newest technologies
Speaking English fluently and having great communication skills
Being flexible in working for different clients

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
What do you get in return?
One of the coolest communities to work with
A salary, depending on your work experience, ranging from € 3.200,- to € 5.000,-
Your own budget for education purposes
A single person who guides you
Help with relocating and applying for visa
Interested in joining us? Send your resume and motivation to Pieter Landsman via Pieter.landsman@yacht.nl or call him on +31 (0) 6 45 95 57 40]

[Noord-HollandJob Summary

The Quality Test Engineer III is a position in Quality Assurance responsible for developing and executing performance and automation tests. This position plans and executes effective and efficient performance and automation testing to accomplish on-time and efficient delivery of high-quality software products and/or data.

Engineering Village offers access to 12 engineering literature and patent databases providing coverage from a wide range of trusted engineering sources. One of those DBs is Ei Compendex, the broadest and most complete engineering literature database available in the world. It provides a truly holistic and global view of peer reviewed and indexed publications with over 20 million records from 77 countries across 190 engineering disciplines. Every record is carefully selected and indexed using the Engineering Index Thesaurus to ensure discovery and retrieval of engineering-specific literature that engineering students and professionals can rely on. By using Ei Compendex, engineers can be confident information is relevant, complete, accurate and of high quality.

Engineering Village is a part of the Elsevier organization, the world’s leading provider of scientific, technical and medical information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization.
Experience and Education
3+ years of Quality Test Engineering experience.
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required.
Experience with Java and automated testing tools/technologies.
Experience working in agile development methodologies.
Responsibilities
Ensure that testing addresses requirements as agreed with all stakeholders.
Develop, write, and execute tests with a focus on automation to ensure deliverables meet business requirements.
Focus on identifying opportunities to apply automation to manual tests or existing regression tests.
Work across teams to enhance quality assurance/testing with a broad scope in mind for overall impacts.
Research available tools and lead or participate in initiatives to identify and implement those that will cost-effectively enhance testing capabilities and product quality.
Configure, maintain, and/or administer testing tools or environments.
Identify areas for cooperation with other teams to improve overall quality and implement initiatives to improve testing capability and efficiency.
Maintain awareness of the state of the industry and evaluate emerging trends/developments that may benefit the organization.
Maintain flexibility to react quickly to changes in priorities or circumstances to meet the needs of the business.
Report issues and results, researching and identifying root causes as appropriate, documenting accordingly.
Other duties as assigned.
Required Skills

Strong understanding of QA methodologies.
Strong knowledge of process improvement.
Strong knowledge of the Agile (Scrum, Kanban) software development process.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills.
Solid QA testing skills, including test development, execution, and management.
Strong attention to detail.
Automation test experience with Selenium Webdriver (preferred) or similar tools.
Experience with Java
Proven ability to develop and execute automated and performance testing.
Demonstrated ability to work in multi-team, multi-location environment (including onshore/offshore) where heavy collaboration and coordination of activities is critical.
Understanding of industry trends.
Strong research skills (tools/root cause analysis).
Experience with JIRA and Confluence desired.]

[Noord-HollandOnbepaalde tijdI am looking for a MDM Analyst for one of my clients in the Amsterdam region.
Purpose of the job?
The Master Data Analyst designs and maintains the data governance framework to ensure supplier, customer, project and product data is compliant with MDM standards.
He or she is the key contact for Business Units regarding all master data activities, investigates, analyze and resolves data issues in order to maintain data quality, consistency and integrity levels.
Key responsibilities
1. MDM Processes and Governance
Design, implement and maintain processes and workflows needed to successfully introduce data management, MDM, data governance and data quality, ensuring clear ownerships for data and tasks.
Support Data Owners in understanding data concepts and how to improve data quality
2. Data Quality, Analysis and Improvement
Define and put in place data quality metrics and controls to monitor data quality.
Based on business rules, produce data quality reports for all key data assets and present findings on data quality controls and performance to data owners and other key partners.
Liaise with all areas of the business to investigate and resolve day-to-day quality issues.
Undertake analysis (regular and ad hoc) to understand data quality performance, make
recommendations and contribute to the development of business cases for remediating data quality issues.
3. Business Partnering
Provide professional expertise and advice to relevant stakeholders regarding master data management, data governance and data quality.
Act as a sparring partner for management and business units, advise and support them in the area of master data management, data governance and data quality
Work in multidisciplinary project teams with analysts, data scientists, data engineers and domain experts to deliver project results.
4. Monitoring Quality of Work
Monitor the quality of work executed by outsourcing partners, ensuring deliverables meet requirements and standards.
5. Knowledge Development
Define knowledge gaps in own department/discipline.
Ensure the development and exchange of knowledge among professionals within the
department and between business units.
6. SHEQ
Prepare and execute all activities in line with SHEQ rules, regulations, procedures, instructions, guidelines, and promote awareness, including addressing anomalies to others.
Who are we looking for?
Master’s/bachelor degree in a relevant area and 4 – 6 years of working experience
3+ years of experience working with data, developing business rules for data quality validation and executing data quality assessments
3+ years of experience with improving data integrity and data quality within a business
Experience working on either data migration or MDM projects.
Experience in documenting and developing user requirements through Epics and User Stories
Experience working in an Agile delivery model
Knowledge of GDPR and associated regulations
Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills
Fluent in English, both written and verbal
They offer a very attractive salary and package.
Interested? Send me your CV and motivation!]

[Noord-HollandOnbepaalde tijdI am looking for a MDM Analyst for one of my clients in the Amsterdam region.
Purpose of the job?
The Master Data Analyst designs and maintains the data governance framework to ensure supplier, customer, project and product data is compliant with MDM standards.
He or she is the key contact for Business Units regarding all master data activities, investigates, analyze and resolves data issues in order to maintain data quality, consistency and integrity levels.
Key responsibilities
1. MDM Processes and Governance
Design, implement and maintain processes and workflows needed to successfully introduce data management, MDM, data governance and data quality, ensuring clear ownerships for data and tasks.
Support Data Owners in understanding data concepts and how to improve data quality
2. Data Quality, Analysis and Improvement
Define and put in place data quality metrics and controls to monitor data quality.
Based on business rules, produce data quality reports for all key data assets and present findings on data quality controls and performance to data owners and other key partners.
Liaise with all areas of the business to investigate and resolve day-to-day quality issues.
Undertake analysis (regular and ad hoc) to understand data quality performance, make
recommendations and contribute to the development of business cases for remediating data quality issues.
3. Business Partnering
Provide professional expertise and advice to relevant stakeholders regarding master data management, data governance and data quality.
Act as a sparring partner for management and business units, advise and support them in the area of master data management, data governance and data quality
Work in multidisciplinary project teams with analysts, data scientists, data engineers and domain experts to deliver project results.
4. Monitoring Quality of Work
Monitor the quality of work executed by outsourcing partners, ensuring deliverables meet requirements and standards.
5. Knowledge Development
Define knowledge gaps in own department/discipline.
Ensure the development and exchange of knowledge among professionals within the
department and between business units.
6. SHEQ
Prepare and execute all activities in line with SHEQ rules, regulations, procedures, instructions, guidelines, and promote awareness, including addressing anomalies to others.
Who are we looking for?
Master’s/bachelor degree in a relevant area and 4 – 6 years of working experience
3+ years of experience working with data, developing business rules for data quality validation and executing data quality assessments
3+ years of experience with improving data integrity and data quality within a business
Experience working on either data migration or MDM projects.
Experience in documenting and developing user requirements through Epics and User Stories
Experience working in an Agile delivery model
Knowledge of GDPR and associated regulations
Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills
Fluent in English, both written and verbal
They offer a very attractive salary and package.

Job_Title: Regional Account Operations Manager, Analytics & Automation- Uber Freight EU
Job_Description:
[Postcode 1097 in Amsterdam OostAt Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the role:
The Uber Freight business is growing, and is expanding internationally. It’s our vision at Uber Freight to transform the industry by creating an efficient, safe, and a high-quality experience for commercial shippers and carriers by matching freight loads through technology.

Our Operations teams are the heart and soul of Uber Freight. The Regional Account Ops Manager role has a direct impact on the growth of our business and is responsible for developing initiatives that optimise the shipper experience on Uber Freight’s platform. This data-driven role calls for a combination of analytical thinking, operational prowess, and interpersonal ability to manage relationships with a very valuable part of our business; our shippers.

It’s a rare and exciting opportunity to be part of a new team at Uber, helping to launch Uber Freight in a new market. Join on the ground floor and help us build the future of freight internationally!
What you'll do:
Automation. Identify opportunities to optimise or automate a larger part of our processes (e.g. creation of loads, simple support requests…), and deliver on them
Analytics. Utilize data to understand shipper behavior, identify areas for improvement in our interactions with shippers and improve the performance of our account managers
Develop & Optimize Processes. Take big picture ideas and projects and break them into actionable steps with aggressive timelines for completion.
Stakeholder Management. Work closely with the US and European Account Ops teams, and the broader Uber Freight business to continually identify and drive new solutions

What you'll need:
Bachelor’s degree required, Masters preferred
3+ years work experience (e.g. Strategy Consulting, Engineering, Banking, Start-ups, …) with previous experience using data to drive business decisions. Industry knowledge is a plus
Excellent Excel skills and SQL experience required
Good understanding of R and / or Python
Demonstrated ability to influence the performance of client success or account management
Ability to balance attention to detail with swift execution

About the team:
The Uber Freight Account Operations team serves as a partner to our clients and our internal sales team, anticipating challenges and presenting solutions to support Uber Freight's business objectives. They help build and ensure sustainable growth for the European business.]

[AmsterdamAbout Calvin Klein Europe B.V
CALVIN KLEIN is a global lifestyle brand that exemplifies bold, progressive ideals and a seductive aesthetic. We seek to thrill and inspire our audience while using provocative imagery and striking designs to ignite the senses.

Founded in 1968 by Calvin Klein and his business partner Barry Schwartz, we have built our reputation as a leader in American fashion through our clean aesthetic and innovative designs. Global retail sales of CALVIN KLEIN brand products exceeded $8 billion in 2016 and were distributed in over 110 countries. Calvin Klein, Inc. employs over 10,000 associates globally. We were acquired by PVH Corp. in 2003.
Department and Team
Your role is part of the Digital Marketing team who are responsible for strategy and execution of all digital paid media campaign across Europe. You will work closely with Marketing, Ecom, Programmatic Campaign management, Creative Studio, CI, DMP Specialist, CRM, Ecom analytics and external partners.

Your team is based in our Amsterdam headquarters and has 3 key objectives:

Increase brand engagement and consideration in the markets.
Drive traffic and conversion at full price.
Be a proactive business partner with all stakeholders, internal and external.


The Position
CALVIN KLEIN has launched a series of interconnected projects aimed at transforming our in-house marketing and data management capabilities to create a more connected, integrated and personalised dialogue with our customers. A key part of this transformation project is the in-housing of our digital media buy.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst that can own and drive the data and campaign analysis strategy and execution for our Calvin Klein media team in Europe. You will be the go-to resource for media/campaign performance measurement. You will lead audience segmentation, assist with data integration related projects, and develop clear and actionable dashboards, reports and insights. You will work closely with the CRM and Ecom teams to determine the best strategy based on the data analyses you have done.


Position Responsibilities

Create, test and analyse customer journeys (for both known and unknown customers) across owned, paid and earned media.
Understand the timing of the messages leading to an action in order to optimise the media strategy and budget allocation.
Generate reports providing insights and recommendations to key stakeholders based on data across the channels. You will also build visualisation dashboards.
Mining and analysing event-level campaign data to provide actionable insights in the drivers of incremental ROI.
Be the owner of the marketing KPI framework, taxonomy and tracking principles.
Offer solutions that will guide the stakeholders in making informed decisions, and constantly test hypotheses.
Use A/B testing and a variety of alternative methodologies to measure marketing effectiveness, attribution and ROI. Be the owner of the A/B test agenda and archive.
Responsibility for tagging-based analytics needs regarding the various tracked channels with GA360 and Adobe Analytics.

Audience creation, management, analysis and maintenance (in DMP and media platform). Collaborate with team members to configure, test, and validate destinations (social, display, rich media, targeting platforms) to send segments for audience activation.

Experience in working in a fast-paced digital agency, media, performance marketing or Ecom environment.

A strong learn-it-all and entrepreneurial mentality. Ability to deliver projects throughout the full project management life-cycle. Eager to learn and test new initiatives.
A detail-oriented, data-driven, and creative eye, combined with the ability to multi-task and manage several projects simultaneously.
Strong passions for Mar-Ad Technology: DSP, SSP, DMPs, CMP, Attribution platforms, etc. You can envision integration and activation capabilities across multiple technology platforms.


You Bring

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as business fluency in English (written and verbal).


We Offer

A newly built campus with gyms, cafes, amazing lunches, and plenty of company events.

Job_Title: Junior Quantitative Risk Analyst (Non Retail Modelling)
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamWe need you!
ABN AMRO is a leading Dutch bank, with an international presence across Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Americas. We are looking for skilled quantitative risk analysts who have a solid quantitative background and a passion for working with advanced techniques to unlock the valuable information contained within our production and historical data.
Your job
As a Non-Retail Credit Risk modeller, you will play a key role in ensuring that the bank makes informed, data driven decisions. Your main focus will be the development and maintenance of our Credit Risk models for professional clients covering over EUR 100 billion in exposure. These models are key to the existence of the bank as they form the basis for loan approval, pricing, performance management and regulatory capital.

In your day-to-day job you will work in multidisciplinary project teams. You closely work together with the business lines in order to ensure that the models properly reflect the business and processes. You will decide on the best quantitative methods and techniques to unlock the intelligence contained within the data. You are aware of new and existing regulatory requirements and ensure that these are properly reflected in the models. As a junior analyst you take the responsibility over parts of the model development process and are actively involved in stakeholder management.

Overall you apply your quantitative skills and experience on various data sets and business challenges, and make a positive impact for the bank and its customers. You will contribute significantly to the success of your team, which includes both junior analysts and experienced senior risk analysts who can help you to further develop your skills.
About us
ABN AMRO Risk Modelling is a growing, international team of more than 90 professionals. We are the centre of excellence within the bank for developing quantitative risk models, which inform the bank in its daily decisions, from pricing of deals and granting of customer credits, through to setting and monitoring of market risk limits and determining the capital requirements for the bank.
About you!
you have a strong quantitative education in an area such as pure mathematics, econometrics, actuarial studies, or physics. Besides that you have skills in software packages for statistical and data analysis, such as Python, SAS, R, and MATLAB
you want to prove yourself in a quantitative modelling environment, and to apply your skills to derive meaningful, robust, data driven models to guide business decisions
you work well within a team, and can take responsibility for making your contribution to successful delivery
you fit the profile if you meet the following requirements: Quantitative academic education (Master’s Degree or PhD) in a relevant field, like econometrics, mathematics, actuarial studies or physics
good knowledge of statistics, econometrics, financial mathematics, stochastic calculus or machine learning
able to effectively communicate (in written and spoken English) about your analysis and results;
experienced in modern programming languages (e.g. MATLAB, Python) or statistical languages (e.g. SAS, R)
strong analytic skills and affinity with data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling
able to work independently and under pressure
pro-active attitude and an excellent team player
Our offer
the opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
an informal multi-cultural working environment with great colleagues
challenging work on complex and advanced quantitative problems
the opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
a competitive salary
a supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
a personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
an annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on the function
a solid pension plan
Interested?
Please submit your application online.

We are looking forward to hear from you!]

Do you have a deep passion for utilizing technology to empower businesses? Are you passionate about collaborating with technology and business leaders to deliver cloud-based solutions?

Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com and a leader in Cloud Computing, is seeking early career talent to join our AWS Tech U Program. This is a unique opportunity for driven, self-starters to play a key role in a fast-growing business, and to deliver significant value to AWS customers of all sizes from nimble startups to global brands. You will learn from top AWS subject matter experts and get paid while you train for an exciting career in the tech industry.

These are some of the most challenging and exciting roles in the IT industry today. We work with cutting edge technologies supporting the largest and most innovative businesses, non-profits, and government agencies around the world. This is a an unparalleled opportunity to leapfrog your peers and take a leadership role helping AWS to transform the way the world uses technology to solve their business challenges. The skills and experiences you gain will be highly sought after throughout the industry and give you the opportunity for the career of a lifetime.

Associate Solutions Architect

Our Associate Solutions Architects are passionate technologists with technical breadth and depth coupled with strong interpersonal skills. They are passionate about helping customers build infrastructures and applications at scale. In this role, you will partner across AWS teams to help customers craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems. As a trusted customer advocate, you will help organizations understand best practices around cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help customers use AWS within their organizations ranging from new start-ups to large enterprise customers.

About Tech U

As an Associate Solutions Architect, you will be part of AWS Tech U, which is an accelerated career development program for those who want to advance both their technical and business skills. This unique program consists of a 6-month instructor lead, project-based learning curriculum, followed by a 6-month On-the-Job Training (OJT) learning assignment within Solutions Architecture.

Are you ready to embrace the challenge? Come build the future with us.

Program Starts in March 2020/September 2020

Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions to both large and small audiencesExperience implementing a cloud-based technology solution in a school project or while working for a companyExperience with one or more of the following domains: systems administration (Linux/Window), network administration (DNS, IPsec, BGP, VPN, Load Balancing), or programming (Node.JS, Java, Ruby, C#, Python, or PHP)Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Application and Assessment Process

Eligible candidates will be invited to attend an online assessment. If successful after this, candidates will be invited to complete a technical phone screen. Candidates who pass the technical phone screen will then be invited to attend an in-house assessment centre. This selection process is subject to change but you will be notified if any changes are made.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

EU Student Programs Team]

Databricks' mission is to accelerate innovation for its customers by unifying Data Science, Engineering and Business. Job_Title: Technology (Cloud) Solution Engineer/ Consultant – Finish market
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamTechnology (Cloud) Solution Engineer/ Consultant – Finish market-19001GA2


Preferred Qualifications

Oracle offers a comprehensive and fully integrated stack of cloud applications and platform services. For more information about Oracle (NYSE:ORCL), visit oracle.com.

Technology (Cloud) Solution Engineer/ Consultant – Finish market, Amsterdam
Based in Amsterdam

Are you a talented professional interested in applying your expertise to get real business value for clients?

Oracle Digital is the front runner within Oracle Corporation when it comes to creating innovative cloud technology solutions for our customers and developing the sales model of the future. As Cloud Technology Solution Engineer you are part of a bigger international team within the EMEA region. You will work with ambitious and dynamic sales teams in Malaga and Amsterdam, covering the market area of Germany, Nordic countries (Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway), and Switzerland. Your solutions range from (not limited to) Security, Internet of Things, Big Data, Analytics, Integration, Application Development, Database and Infrastructure within the PaaS and IaaS part of Oracle portfolio.

The main responsibility of the Solution Engineer is to secure Oracle solution selection. You will assist our German Sales Representatives, also based in Amsterdam, to drive the sales of Oracle Cloud solutions. You will advise our Customers on how to address their business challenges and map the best Oracle Cloud solution to manage these challenges.
If you have a passion for Technology and Customer Success, then this represents a perfect opportunity to blend your technical skills with business acumen.

For more information about Oracle Cloud Technology please visit:
http://cloud.oracle.com/

Key Responsibilities:
Be a technical expert on Oracle Technology and Cloud solutions both for customers and internally in Oracle.
Deliver an outstanding customer experience in-person and remotely.
Deliver customer presentations & demos highlighting the value of Oracle’s Solutions.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge and expertise in Oracle Technology and Cloud solutions and market trends.
Develop customer-specific value propositions highlighting benefits and differentiators of Oracle
Represent Oracle at Technology marketing events.
Collaborate on customer opportunities with Oracle Sales, Solution Engineering and Product Management communities.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Customer Engagement Skills:
Work experience in Solution Engineering or Sales Consulting position is preferred.
Excellent communication skills, able to articulate complex messages very clearly. You are a story teller.
You won’t be satisfied until the job is done to the right quality for our customers.
Ability to work in (virtual) teams. To get a specific job done can require working together with many colleagues, partners and customers.
Self-motivated, you have the natural drive to learn and pick up new challenges.
Team-worker.
Agile and happy to continually adapt to change.
Always looking to raise the bar of own skills/competencies development.
Comfortable in delivering presentations in person and remotely.
Technology Skills:
Bachelors or Master’s degree in Computer Science
You have hands-on experience with technology solutions with Database, Middleware and/or Business Analytics Technology. Experience with implementation of Oracle Technology solutions is an advantage.
Knowledge of Oracle Cloud technology solutions or other cloud solutions is an advantage.
Understanding of the value for business of Cloud solutions, for IT departments, Lines of Business and Developers, is an advantage.
Proven Solution Architecture knowhow is an advantage (e.g. TOGAF certification).
Business Skills:
MBA is an advantage.
Understanding of sales methodologies processes and disciplines is an advantage. The ability to positively contribute towards sales processes as well.
Excellent understanding of Customer’s business challenges & needs.

Language Skills:
Speaking Finish on a native level as well as fluent in English.
Additional language skills are an advantage.

What we offer
With more than 420,000 customers—including 100 of the Fortune 100—and with deployments across a wide variety of industries in more than 145 countries, Oracle offers a comprehensive and fully integrated stack of cloud applications, platform services, and engineered systems. Oracle Digital will provide you:
This position is based in the city centre of Amsterdam, The Netherlands
An environment that is focused on continuous learning
Ample opportunity to train on new products and to develop new personal skills
A combination of deploying technical knowledge and sales abilities
A challenging and interesting work environment with the possibility for interaction with colleagues, customers and partners
Attractive salary and benefits, and relocation support
Excellent possibilities to develop yourself and your career.
For more information visit experience.oracle.com or iamsterdam.com
For more information regarding this amazing role, please contact me on: anna.cvajnigova@oracle.com

As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to complete a pre-employment screening process, prior to an offer being made. This will involve identity and employment verification, salary verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).


Detailed Description and Job Requirements

The primary focus of a Sales Consultant (Pre-sales) is to become an expert in a core set of Oracle products and solutions and to present the value proposition and benefits of our solutions to our partners, prospects and customers and internally to our sales force

As a Staff Internet Sales Consultant you will be responsible for providing presales technical/functional support to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction, through on-line/in person sales efforts. Develop and deliver high quality standard Oracle presentations and demonstrations via the internet and/or in person. Present and articulate Oracle product*s strengths, features, benefits, and competitive advantages. Design, validate, and present Oracle software solutions to include advanced product concepts, future direction, and 3rd party complimentary products. Support sales team in online/in-person selling efforts with some supervision. Develop and deliver proposed solution to customers. Approximate percentage of face to face interaction with customers to perform their responsibilities is 10%

Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures.3 - 5 years business experience preferred; vendor experience also preferred. 3 years relevant computer applications or database/tools preferred. Demonstrated proficiency in one multi-user operating system. Knowledge of system and application design preferred. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Ability to travel as needed. BA/BS degree or equivalent preferred.

As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).]

[AmsterdamAbout our PVH Ecommerce division
The Ecommerce (Ecom) Team is responsible for managing the European own and operated tommy.com and calvinklein.com sites across all European markets. The team operates all necessary functions to manage the Ecom business end-to-end. Both brands are growing in a fast pace and have very ambitious growth targets for the coming years. The team consists of approx. 80+ people and will grow significantly until the end of the year. Furthermore, team members are of various cultural backgrounds and nationalities, all highly motived and skilled as well as inspiring to work with.

At PVH we are transforming the fashion industry by breaking conventions every single day. We are always exploring ways to bring the industry forward and constantly accelerating the pace in which we do business.

What does your team do within PVH Ecommerce?
The E-commerce Analytics team’s mission is to provide the E-Commerce & Digital Marketing departments with actionable insights and state-of-the-art activation solutions that enable Tommy Hilfiger & Calvin Klein to continuously improve, create value from data and be ahead of competitors to drive the business forward.

The team supports change and informed decision-making across the entire company whenever and wherever it touches E-commerce. It constantly challenges and educates business owners to think analytically, ask the right questions and act upon given data driven insights. The team enables stakeholders to measure their performance and leads the development of clear and actionable dashboards, models & automated (activation) solutions.

Your mission is to ensure the business is making data driven decisions. As such, you will help prioritize business needs based on potential value, risk and investments from analyses. You will provide requirements to Product Owners Analytics to enrich the pool of information and activation tools available to the business. You will work closely with (site) merchandizing, content, customer experience, customer service, online/digital marketing, data science and CRM teams to determine the best strategy based on the data analyses you have done.
Your role at PVH

Implement a prioritization framework to ensure what the Analytics team works on drives value
Journey analyses: link the various channels through which visitors interact with our brands and understand the timing of the messages leading to a purchase in order to optimize the Performance Marketing strategy
Generate reports (analyses) and dashboards providing insights and recommendations based on data across the channels
Improve data maturity throughout the department: ensure data integrity & documentation of tracking standards and assist users in adopting best practices
Offer solutions that will guide the stakeholders and platform product owners in making informed decisions and constantly test hypotheses
To approach and inspire team members & stakeholders and actively transfer your knowledge and love for numbers without losing sight of what is important and relevant to them


What we are looking for
We’re looking for people who can bring new perspectives and life experiences to our team. If you’re looking for a place that values your curiosity, passion and desire to learn; if you’re seeking colleagues who are big thinkers, eager to take on fresh challenges, then our team is perfect for you.

Minimum 3 years’ experience in Web Analytics (Adobe Analytics / Google Analytics)
Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written
Strong commercial focus and the ability to prioritize tasks accordingly;
Pragmatic and results-focused work attitude;
Strong analytical skills / background;
Excellent analytical, communication & story-telling skills
A team mentality: inspire, coach & support
An entrepreneurial mindset: eager hands-on mentality, self-motivated, daring to experiment & disrupt
Experience with SQL or BigQuery (advanced skills is a plus)
Experience in performance marketing or CRM is a plus


We offer you

A challenging position in a growing team with a strong start-up mentality
Competitive salary with benefits such as reimbursed commuting expenses, 25 days annual leave, discount on your mandatory Dutch Health Insurance, and pension plan
State-of-the-art campus facilities
‘All-you-can-eat’ healthy lunches and amazing events
Wide range of courses at PVH University to satisfy your learning appetite
Great colleagues (curious, ambitious, and fun)
International working environment
Relocation assistance, from A to Z (if you live abroad)


NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.]

[AmsterdamDo you want to work at a highly dynamic startup founded by an insurance domain-expert and a renowned Computer Science professor? Can you effectively engineer ML applications using vast amounts of insurance data?

For a client in Amsterdam we are looking for a:

Machine Learning Engineer

The client is a young dynamic company with a purpose, operating within the general insurance market, whether that is educating boards of directors, building bespoke insurance products or assisting in house- data scientists, we have a proven track record at all levels. After doing several successful experiments in the past years, the client has setup a joint-venture with a global insurance partner. The client is a autonomous R&D entity that develops POC’s for the insurance market. They are now with around 5 data scientists. With an industry veteran as a Co-founder as well as a partner with global reach, they can penetrate the market extremely effectively. This is a merit-based company with a real focus on employee fulfillment. They believe this to be the key to sustainable success.

With the business acumen, the academic depth and the capacity to execute at the code-face, this company delivers turn-key solutions. They use data science and machine learning (ML) technologies to engineer impactful applications that can be applied throughout the insurance industry. The technology choices are predicated on building reproducible data pipelines/ from raw data sources to actionable insights. These pipelines take the form of literate programming narratives where we motivate and make explicit all assumptions, hypotheses and their tests and provide evidence to support all conclusions. To build these pipelines they favor open-source software consisting of a range of command-line tools on plain text data formats, on a Python stack building on Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, using Emacs and Org-mode..

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of insurance client data, then build bespoke products to help them make smarter decisions, reducing risks to their business and empower them to provide a better customer service journey. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, carrying out statistical analysis, and building high quality predication systems integrated with our products. You will build-, and optimize classifiers using machine learning techniques to engineer new features. You will Mine data with state-of-the-art methods, combining client’s as well as third-party data sources. Data-collection procedures are enhanced by including information relevant for analytics systems as well as process, cleansing and verifying data-integrity before analysis. All these activities are aimed at engineering solutions for actionable insights.

Profile of the Machine Learning Engineer:
You have a BSc., MSc., or PhD in Computer Science, Physics or Mathematics
You have more than 2 years of professional experience as a ML-Engineer
You have proven experience with data-, and software engineering Python
You have hands-on experience developing applications using ML-technologies
You have demonstrable experience with either Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Tensorflow, PyTorch
You have demonstrable experience with applied statistics
You have demonstrable experience with either Matplotlib, Seaborn, D3.js, GGplot

Job_Title: Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst (Non Retail Modelling)
Job_Description:
[AmsterdamWe are looking for skilled quantitative risk analysts who have a solid quantitative background and a passion for working with advanced techniques to unlock the valuable information contained within our production and historical data.
We need you!
ABN AMRO is a leading Dutch bank, with an international presence across Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Americas. We are looking for skilled quantitative risk analysts who have a solid quantitative background and a passion for working with advanced techniques to unlock the valuable information contained within our production and historical data.
Your job
As a Non-Retail Credit Risk modeller, you will play a key role in ensuring that the bank makes informed, data driven decisions. Your main focus will be the development and maintenance of our Credit Risk models for professional clients covering over EUR 100 billion in exposure. These models are key to the existence of the bank as they form the basis for loan approval, pricing, performance management and regulatory capital.

In your day-to-day job you will work in multidisciplinary project teams. You closely work together with the business lines in order to ensure that the models properly reflect the business and processes. You will decide on the best quantitative methods and techniques to unlock the intelligence contained within the data. You are aware of new and existing regulatory requirements and ensure that these are properly reflected in the models. As a senior analyst you take the responsibility of the model development process and are actively involved in stakeholder management of both internal and external parties including the DNB and ECB.

Overall you apply your quantitative skills and experience on various data sets and business challenges, and make a positive impact for the bank and its customers. You will contribute significantly to the success of your team, which includes both junior analysts and medior risk analysts. As a senior you take a leading role in the coaching and development of your team members.
About us
ABN AMRO Risk Modelling is a growing, international team of more than 90 professionals. We are the centre of excellence within the bank for developing quantitative risk models, which inform the bank in its daily decisions, from pricing of deals and granting of customer credits, through to setting and monitoring of market risk limits and determining the capital requirements for the bank.
About you
at least 8 years of work experience in quantitative analysis, preferably within risk modelling in banking and finance
quantitative academic education (Master’s Degree or PhD) in a relevant field, like econometrics, mathematics, actuarial studies or physics
good knowledge of statistics, econometrics, financial mathematics, stochastic calculus or machine learning
you have skills in software packages for statistical and data analysis, such as Python, SAS, R, and MATLAB
able to effectively communicate (in written and spoken English) about your analysis and results
able to work independently and under pressure
pro-active attitude
you work well within a team, and can take the lead on elements of work, guiding junior team members and enabling successful delivery
Our offer
an informal multicultural working environment with great colleagues
challenging work on complex and advanced quantitative problems
an attractive payment package
flexible working hours
a wide range of training opportunities
career development and the possibility to gain experience in all areas of risk modelling, in other business areas of the bank, or in one of our international locations
Interested?
Please submit your application online.

We are looking forward to hear from you!]

[Noord-HollandJob Summary

The Quality Test Engineer III is a position in Quality Assurance responsible for developing and executing performance and automation tests. This position plans and executes effective and efficient performance and automation testing to accomplish on-time and efficient delivery of high-quality software products and/or data.

Engineering Village offers access to 12 engineering literature and patent databases providing coverage from a wide range of trusted engineering sources. One of those DBs is Ei Compendex, the broadest and most complete engineering literature database available in the world. It provides a truly holistic and global view of peer reviewed and indexed publications with over 20 million records from 77 countries across 190 engineering disciplines. Every record is carefully selected and indexed using the Engineering Index Thesaurus to ensure discovery and retrieval of engineering-specific literature that engineering students and professionals can rely on. By using Ei Compendex, engineers can be confident information is relevant, complete, accurate and of high quality.

Engineering Village is a part of the Elsevier organization, the world’s leading provider of scientific, technical and medical information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization.
Experience and Education
3+ years of Quality Test Engineering experience.
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required.
Experience with Java and automated testing tools/technologies.
Experience working in agile development methodologies.
Responsibilities
Ensure that testing addresses requirements as agreed with all stakeholders.
Develop, write, and execute tests with a focus on automation to ensure deliverables meet business requirements.
Focus on identifying opportunities to apply automation to manual tests or existing regression tests.
Work across teams to enhance quality assurance/testing with a broad scope in mind for overall impacts.
Research available tools and lead or participate in initiatives to identify and implement those that will cost-effectively enhance testing capabilities and product quality.
Configure, maintain, and/or administer testing tools or environments.
Identify areas for cooperation with other teams to improve overall quality and implement initiatives to improve testing capability and efficiency.
Maintain awareness of the state of the industry and evaluate emerging trends/developments that may benefit the organization.
Maintain flexibility to react quickly to changes in priorities or circumstances to meet the needs of the business.
Report issues and results, researching and identifying root causes as appropriate, documenting accordingly.
Other duties as assigned.
Required Skills

Strong understanding of QA methodologies.
Strong knowledge of process improvement.
Strong knowledge of the Agile (Scrum, Kanban) software development process.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills.
Solid QA testing skills, including test development, execution, and management.
Strong attention to detail.
Automation test experience with Selenium Webdriver (preferred) or similar tools.
Experience with Java
Proven ability to develop and execute automated and performance testing.
Demonstrated ability to work in multi-team, multi-location environment (including onshore/offshore) where heavy collaboration and coordination of activities is critical.
Understanding of industry trends.
Strong research skills (tools/root cause analysis).
Experience with JIRA and Confluence desired.]

[Noord-HollandOnbepaalde tijdI am looking for a MDM Analyst for one of my clients in the Amsterdam region.
Purpose of the job?
The Master Data Analyst designs and maintains the data governance framework to ensure supplier, customer, project and product data is compliant with MDM standards.
He or she is the key contact for Business Units regarding all master data activities, investigates, analyze and resolves data issues in order to maintain data quality, consistency and integrity levels.
Key responsibilities
1. MDM Processes and Governance
Design, implement and maintain processes and workflows needed to successfully introduce data management, MDM, data governance and data quality, ensuring clear ownerships for data and tasks.
Support Data Owners in understanding data concepts and how to improve data quality

Define and put in place data quality metrics and controls to monitor data quality.
Based on business rules, produce data quality reports for all key data assets and present findings on data quality controls and performance to data owners and other key partners.
Liaise with all areas of the business to investigate and resolve day-to-day quality issues.
Undertake analysis (regular and ad hoc) to understand data quality performance, make
recommendations and contribute to the development of business cases for remediating data quality issues.
3. Business Partnering
Provide professional expertise and advice to relevant stakeholders regarding master data management, data governance and data quality.
Act as a sparring partner for management and business units, advise and support them in the area of master data management, data governance and data quality

4. Monitoring Quality of Work
Monitor the quality of work executed by outsourcing partners, ensuring deliverables meet requirements and standards.

department and between business units.

Master’s/bachelor degree in a relevant area and 4 – 6 years of working experience

Voor een multimedia bureau in de regio Amsterdam ben ik op zoek naar een BI manager.
Als BI manager geef je vorm aan de datastrategie van de organisatie. Met je team bouw je verder aan het datawarehouse en lever je steeds geavanceerdere analyses en rapportages. Je stimuleert data gedreven werken met state-of-art tooling en dashboards voor de business. Je stuurt een team aan met data analisten, data scientists en een data developer. Je bent een ervaren manager, die volledig thuis is in BI concepten en hands-on in data modelleren, data management, ETL, en SQL. Je werkt pro-actief samen met de business om steeds relevanter data te leveren. Je werkt projectmatig en bent in staat om steeds nieuwe data technologieën te introduceren. Je bent een leidende kracht binnen onze data infrastructuur en verantwoordelijk voor de data kwaliteit.
Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor
Het aansturen en optimaal inrichten van het team;
Proactief fungeren als centraal contactpersoon, klankbord en adviseur voor de business. Je stimuleert data gestuurd werken;
Het verder ontwikkelen van het datawarehouse en het professionaliseren van alle tools, dashboards en rapportages
Het verder ontwikkelen van het data beleid: waar moet de datakwaliteit verbeterd worden, welke bronnen moeten nog ontsloten worden en welke data moet beter gestructureerd worden om zo één bron van de waarheid te krijgen?
Wat er van jou wordt gevraagd
Ervaring als leidinggevende in een BI omgeving (bij voorkeur in een online omgeving);
Kennis van SQL, ETL, data modellering, database technologie en rapportage en visualisatie tools als Tableau en Kibana;
Je bent thuis in een online omgeving;
Goede technische kennis, zodat je makkelijk werkt met de software development teams;
Ambitie. Je zoekt altijd naar structurele, kwalitatieve verbeteringen van je BI organisatie;
Je bent iemand die graag samen met het team de mouwen opstroopt om interne klanten nog beter te voorzien van de juiste informatie. Track record in het koppelen van grote backoffice systemen (SAP) om tot geïntegreerde klantbeelden te komen.]

[Noord-HollandJob Summary

The Quality Test Engineer III is a position in Quality Assurance responsible for developing and executing performance and automation tests. This position plans and executes effective and efficient performance and automation testing to accomplish on-time and efficient delivery of high-quality software products and/or data.

Engineering Village offers access to 12 engineering literature and patent databases providing coverage from a wide range of trusted engineering sources. One of those DBs is Ei Compendex, the broadest and most complete engineering literature database available in the world. It provides a truly holistic and global view of peer reviewed and indexed publications with over 20 million records from 77 countries across 190 engineering disciplines. Every record is carefully selected and indexed using the Engineering Index Thesaurus to ensure discovery and retrieval of engineering-specific literature that engineering students and professionals can rely on. By using Ei Compendex, engineers can be confident information is relevant, complete, accurate and of high quality.

Engineering Village is a part of the Elsevier organization, the world’s leading provider of scientific, technical and medical information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization.
Experience and Education
3+ years of Quality Test Engineering experience.
BS Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent experience required.
Experience with Java and automated testing tools/technologies.
Experience working in agile development methodologies.
Responsibilities
Ensure that testing addresses requirements as agreed with all stakeholders.
Develop, write, and execute tests with a focus on automation to ensure deliverables meet business requirements.
Focus on identifying opportunities to apply automation to manual tests or existing regression tests.
Work across teams to enhance quality assurance/testing with a broad scope in mind for overall impacts.
Research available tools and lead or participate in initiatives to identify and implement those that will cost-effectively enhance testing capabilities and product quality.
Configure, maintain, and/or administer testing tools or environments.
Identify areas for cooperation with other teams to improve overall quality and implement initiatives to improve testing capability and efficiency.
Maintain awareness of the state of the industry and evaluate emerging trends/developments that may benefit the organization.
Maintain flexibility to react quickly to changes in priorities or circumstances to meet the needs of the business.
Report issues and results, researching and identifying root causes as appropriate, documenting accordingly.
Other duties as assigned.
Required Skills

Strong understanding of QA methodologies.
Strong knowledge of process improvement.
Strong knowledge of the Agile (Scrum, Kanban) software development process.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills.
Solid QA testing skills, including test development, execution, and management.
Strong attention to detail.
Automation test experience with Selenium Webdriver (preferred) or similar tools.
Experience with Java
Proven ability to develop and execute automated and performance testing.
Demonstrated ability to work in multi-team, multi-location environment (including onshore/offshore) where heavy collaboration and coordination of activities is critical.
Understanding of industry trends.
Strong research skills (tools/root cause analysis).
Experience with JIRA and Confluence desired.]
